block.text: "Dispela pasin I tambu long ol man i mekim long de Sabat, olsem na watpo yupela I mekim?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, answering them, said,

block.text: Na Jisas i bekim tok bilong ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Haven’t you read what David did when he was hungry, he, and those who were with him;

block.text: "Ating yupela i no bin ritim dispela stori long samting Devit i mekim? Mi tok long dispela taim em wantaim ol lain bilong en ol i hangre

ReferenceBlocks.text: how he entered into God’s house, and took and ate the show bread, and gave also to those who were with him, which is not lawful to eat except for the priests alone?”

block.text: na Devit i go insait long haus bilong God na kisim dispela bret ol i save putim i stap long pes bilong God. Dispela bret i tambu, na ol pris tasol inap long kaikai. Tasol Devit em i kaikai, na em i givim long ol lain bilong en tu. Yupela i no bin ritim dispela tok, a?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol moa olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Son of Man is lord of the Sabbath.”

block.text: "Pikinini Bilong Man em i bosim de Sabat."

ReferenceBlocks.text: It also happened on another Sabbath that he entered into the synagogue and taught. There was a man there, and his right hand was withered.

block.text: Long narapela de Sabat Jisas i go insait long haus lotu na i givim tok long ol manmeri. Na wanpela man i stap, han sut bilong en i dai pinis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The scribes and the Pharisees watched him, to see whether he would heal on the Sabbath, that they might find an accusation against him.

block.text: Ol saveman bilong lo na ol Farisi ol i was gut long Jisas, long wanem, ol i laik save, em bai i mekim orait ol sikman long de Sabat, o nogat. Ol i laik painim rot bilong kotim Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he knew their thoughts; and he said to the man who had the withered hand,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i save long tingting bilong ol. Olsem na em i tokim dispela man, han bilong en i nogut, olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rise up, and stand in the middle.”

block.text: "Yu kirap na sanap hia long ai bilong ol man."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He arose and stood.
Then Jesus said to them,

block.text: Orait dispela man i kirap na i sanap.
Na Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will ask you something: Is it lawful on the Sabbath to do good, or to do harm? To save a life, or to kill?”

block.text: "Mi laik askim yupela. Ating yumi ken mekim gutpela pasin long de Sabat, o yumi ken mekim pasin nogut? Ating yumi ken helpim ol man na mekim ol i stap gut, o yumi ken bagarapim ol man?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He looked around at them all, and said to the man,

block.text: Na Jisas i lukluk raun long olgeta man, na em i tokim dispela man olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Stretch out your hand.”

block.text: "Stretim han bilong yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He did, and his hand was restored as sound as the other.

block.text: Man i mekim olsem, na han bilong en i kamap gutpela gen.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they were filled with rage, and talked with one another, saying:

block.text: Tasol ol saveman bilong lo na ol Farisi i belhat nogut tru na ol I toktok namel long ol yet olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What can we do about Jesus?”

block.text: "Bai yumi mekim wanem long Jisas?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened in these days, that he went out to the mountain to pray, and he continued all night in prayer to God.

block.text: Long dispela taim Jisas i laik beten, na em i go antap long wanpela maunten na long nait em i beten long God. Long dispela nait olgeta em i beten i stap, inap tulait i bruk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When it was day, he called his disciples, and from them he chose twelve, whom he also named apostles:

block.text: San i kamap, na em i singautim ol disaipel bilong en i kam. Na em i makim 12 -pela, na em i givim nem aposel long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon, whom he also named Peter; Andrew, his brother; James; John; Philip; Bartholomew;

block.text: Wanpela em Saimon, na Jisas i givim nem Pita long em. Na em i makim tu Andru, em i brata bilong Saimon, na Jems na Jon na Filip na Bartolomyu

ReferenceBlocks.text: Matthew; Thomas; James, the son of Alphaeus; Simon, who was called the Zealot;

block.text: na Matyu na Tomas na Jems, em pikinini bilong Alfius, na Saimon, em wanpela man bilong lain Selot,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Judas the son of James; and Judas Iscariot, who also became a traitor.

block.text: na Judas, em pikinini bilong Jems, na Judas Iskariot, em dispela man bihain em i givim Jisas long ol man i birua long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came down with them, and stood on a level place, with a crowd of his disciples. A great number of the people from all Judea and Jerusalem and the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon came to hear him and to be healed of their diseases.

block.text: Orait Jisas wantaim ol disaipel bilong en i go daun long maunten, na em i go sanap long wanpela stretpela hap graun wantaim bikpela lain disaipel bilong en. Planti manmeri tru bilong olgeta hap bilong distrik Judia na taun Jerusalem na bilong nambis klostu long taun Tair na Saidon, ol tu i stap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who were troubled by unclean spirits came and were healed.

block.text: Ol i kam bilong harim tok bilong em, na bilong em i ken mekim orait ol sik bilong ol. Na ol manmeri i gat spirit nogut i bagarapim ol, Jisas i oraitim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the multitude sought to touch him, for power came out from him and healed them all.

block.text: Na olgeta manmeri ol i traim long putim han long em, long wanem, bikpela strong i stap long em, na dispela strong i save mekim orait olgeta man i putim han long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He lifted up his eyes to his disciples, and said,

block.text: Na Jisas i lukluk long ol disaipel bilong en, na em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Blessed are you who are poor, for yours is the Kingdom of God.

block.text: "Yupela ol rabisman, yupela i ken amamas. Kingdom bilong God em bilong yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed are you who hunger now, for you will be filled. Blessed are you who weep now, for you will laugh.

block.text: "Yupela ol lain i stap hangre nau, yupela i ken amamas. Bihain bai yupela i kaikai na i pulap. i lap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed are you when men shall hate you, and when they shall exclude and mock you, and throw out your name as evil, for the Son of Man’s sake.

block.text: "Bihain ol man bai i lukim yupela i bihainim Pikinini Bilong Man, na ol bai i bel nogut tru long yupela, na ol bai i rausim yupela na tok nogut long yupela, na ol bai i lukim nem bilong yupela olsem samting nogut tru. Orait taim dispela olgeta samting i kamap, yupela i ken amamas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Rejoice in that day, and leap for joy, for behold, your reward is great in heaven, for their fathers did the same thing to the prophets.”

block.text: Sapos ol i mekim ol dispela pasin long yupela, orait yupela i ken amamas na belgut tru. Harim. Bikpela pe i wetim yupela long heven. Bipo ol tumbuna bilong ol i save mekim wankain pasin long ol profet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But woe to you who are rich! For you have received your consolation.

block.text: "Tasol yupela ol maniman, yupela lukaut. Yupela i kisim pinis samting bilong mekim gut bel bilong yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Woe to you, you who are full now, for you will be hungry. Woe to you who laugh now, for you will mourn and weep.

block.text: "Yupela ol lain nau yupela i save kaikai na pulap, yupela lukaut. Bihain bai yupela i hangre. na wara bai i kapsait long ai bilong yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Woe, when men speak well of you, for their fathers did the same thing to the false prophets.”

block.text: Sapos olgeta man i litimapim nem bilong yupela, orait yupela lukaut. Bipo ol tumbuna bilong ol i save mekim wankain pasin long ol giaman profet."

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But I tell you who hear: love your enemies, do good to those who hate you;

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Mi tokim yupela ol man i save harim tok bilong mi, yupela i mas laikim ol birua bilong yupela, na yupela i mas mekim gutpela pasin long ol man i save bel nogut long yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: bless those who curse you, and pray for those who mistreat you.

block.text: Na sapos sampela man i tok long God i ken bagarapim yupela, yupela i mas askim God long mekim gut long ol. Na yupela i mas beten bai God i marimari long ol man i mekim nogut long yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: To him who strikes you on the cheek, offer also the other; and from him who takes away your cloak, don’t withhold your coat also.

block.text: Sapos wanpela man i solapim wanpela wasket bilong yu, orait yu mas tanim narapela wasket tu i go long em. Sapos wanpela man i pulim saket bilong yu, orait yu mas larim em i kisim siot bilong yu tu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Give to everyone who asks you, and don’t ask him who takes away your goods to give them back again.”

block.text: Olgeta man i askim yu long givim ol samting long ol, orait yu mas givim long ol. Na sapos wanpela man i kisim ol samting bilong yu, orait yu no ken tok strong long em i mas givim bek.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “As you would like people to do to you, do exactly so to them.

block.text: Olgeta pasin yupela i laik bai ol arapela manmeri i mas mekim long yupela, ol dispela pasin tasol yupela i mas mekim long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If you love those who love you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners love those who love them.

block.text: "Sapos yupela i laikim tasol ol man i save laikim yupela, orait husat bai i ting yupela ol gutpela manmeri? Ol man bilong mekim sin ol tu i save laikim ol man i laikim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If you do good to those who do good to you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners do the same.

block.text: Na sapos yupela i mekim gutpela pasin long ol man i mekim gutpela pasin long yupela, orait husat bai i ting yupela ol gutpela manmeri? Ol man bilong mekim sin ol tu i save mekim wankain pasin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If you lend to those from whom you hope to receive, what credit is that to you? Even sinners lend to sinners, to receive back as much.

block.text: Na sapos yupela i givim dinau long ol man yupela i ting ol bai inap bekim dinau, orait husat bai i ting yupela ol gutpela manmeri? Ol man bilong mekim sin ol tu i save givim dinau long ol arapela man bilong mekim sin, long wanem, ol i save ol dispela lain bai i bekim gen ol dinau bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, expecting nothing back; and your reward will be great, and you will be children of the Most High; for he is kind toward the unthankful and evil.

block.text: Tasol yupela i mas laikim ol birua bilong yupela. Yupela i mas mekim gutpela pasin long ol. Yupela i mas givim dinau long ol man, yupela i no ting ol bai inap bekim dinau gen long yupela. Yupela i mekim olsem, na bihain bai yupela i gat bikpela pe moa, na bai yupela i stap pikinini bilong God Antap Tru. Em i save mekim gutpela pasin tu long ol man i no save tenkyu long em na long ol man nogut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore be merciful, even as your Father is also merciful.

block.text: Yupela i mas sori long ol man, olsem Papa bilong yupela em i save sori long ol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don’t judge, and you won’t be judged. Don’t condemn, and you won’t be condemned. Set free, and you will be set free.”

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Yupela i no ken skelim pasin bilong ol arapela na tok ol i man nogut. Nogut God i mekim wankain pasin long yupela tu. Yupela i mas lusim sin bilong ol man, na bai God i lusim sin long yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Give, and it will be given to you: good measure, pressed down, shaken together, and running over, will be given to you. For with the same measure you measure it will be measured back to you.”

block.text: Yupela i mas givim ol samting long ol arapela, na bai God i givim ol samting long yupela. Em bai i skelim gutpela moa long yupela, na em bai i pulapim tru, na sakim i go daun, na pulapim moa yet, inap long ol samting i kapsait, na givim long yupela. Skel yupela i save givim long ol arapela man, long dispela skel tasol God bai i bekim long yupela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He spoke a parable to them.

block.text: Jisas i givim wanpela tok piksa tu long ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Can the blind guide the blind? Won’t they both fall into a pit?

block.text: "Ating wanpela aipas em inap long soim rot long narapela aipas? Nogat. Tupela wantaim bai i pundaun long hul.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A disciple is not above his teacher, but everyone when he is fully trained will be like his teacher.

block.text: Sumatin i no winim tisa bilong en. Tasol taim em i skul gut pinis, orait em bai i kamap wankain olsem tisa bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Why do you see the speck of chaff that is in your brother’s eye, but don’t consider the beam that is in your own eye?

block.text: "Bilong wanem yu lukim liklik hap pipia i stap long ai bilong brata bilong yu, tasol yu no tingim bikpela plang i stap long ai bilong yu yet?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or how can you tell your brother, ‘Brother, let me remove the speck of chaff that is in your eye,’ when you yourself don’t see the beam that is in your own eye? You hypocrite! First remove the beam from your own eye, and then you can see clearly to remove the speck of chaff that is in your brother’s eye.

block.text: Sapos yu no lukim bikpela plang i stap long ai bilong yu yet, orait olsem wanem na yu inap tokim brata bilong yu, 'Brata, mi laik kamautim pipia i stap long ai bilong yu'? Yu man bilong giaman, pastaim yu mas kamautim bikpela plang i stap long ai bilong yu yet. Na bihain bai yu inap lukluk gut na kamautim liklik hap pipia i stap long ai bilong brata bilong yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: For there is no good tree that brings forth rotten fruit; nor again a rotten tree that brings forth good fruit.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Gutpela diwai em i no save karim kaikai nogut. Olsem tasol diwai nogut em i no save karim gutpela kaikai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For each tree is known by its own fruit. For people don’t gather figs from thorns, nor do they gather grapes from a bramble bush.

block.text: Ol man i save lukim kaikai bilong diwai pastaim na ol i save, em i gutpela diwai, o em i nogut. Ol man i no save go long rop i gat nil bilong kisim pikinini bilong diwai fik. Na ol i no save kisim pikinini bilong wain long liklik rabis diwai i gat nil.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The good man out of the good treasure of his heart brings out that which is good, and the evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart brings out that which is evil, for out of the abundance of the heart, his mouth speaks.”

block.text: Gutpela man i gat planti gutpela tingting i stap long bel bilong en. Olsem na em i save mekim gutpela pasin. Man nogut em i gat planti tingting nogut i stap long bel bilong en. Olsem na em i save mekim pasin nogut. Kain tingting i pulap long bel, em maus i save autim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you call me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ and don’t do the things which I say?

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, " Bilong wanem yupela i save kolim mi Bikpela, Bikpela, na yupela i no bihanim tok bilong mi?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Everyone who comes to me, and hears my words, and does them, I will show you who he is like.

block.text: Sapos wanpela man i kam long mi, na i harim tok bilong mi na i bihainim, orait mi ken tokim yupela long pasin bilong dispela kain man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He is like a man building a house, who dug and went deep, and laid a foundation on the rock. When a flood arose, the stream broke against that house, and could not shake it, because it was founded on the rock.

block.text: Dispela man em i olsem wanpela man i laik wokim haus. Pastaim em i wokim hul i go daun, na em i putim simen i go pas tru long bikpela bikpela ston insait long graun. Na bihain em i sanapim haus antap long dispela. Na taim tait i kamap na wara i sakim dispela haus, haus i no pundaun, long wanem, dispela man i bin wokim gutpela strongpela haus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he who hears, and doesn’t do, is like a man who built a house on the earth without a foundation, against which the stream broke, and immediately it fell, and the ruin of that house was great.”

block.text: Tasol man i harim tok bilong mi na i no bihainim, em i olsem wanpela man i wokim haus i sanap nating long graun. Em i no putim simen pastaim insait long graun. Bihain wara i sakim dispela haus, na kwiktaim em i pundaun, na i bagarap olgeta."

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE 7
After he had finished speaking in the hearing of the people, he entered into Capernaum.

block.text: Jisas i autim tok pinis long ol manmeri, orait em i go insait long taun Kaperneam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A certain centurion’s servant, who was dear to him, was sick and at the point of death.

block.text: Wanpela kepten bilong 100 soldia em i stap, na em i gat wanpela wokboi. Em i laikim tumas dispela wokboi bilong en, tasol nau dispela wokboi i gat sik na klostu em i laik i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he heard about Jesus, he sent to him elders of the Jews, asking him to come and save his servant.

block.text: Kepten i harim tok long Jisas i stap, orait em i salim ol hetman bilong ol Juda i go long em bilong askim em long kam na mekim orait wokboi bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they came to Jesus, they begged him earnestly, saying,

block.text: Ol i kamap long Jisas na ol i tokim em strong tru olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He is worthy for you to do this for him,
for he loves our nation, and he built our synagogue for us.”

block.text: "Dispela kepten em i gutpela man, inap long yu ken helpim em.
Em i save laikim yumi Juda. Em yet i bin wokim haus lotu bilong mipela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus went with them. When he was now not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to him, saying to him,

block.text: Orait Jisas i go wantaim ol. Em i kamap klostu pinis long haus, na dispela kepten i salim ol pren i kam bringim tok long Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, don’t trouble yourself, for I am not worthy for you to come under my roof.

block.text: "Bikpela, maski yu hatwok tumas. Mi no gutpela man inap long yu kam insait long haus bilong mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore I didn’t even think myself worthy to come to you; but say the word, and my servant will be healed.

block.text: Olsem na mi ting mi no gutpela man inap long mi yet mi kam lukim yu. Tasol yu mekim tok tasol, na wokboi bilong mi bai i orait gen.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I also am a man placed under authority, having under myself soldiers. I tell this one, ‘Go!’ and he goes; and to another, ‘Come!’ and he comes; and to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”

block.text: Mi tok olsem, long wanem, mi tu mi stap aninit long man i gat namba bilong bosim mi. Na mi yet mi gat ol soldia i stap aninit long mi. Na sapos mi tokim wanpela, 'Yu go,' orait em i save go. Na sapos mi tokim narapela, 'Yu kam,' orait em i save kam. Na taim mi tokim wokboi bilong mi, 'Yu mekim dispela wok,' orait em i save mekim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus heard these things, he marveled at him, and turned and said to the multitude who followed him,

block.text: Jisas i harim dispela tok, na em i kirap nogut long tok bilong dispela man. Na em i tanim na i tokim dispela bikpela lain manmeri i bihainim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I tell you, I have not found such great faith, no, not in Israel.”

block.text: "Mi tokim yupela, long Israel yet mi no bin lukim wanpela man i gat kain bilip olsem bilong dispela man."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who were sent, returning to the house, found that the servant who had been sick was well.

block.text: Na ol dispela man kepten i bin salim ol i kam, ol i go bek long haus, na ol i lukim wokboi i orait pinis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened soon afterwards, that he went to a city called Nain. Many of his disciples, along with a great multitude, went with him.

block.text: Bihain liklik Jisas i go long wanpela taun, nem bilong en Nain. Ol disaipel bilong en wantaim bikpela lain manmeri ol i go wantaim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when he drew near to the gate of the city, behold, one who was dead was carried out, the only son of his mother, and she was a widow. Many people of the city were with her.

block.text: Em i kamap klostu long bikpela dua bilong banis i raunim dispela taun, na em i bungim sampela man i karim bodi bilong wanpela man i dai pinis i kam ausait long taun. Mama bilong dispela man i, em i gat dispela wanpela pikinini tasol. Na man bilong en tu i dai pinis. Na bikpela lain manmeri bilong dispela taun i wokabaut i kam wantaim dispela meri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her, and said to her,

block.text: Bikpela i lukim dispela meri, na em i sori tru long em, na em i tokim meri olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don’t cry.”

block.text: "Yu no ken krai."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came near and touched the coffin, and the bearers stood still. He said,

block.text: Na em I go klostu, na i putim han long bet ol i karim bodi long en. Na ol man I karim dispela bet ol i sanap. Na Jisas i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Young man, I tell you, arise!”

block.text: "Yangpela man, mi tokim yu, yu kirap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The young man who was dead sat up, and began to speak. And Jesus returned him to his mother saying:

block.text: Na dispela man i dai pinis, em i kirap na i sindaun, na em i stat long toktok. Na Jisas i givim em bek long mama bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Receive your son.”
Fear took hold of all, and they glorified God, saying,

block.text: Bel bilong olgeta manmeri i kirap long lukim bikpela strong bilong God, na ol i litimapim nem bilong God. Ol i tok,

block.characterId: crowd, large (witnessed healing of widow's son)

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: crowd, large (witnessed healing of widow's son)
ReferenceBlocks.text: “A great prophet has arisen among us!”

block.text: "Wanpela bikpela profet i kamap pinis namel long yumi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: and,

block.text: Na ol i tok,

block.characterId: crowd, large (witnessed healing of widow's son)

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: crowd, large (witnessed healing of widow's son)
ReferenceBlocks.text: “God has visited his people!”

block.text: "God i kam pinis bilong helpim ol manmeri bilong en."

ReferenceBlocks.text: This report went out concerning him in the whole of Judea, and in all the surrounding region.

block.text: Na ol manmeri i go nabaut long olgeta hap bilong distrik Judia na long ol arapela hap nabaut, na ol i stori long dispela samting Jisas i bin mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The disciples of John told him about all these things.

block.text: Ol disaipel bilong Jon i tokim em long olgeta dispela samting Jisas i mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: John, calling to himself two of his disciples, sent them to Jesus, saying,

block.text: Na Jon i singautim tupela disaipel bilong en, na em i salim tupela i go long Bikpela bilong askim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you the one who is coming, or should we look for another?”

block.text: "Ating yu dispela man God i bin promis long salim i kam, o mipela i mas wetim narapela?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the men had come to him, they said,

block.text: Dispela tupela man i kamap pinis long Jisas, na tupela i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “John the Baptizer has sent us to you, saying, ‘Are you he who comes, or should we look for another?’”

block.text: "Jon Bilong Baptais em i salim mitupela i kam long yu, na em i laik askim yu olsem, 'Ating yu dispela man God i bin promis long salim I kam, o mipela i mas wetim narapela?'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: In that hour he cured many of diseases and plagues and evil spirits; and to many who were blind he gave sight.
Jesus answered them,

block.text: Long dispela taim Jisas I wok long mekim orait planti manmeri i gat ol kain kain sik. Na em I rausim planti spirit nogut i stap long ol. Na planti aipas, em i mekim ol i lukluk.
Na Jisas i bekim tok bilong tupela disaipel bilong Jon olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go and tell John the things which you have seen and heard: that the blind receive their sight, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor have good news preached to them.

block.text: "Yutupela go tokim Jon long ol samting nau yutupela i lukim na harim. Ol aipas ol i lukluk gen, na ol lek nogut ol i wokabaut. Skin bilong ol man i gat sik lepra, em i kamap klin, na ol yaupas i harim toktok. Ol man i dai pinis, ol i kirap gen, na ol rabisman i harim gutnius.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed is he who finds no occasion for stumbling in me.”

block.text: Na ol man i lukim mi, na bilip bilong ol i no pundaun, ol i ken amamas."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When John’s messengers had departed, he began to tell the multitudes about John,

block.text: Taim dispela tupela man i bin bringim tok bilong Jon, tupela i go pinis, orait Jisas i tokim ol manmeri long Jon olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?

block.text: "Taim yupela i bin i go long hap i no gat man, yupela i go bilong lukim wanem samting? Ating yupela i go bilong lukim win i sakim wanpela pitpit? Nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But what did you go out to see? A man clothed in soft clothing? Behold, those who are gorgeously dressed, and live delicately, are in kings’ courts.

block.text: Yupela i go bilong lukim wanem samting? Ating yupela i go bilong lukim wanpela man i putim ol gutpela gutpela klos? Nogat. Ol man i putim ol naispela klos na i gat ol gutpela gutpela samting bilong bodi, ol dispela kain man i save stap long haus bilong ol king.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and much more than a prophet.

block.text: Tasol yupela i go bilong lukim wanem samting? Yupela i go bilong lukim wanpela profet, a? Em tasol. Na mi tokim yupela, dispela profet hia, em i winim olgeta arapela profet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is he of whom it is written, ‘Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.’”

block.text: Long dispela man tasol buk bilong God i tok olsem, 'Harim. Bai mi salim wanpela man bilong autim tok bilong mi, na em bai i go paslain long yu. Na em bai i redim rot bilong yu.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “For I tell you, among those who are born of women there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptizer, yet he who is least in the Kingdom of God is greater than he.”

block.text: Mi tokim yupela olsem, Jon i winim olgeta man i stap long graun. Tasol man i stap liklik tru long kingdom bilong God, em i winim Jon."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When all the people and the tax collectors heard this, they declared God to be just, having been baptized with John’s baptism.

block.text: Ol manmeri wantaim ol man bilong kisim takis ol i harim dispela tok pinis, na ol i tok, "Pasin bilong God em i stret olgeta." Ol i tok olsem, long wanem, ol i bin kisim baptais long han bilong Jon.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the Pharisees and the lawyers rejected the counsel of God, not being baptized by him themselves.

block.text: Tasol ol Farisi na ol saveman bilong lo ol i no bin kisim baptais long Jon. Olsem na ol i givim baksait long gutpela rot God i soim long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “To what then will I liken the people of this generation? What are they like?

block.text: Na Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Sapos mi laik tokaut long pasin bilong ol manmeri bilong dispela taim, bai mi mekim wanem kain tok piksa? Ol i olsem wanem kain man?

ReferenceBlocks.text: They are like children who sit in the marketplace, and call one to another, saying, ‘We piped to you, and you didn’t dance. We mourned, and you didn’t weep.’

block.text: Ol i olsem ol pikinini i sindaun i stap long ol ples bung na i singaut long ol arapela pikinini olsem, 'Mipela i winim mambu long yupela i ken singsing, tasol yupela i no laik singsing. Na mipela i mekim singsing sori, tasol yupela i no laik krai.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: For John the Baptizer came neither eating bread nor drinking wine, and you say, ‘He has a demon.’

block.text: "Jon Bilong Baptais em i kam, na em i no kaikai bret, na em i no save dring wain. Na yupela i tok, 'Spirit nogut i stap long em.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Son of Man has come eating and drinking, and you say, ‘Behold, a gluttonous man, and a drunkard; a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’

block.text: Na nau Pikinini Bilong Man i kam, na em i kaikai na i dring, na yupela i save tok, 'Lukim, em i man bilong kaikai planti tumas, na em i man bilong dring planti wain tumas. Em i pren bilong ol man bilong kisim takis na bilong ol man bilong mekim sin.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: Wisdom is justified by all her children.”

block.text: Yupela i save tok olsem, tasol ol manmeri i kisim save bilong God ol i soim yumi olsem save bilong en em i samting tru."

ReferenceBlocks.text: One of the Pharisees invited him to eat with him. He entered into the Pharisee’s house, and sat at the table.

block.text: Wanpela Farisi i singautim Jisas i kam kaikai wantaim em. Na Jisas i go long haus bilong dispela Farisi na i sindaun long kaikai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, a woman in the city who was a sinner, when she knew that he was reclining in the Pharisee’s house, she brought an alabaster jar of ointment.

block.text: Wanpela meri i save mekim ol kain kain pasin nogut em i stap long dispela taun. Em i harim tok long Jisas i kaikai long haus bilong dispela Farisi, olsem na dispela meri i kisim wanpela naispela botol ston i gat sanda na em i kam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Standing behind at his feet weeping, she began to wet his feet with her tears, and she wiped them with the hair of her head, kissed his feet, and anointed them with the ointment.

block.text: Na em i go sanap baksait long Jisas klostu long lek bilong en, na em i krai i stap. Wara bilong ai bilong en i kapsait long lek bilong Jisas, na dispela meri i mekim drai long gras bilong het bilong em yet. Em i givim planti kis long lek bilong Jisas, na em i kisim dispela sanda na welim lek bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when the Pharisee who had invited him saw it, he said to himself,

block.text: Dispela Farisi i bin singautim Jisas i kam, em i lukim ol samting dispela meri i mekim, na em i tingting olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man, if he were a prophet, would have perceived who and what kind of woman this is who touches him, that she is a sinner.”

block.text: "Sapos dispela man em i profet tru, bai em i save long dispela meri i putim han long em, na bai em i save long pasin bilong en tu. Dispela meri em i meri bilong mekim sin."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered him,

block.text: Jisas i save long tingting bilong dispela man na em i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Simon, I have something to tell you.”

block.text: "Saimon, mi gat wanpela tok mi laik givim yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Na Saimon i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell me teacher,”

block.text: "Tisa, yu autim tok bilong yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus replied:

block.text: Na Jisas i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A certain lender had two debtors. The one owed five hundred denarii, and the other fifty.

block.text: "Tupela man i gat dinau long wanpela man. Narapela i gat dinau long 100 kina, na narapela i gat dinau long 10 kina tasol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they couldn’t pay, he forgave them both. Which of them therefore will love him most?”

block.text: Tupela i no inap bekim dinau bilong tupela, olsem na dispela man i lusim dinau bilong tupela. Orait yu ting husat bilong tupela bai i laikim em moa?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon answered,

block.text: Na Saimon i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He, I suppose, to whom he forgave the most.”

block.text: "Mi ting dispela man em i lusim bikpela dinau bilong en."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You have judged correctly.”

block.text: "Tingting bilong yu I stret."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Turning to the woman, he said to Simon,

block.text: Na Jisas i tanim na lukim dispela meri, na em i tokim Saimon olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you see this woman? I entered into your house, and you gave me no water for my feet, but she has wet my feet with her tears, and wiped them with the hair of her head.

block.text: "Yu lukim dispela meri hia? Mi kam insait long haus bilong yu, na yu no givim mi wara bilong wasim lek bilong mi. Tasol dispela meri em i wasim lek bilong mi long wara bilong ai bilong em yet. Na em i mekim drai long gras bilong em yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You gave me no kiss, but she, since the time I came in, has not ceased to kiss my feet.

block.text: Yu no givim kis long mi. Tasol taim mi kam insait, na i kam inap long nau, dispela meri em i wok long givim kis long lek bilong mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You didn’t anoint my head with oil, but she has anointed my feet with ointment.

block.text: Yu no bin kisim wel na welim het bilong mi. Tasol dispela meri i kisim sanda i kam na i welim lek bilong mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore I tell you, her sins, which are many, are forgiven, for she loved much. But to whom little is forgiven, the same loves little.”

block.text: Olsem na mi tokim yu, yumi lukim dispela meri i laikim mi tru na yumi save, God i lusim pinis ol planti sin bilong en. Tasol man i mekim liklik sin tasol na God i lusim sin bilong en, orait laik bilong en bai i liklik tasol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to her,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim dispela meri olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Your sins are forgiven.”

block.text: "Mi lusim pinis ol sin bilong yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who sat at the table with him began to say to themselves,

block.text: Ol man I sindaun long tebol wantaim em, ol i harim dispela tok na ol i stat long toktok namel long ol yet olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who is this who even forgives sins?”

block.text: "Dispela man em i husat na em i lusim ol sin?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to the woman,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim dispela meri olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Your faith has saved you. Go in peace.”

block.text: "Bilip bilong yu i mekim na nau yu stap gut wantaim God. Yu go, na bel bilong yu i ken i stap isi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE 8
It happened soon afterwards, that he went about through cities and villages, preaching and bringing the good news of the Kingdom of God. With him were the twelve,

block.text: Bihain liklik orait Jisas i raun long ol taun na ol ples na em i wok long autim gutnius bilong kingdom bilong God long ol manmeri. Na ol 12 -pela disaipel i wokabaut i go wantaim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: and certain women who had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities: Mary who was called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out;

block.text: Na sampela meri, bipo Jisas i bin rausim ol spirit nogut long ol na mekim orait sik bilong ol, ol tu i wokabaut i go wantaim em. Wanpela em Maria, ol i kolim em Maria bilong taun Makdala. Bipo Jisas i bin rausim 7 -pela spirit nogut long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: and Joanna, the wife of Chuzas, Herod’s steward; Susanna; and many others; who served them from their possessions.

block.text: Na Joana na Susana na planti arapela meri tu, ol i go wantaim em. Joana em i meri bilong Kusa, em wanpela bosman bilong haus bilong Herot. Ol dispela meri i save givim ol samting bilong ol bilong helpim Jisas wantaim ol disaipel bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When a great multitude came together, and people from every city were coming to him, he spoke by a parable.

block.text: Ol manmeri bilong olgeta taun i kam long Jisas, na bikpela lain manmeri i bung i stap. Na em i givim wanpela tok piksa long ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The farmer went out to sow his seed. As he sowed, some fell along the road, and it was trampled under foot, and the birds of the sky devoured it.

block.text: "Wanpela man i go tromoi pikinini wit long gaden. Em i wok long tromoi i go, na sampela pikinini wit i pundaun long rot. Na ol man i krungutim, na ol pisin i kam kaikai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Other seed fell on the rock, and as soon as it grew, it withered away, because it had no moisture.

block.text: Na sampela pikinini wit i pundaun long hap graun i gat ston. Na wit i kamap, tasol graun i no gat wara, na dispela wit i drai olgeta na i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Other fell amid the thorns, and the thorns grew with it, and choked it.

block.text: Na sampela pikinini wit i pundaun namel long ol rop i gat nil. Na ol rop i gat nil i kamap wantaim na i karamapim wit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Other fell into the good ground, and grew, and brought forth fruit one hundred times.”

block.text: Na sampela pikinini wit i pundaun long gutpela graun, na wit i kamap, na i karim planti kaikai moa, olsem wan handet wan handet."

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he said these things, he called out,

block.text: Jisas i mekim dispela tok piksa pinis, na em i singaut olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He who has ears to hear, let him hear!”

block.text: "Man i gat yau em i mas harim dispela tok."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then his disciples asked him,

block.text: Ol disaipel bilong Jisas i askim em

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What does this parable mean?”

block.text: long as bilong dispela tok piksa em i bin autim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Na em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “To you it is given to know the mysteries of the Kingdom of God, but to the rest in parables; that ‘seeing they may not see, and hearing they may not understand.’

block.text: "God i larim yupela i save pinis long as bilong ol tok hait bilong kingdom bilong God. Tasol ol arapela manmeri i save harim ol tok piksa tasol. Olsem na bai ol i lukluk planti taim, tasol ol i no luksave long wanpela samting. Na bai ol i harim tok planti taim, tasol bai ol i no save long as bilong en."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.

block.text: Na Jisas i tok moa olsem, "As bilong dispela tok piksa em i olsem. Dispela ol pikinini wit ol i makim tok bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those along the road are those who hear, then the devil comes, and takes away the word from their heart, that they may not believe and be saved.

block.text: Ol pikinini wit i pundaun long rot, ol i olsem ol lain manmeri i harim tok bilong God, tasol bihain Satan i kam, na em i rausim dispela tok long bel bilong ol. Satan i ting, 'Nogut ol i bilip, na God i kisim bek ol.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those on the rock are they who, when they hear, receive the word with joy; but these have no root, who believe for a while, then fall away in time of temptation.

block.text: Na ol pikinini wit i pundaun long graun i gat ston, ol i olsem ol man i harim tok, na ol i kisim, na ol i amamas long en. Tasol ol i olsem pikinini wit i no gat rop i go daun insait long graun, olsem na ol i bilip long liklik taim tasol, na long taim bilong traim, ol i save surik na lusim God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: That which fell among the thorns, these are those who have heard, and as they go on their way they are choked with cares, riches, and pleasures of life, and bring no fruit to maturity.

block.text: Na ol pikinini wit i pundaun namel long ol rop i gat nil, ol i olsem ol man i harim tok bilong God, na ol i go nabaut na ol i tingting planti long ol samting i kamap long ol na long mani samting na ol i amamas long ol samting bilong dispela graun, na dispela ol samting i karamapim ol na ol i no bihainim gut tok bilong God. Ol i olsem kaikai i no mau gut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: That in the good ground, these are such as in an honest and good heart, having heard the word, hold it tightly, and bring forth fruit with patience.”

block.text: Tasol ol dispela pikinini wit i pundaun long gutpela graun, ol i olsem ol man i harim tok na ol i holimpas. Bel bilong ol em i stretpela na i gutpela, na ol i save stap strong na ol i karim kaikai i stap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: “No one, when he has lit a lamp, covers it with a container, or puts it under a bed; but puts it on a stand, that those who enter in may see the light.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Ol man i no save laitim lam na karamapim long sospen samting o putim aninit long bet. Nogat. Ol i save putim antap long tebol, bai ol man i kam insait long haus ol i ken lukim dispela lait.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For nothing is hidden, that will not be revealed; nor anything secret, that will not be known and come to light.

block.text: Olgeta samting i stap hait, bihain bai em i kamap long ples klia. Na olgeta samting ol man i karamapim i stap, bihain bai ol i kamap long ples klia, na bai ol man i save long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Be careful therefore how you hear. For whoever has, to him will be given; and whoever doesn’t have, from him will be taken away even that which he thinks he has.”

block.text: "Yupela i mas lukaut gut bai yupela i harim gut tok. Sapos wanpela man i gat sampela samting pinis, orait God bai i givim sampela moa long em. Tasol sapos man i no gat ol samting, orait God bai i tekewe ol samting em i ting em i holim pinis."

ReferenceBlocks.text: His mother and brothers came to him, and they could not come near him for the crowd.

block.text: Long dispela taim mama wantaim ol brata bilong Jisas ol i kam bilong lukim em. Tasol planti manmeri ol i bung i stap, na ol lain bilong Jisas i no inap i kam klostu long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It was told him by some saying,

block.text: Sampela man i tokim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Your mother and your brothers stand outside, desiring to see you.”

block.text: "Mama bilong yu wantaim ol brata bilong yu ol i sanap ausait, na ol i laik lukim yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered them,

block.text: Tasol em i bekim tok bilong ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “My mother and my brothers are these who hear the word of God, and do it.”

block.text: "Ol manmeri i harim tok bilong God na i bihainim, ol dispela lain ol i mama bilong mi na brata bilong mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now it happened on one of those days, that he entered into a boat, himself and his disciples, and he said to them,

block.text: Wanpela de Jisas i kalap long wanpela bot wantaim ol disaipel bilong en. Na em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let’s go over to the other side of the lake.”

block.text: "Yumi go long hapsait bilong raunwara."

ReferenceBlocks.text: So they launched out.
But as they sailed, he fell asleep. A wind storm came down on the lake, and they were taking on dangerous amounts of water.

block.text: Olsem na ol i go.
Bot i ran i go, na Jisas i slip. Na wanpela bikpela win i kamap long raunwara, na wara i laik pulap long bot na klostu ol i laik lus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came to him, and awoke him, saying,

block.text: Na ol i go kirapim Jisas, na ol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Master, master, we are dying!”

block.text: "Bikman, bikman, yumi laik lus nau."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He awoke, and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water, and they ceased, and it was calm.
He said to them,

block.text: Na em i kirap na i krosim dispela win na dispela biksi. Na win wantaim biksi i dai, na wara i no moa mekim nais.
Na em i askim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where is your faith?”

block.text: "Olsem wanem? Bilip bilong yupela i stap we?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Being afraid they marveled, saying one to another,

block.text: Ol i lukim dispela strongpela wok na ol i pret, na ol i tingting planti. Na ol i toktok namel long ol yet olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who is this, then, that he commands even the winds and the water, and they obey him?”

block.text: "Dispela man em i husat tru? Em i tok strong long win wantaim wara, na tupela i harim tok bilong em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They arrived at the country of the Gadarenes, which is opposite Galilee.

block.text: Orait Jisas wantaim ol disaipel bilong en i go kamap long hap bilong ol Gerasa. Dispela ples i stap long hapsait bilong raunwara Galili.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus stepped ashore, a certain man out of the city who had demons for a long time met him. He wore no clothes, and didn’t live in a house, but in the tombs.

block.text: Orait Jisas i lusim bot na i go sua, na wanpela man bilong dispela taun i kamap long em. Sampela spirit nogut i stap long dispela man. Longtaim tru em i no save pasim laplap. Na em i no save stap long wanpela haus. Nogat. Em i save stap nabaut long ples matmat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he saw Jesus, he cried out, and fell down before him, and with a loud voice said,

block.text: Dispela man i lukim Jisas, na em i singaut na i pundaun long graun klostu long lek bilong Jisas. Na em i singaut bikmaus tru olsem,

block.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons
ReferenceBlocks.text: “What do I have to do with you, Jesus, you Son of the Most High God? I beg you, don’t torment me!”

block.text: "Jisas, yu Pikinini bilong God Antap Tru, yu laik mekim wanem long mi? Plis, yu no ken mekim nogut long mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: For Jesus was commanding the unclean spirit to come out of the man. For the unclean spirit had often seized the man. He was kept under guard, and bound with chains and fetters. Breaking the bands apart, he was driven by the demon into the desert.
Jesus asked him,

block.text: Em i singaut olsem, long wanem, Jisas i tok pinis long spirit nogut i mas lusim dispela man. Ol man i save was long dispela man oltaim, na ol i save pasim em long ol sen na hankap. Tasol em i save brukim olgeta sen samting. Na dispela spirit nogut i save mekim em i ran i go long hap i no gat man.
Orait Jisas i askim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What is your name?”

block.text: "Wanem nem bilong yu?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Na em i tok,

block.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Legion,”

block.text: "Nem bilong mi Ami,"

ReferenceBlocks.text: for many demons had entered into him.
They begged him, saying:

block.text: long wanem, planti spirit nogut i bin i go insait long em.
Na ol dispela spirit nogut i singaut strong long Jisas olsem,

block.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do not send us into the abyss!”

block.text: "Yu no ken rausim mipela i go long dispela hul i no gat as."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now there was there a herd of many pigs feeding on the mountain. The Demons begged Jesus, saying:

block.text: Wanpela bikpela lain pik ol i kaikai i stap long liklik maunten klostu. Na ol spirit nogut i askim Jisas strong olsem,

block.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Allow us to enter into the pigs!”

block.text: "Yu mas larim mipela i go insait long ol dispela pik."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He allowed them.

block.text: Orait Jisas i larim ol i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The demons came out
from the man, and entered into the pigs, and the herd rushed
down the steep bank into the lake,
and were drowned.

block.text: Na ol dispela spirit nogut i lusim
dispela man na ol i go insait long ol pik. Na ol dispela lain pik i ran
strong tru i go daun long wanpela ples nogut. Na ol i pundaun long raunwara,
na ol i dring wara na i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When those who fed them saw what had happened, they fled, and told it in the city and in the country.

block.text: Ol wasman bilong pik i lukim dispela samting i kamap, orait ol i ranawe, na ol bringim tok i go long taun na long ol hap nabaut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: People went out to see what had happened. They came to Jesus, and found the man from whom the demons had gone out, sitting at Jesus’ feet, clothed and in his right mind; and they were afraid.

block.text: Na ol manmeri i kam lukim wanem samting tru i bin kamap. Ol i kamap long Jisas, na ol i lukim dispela man ol spirit nogut i lusim em pinis. Em i pasim laplap, na tingting bilong en i klia, na em i sindaun i stap klostu long lek bilong Jisas. Ol manmeri i lukim, na ol i pret.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who saw it told them how he who had been possessed by demons was healed.

block.text: Na ol man i bin lukim ol samting i kamap, ol i stori long ol samting Jisas i bin mekim long dispela man, bipo ol spirit nogut i stap long en, na nau em i kamap orait pinis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the people of the surrounding country of the Gadarenes asked him to depart from them, for they were very much afraid. He entered into the boat, and returned.

block.text: Na olgeta man bilong distrik bilong ol Gerasa, ol i tingting long dispela strongpela wok Jisas i bin mekim na ol i pret tru na ol i tok strong long Jisas i mas lusim ol na i go. Olsem na Jisas i kalap long bot, na em i go bek.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the man from whom the demons had gone out begged him that he might go with him, but Jesus sent him away, saying,

block.text: Tasol pastaim dispela man ol spirit nogut i lusim em pinis, em i askim Jisas strong olsem, "Inap yu larim mi i go wantaim yu?" Tasol Jisas i salim em i go bek, na i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Return to your house, and declare what great things God has done for you.”

block.text: "Yu go bek long ples bilong yu, na yu autim tok long olgeta samting God i bin mekim bilong helpim yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went his way, proclaiming throughout the whole city what great things Jesus had done for him.

block.text: Olsem na dispela man i go, na em i autim tok long olgeta manmeri long taun bilong en, long olgeta samting Jisas i bin mekim bilong helpim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, when Jesus returned, that the multitude welcomed him, for they were all waiting for him.

block.text: Orait Jisas i go bek long hapsait bilong raunwara, na olgeta manmeri i amamas long em i kam, long wanem, ol i bin wetim em i stap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A ruler of the Synagogue named Jairus came and fell at Jesus’s feet, and begged him, saying:

block.text: Na wanpela man i kamap, nem bilong en Jairus. Em i wanpela hetman bilong haus lotu. Em i brukim skru klostu long lek bilong Jisas, na i askim Jisas strong long

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come to my house!”

block.text: i go long haus bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: for he had an only daughter about twelve years of age, and she was dying. But as he went, the multitudes pressed against him.

block.text: Em i gat wanpela pikinini tasol, em i pikinini meri, na em i gat samting olsem 12 -pela krismas. Na klostu em i laik i dai. wantaim na ol i pas tru long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A woman was there who had a flow of blood for twelve years. She had spent all her living on physicians, and could not be healed by any.

block.text: Na wanpela meri i stap, em i save karim blut oltaim na i stap olsem inap long 12 -pela yia. Tasol i no gat wanpela man inap long oraitim sik bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: She came up behind him and touched the fringe of his cloak. Immediately the flow of her blood stopped.
Jesus said,

block.text: Dispela meri i kam klostu long baksait bilong Jisas, na i putim han long arere bilong longpela klos bilong Jisas. Em i mekim olsem, na wantu tasol blut bilong en i drai na i no kamap moa.
Na Jisas i askim olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who touched me?”

block.text: "Husat i putim han long mi?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They all denied it saying:

block.text: Na olgeta i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Not I!”

block.text: "Mi nogat. Mi nogat."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter said:

block.text: Na Pita i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Master, the multitudes press and jostle you, and you say, ‘Who touched me?’”

block.text: "Bikman, bikpela lain manmeri i sanap raunim yu, na ol i pas tru long yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus said,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Someone did touch me, for I perceived that power has gone out of me.”

block.text: "Wanpela i bin putim han long mi. Mi pilim sampela strong i lusim mi na i go."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the woman saw that she was not hidden, she came trembling, and fell down before him. She declared to him in the presence of all the people the reason why she had touched him, and how she was healed immediately.
He said to her,

block.text: Dispela meri i save nau, em i no inap hait. Olsem na em i guria, na em i kam brukim skru na putim pes i go daun long graun klostu long Jisas. Na long ai bilong olgeta manmeri em i tok bilong wanem em i bin putim han long Jisas. Na em i tok, "Sik bilong mi em i pinis wantu tasol."
Na Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Daughter, cheer up. Your faith has made you well. Go in peace.”

block.text: "Pikinini, yu bilip long mi, olsem na yu kamap orait gen. Yu go, na bel bilong yu i ken i stap isi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: While he still spoke, one from the ruler of the synagogue’s house came, saying to him,

block.text: Jisas i toktok yet i stap, na wanpela man bilong haus bilong dispela hetman bilong haus lotu i kam. Em i tokim hetman olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Your daughter is dead. Don’t trouble the Teacher.”

block.text: "Pikinini bilong yu i dai pinis. Maski givim hevi moa long tisa."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus hearing it, answered him,

block.text: Jisas i harim dispela, na i bekim tok olsem long hetman,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don’t be afraid. Only believe, and she will be healed.”

block.text: "Yu no ken pret. Yu mas bilip tasol, na pikinini bilong yu bai i orait."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he came to the house, he didn’t allow anyone to enter in, except Peter, John, James, the father of the child, and her mother.

block.text: Orait Jisas i go long haus bilong hetman, na em i no larim ol manmeri i go insait long haus wantaim em. Nogat. Em i kisim Pita na Jon na Jems na papamama bilong dispela pikinini, na ol tasol i go insait wantaim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All were weeping and mourning her but he said,

block.text: Na olgeta manmeri i stap pinis long haus, ol i sori tru long dispela pikinini, na ol i wok long krai i stap. Tasol Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don’t weep. She isn’t dead, but sleeping.”

block.text: "Yupela i no ken krai. Em i no i dai. Em i slip tasol i stap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were ridiculing
him, knowing that she was dead.

block.text: Na ol i lap nogut long
em, long wanem, ol i save, pikinini i dai pinis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he put them all outside, and taking her by the hand, he called, saying,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i holim han bilong pikinini meri na i singaut olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Child, arise!”

block.text: "Pikinini, yu kirap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Her spirit returned and she rose up immediately. Jesus told them:

block.text: Orait spirit bilong dispela pikinini em i kam bek long em, na kwiktaim em i kirap. Na Jisas i tokim ol long

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Give her something to eat.”

block.text: givim sampela kaikai long dispela pikinini.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Her parents were amazed, but he commanded them, saying:

block.text: Na papamama bilong pikinini i kirap nogut tru. Tasol Jisas i tokim tupela strong olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell no one what has been done.”

block.text: "Yutupela i no ken tokim wanpela man long dispela samting i bin kamap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE 9
He called the twelve together, and gave them power and authority over all demons, and to cure diseases.

block.text: Jisas i singautim ol 12 -pela aposel i kam, na em i givim bikpela strong na namba long ol, bilong ol i ken rausim olgeta spirit nogut i stap long ol manmeri na ol i ken mekim orait ol manmeri i gat olgeta kain sik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent them forth to preach the Kingdom of God, and to heal the sick.
He said to them,

block.text: Na em i salim ol i go bilong autim tok bilong kingdom bilong God, na bilong mekim orait ol sikman.
Na em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Take nothing for your journey--neither staffs, nor wallet, nor bread, nor money; neither have two coats apiece.

block.text: "Yupela i no ken kisim ol samting bilong wokabaut i go wantaim yupela. Yupela i no ken holim stik bilong wokabaut na yupela i no ken karim hanbek samting na bret na mani. Na yupela i no ken kisim tupela siot.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Into whatever house you enter, stay there, and depart from there.

block.text: Na sapos yupela i kamap long wanpela ples na yupela i go insait long wanpela haus, orait yupela i mas i stap long dispela haus tasol inap long taim yupela i laik lusim dispela ples na i go long narapela hap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As many as don’t receive you, when you depart from that city, shake off even the dust from your feet for a testimony against them.”

block.text: Na sapos ol manmeri bilong wanpela taun i no kisim yupela i go long haus bilong ol, orait yupela i mas lusim dispela taun. Na taim yupela i laik i go, yupela i mas rausim pipia graun i stap long lek bilong yupela, bai ol i ken save, ol i gat asua long dispela pasin ol i mekim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They departed, and went throughout the villages, preaching the Good News, and healing everywhere.

block.text: Orait ol disaipel i wokabaut i go long ol ples nabaut. Na ol i autim gutnius na ol i mekim orait ol sikman long olgeta hap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was done by him; and he was very perplexed, because some said:

block.text: Namba wan gavman Herot i harim tok long ol samting Jisas i mekim, na em i tingting planti, long wanem, sampela man i save tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “John had risen from the dead!”

block.text: "Jon i kirap bek long matmat."

ReferenceBlocks.text: and others said,

block.text: Na sampela i save tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Elijah has appeared,”

block.text: "Elaija i kamap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: and still others said,

block.text: Na sampela i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “One of the old prophets had risen again.”

block.text: "Wanpela bilong ol profet bilong bipo em i kirap bek long matmat."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Herod said,

block.text: Olsem na Herot i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “John I beheaded, so who is this about whom I hear such things?”

block.text: "Mi katim nek bilong Jon pinis. Tasol dispela man em i husat tru na mi harim ol man i tok long ol narakain wok em i mekim?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sought to see him.

block.text: Na em i laik lukim Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The apostles, when they had returned, told him what things they had done. He took them, and withdrew apart to a deserted place of a city called Bethsaida.

block.text: Ol aposel i kam bek pinis, na ol i tokim Jisas long olgeta samting ol i bin mekim. Na Jisas i kisim ol, na ol i lusim ol arapela manmeri, na ol tasol i go long wanpela taun, nem bilong en Betsaida.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the multitudes, perceiving it, followed him. He welcomed them, and spoke to them of the Kingdom of God, and he cured those who needed healing.

block.text: Taim ol planti lain manmeri i save olsem Jisas i go pinis, orait ol i bihainim em i go. Ol i kam long em, na em i amamas long ol i kam. Em i autim tok bilong kingdom bilong God long ol, na em i mekim orait ol manmeri i gat sik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Late in the day the twelve came and said to him,

block.text: Long apinun tru ol 12 -pela disaipel i kam long em na ol i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Send the multitude away, that they may go into the surrounding villages and farms, and lodge, and get food, for we are here in a deserted place.”

block.text: "Mobeta yu salim ol manmeri i go long ol ples na long ol hap nabaut, bai ol i ken painim kaikai na ples bilong slip. Dispela hap yumi stap long en, em i no gat man."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said to them,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i tokim ol disaipel olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You give them something to eat.”

block.text: "Yupela yet givim kaikai long ol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Na ol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We have no more than five loaves and two fish, unless we should go and buy food for all these people.”

block.text: "Mipela i no gat planti kaikai. I gat 5 -pela bret na tupela pis tasol i stap. Ating yu laik bai mipela i go baim kaikai bilong dispela olgeta lain manmeri?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: For they were about five thousand men. He said to his disciples,

block.text: Samting olsem 5,000 man i stap. Na Jisas i tokim ol disaipel bilong en olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Make them sit down in groups of about fifty each.”

block.text: "Yupela tokim ol, ol i mas bung 50 50 na ol i mas sindaun. "

ReferenceBlocks.text: They did so, and made them all sit down.

block.text: Ol disaipel i mekim olsem, na olgeta manmeri i sindaun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to the sky, he blessed them, and broke them, and gave them to the disciples to set before the multitude.

block.text: Orait na Jisas i kisim dispela 5 -pela bret wantaim tupela pis, na em i lukluk i go long heven na i tenkyu long God. Na em i brukim bret wantaim pis na i givim long ol disaipel, na ol i tilim i go long ol manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They ate, and were all filled. They gathered up twelve baskets of broken pieces that were left over.

block.text: Na olgeta i kaikai, na ol i pulap. Na ol i bungim olgeta hap kaikai i stap yet na ol i pulapim 12 -pela basket.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, as he was praying alone, that the disciples were with him, and he asked them,

block.text: Long wanpela taim Jisas wanpela em i beten i stap, na ol disaipel bilong en i stap wantaim em. Na em i askim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who do the multitudes say that I am?”

block.text: "Ol manmeri i save tok, mi husat tru?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They answered,

block.text: Na ol i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “‘John the Baptizer,’ but others say, ‘Elijah,’ and others, that one of the old prophets is risen again.”

block.text: "Sampela i save tok olsem, yu Jon Bilong Baptais. Na sampela i save tok, yu Elaija. Na sampela i tok, 'Wanpela bilong ol profet bilong bipo em i kirap bek.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Na em i askim ol,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But who do you say that I am?”

block.text: "Na yupela yet i tok mi husat?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter answered,

block.text: Na Pita i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Christ of God.”

block.text: "Yu dispela man God i bin promis long salim i kam bilong kisim bek ol manmeri bilong en."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus commanded them, saying:

block.text: Orait Jisas i tok strong long ol disaipel na i tambuim ol long ol i

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell this to no one!”

block.text: no ken tokim wanpela man long em i husat tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said:

block.text: Na em i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Son of Man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders, chief priests, and scribes, and be killed, and the third day be raised up.”

block.text: "Pikinini Bilong Man em i mas karim planti pen, na ol hetman na ol bikpris na ol saveman bilong lo bai ol i givim baksait long em na kilim em i dai. Na long de namba 3 bai em i kirap bek."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to all,

block.text: Na em i tokim olgeta disaipel olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If anyone desires to come after me, let him deny himself, take up his cross, and follow me.

block.text: "Sapos wanpela man i laik bihainim mi, orait em i mas daunim laik bilong em yet, na em i mas karim diwai kros bilong en long olgeta de, na em i mas bihainim mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever desires to save his life will lose it, but whoever will lose his life for my sake, the same will save it.

block.text: Long wanem, sapos wanpela man i laik holimpas laip bilong em yet, laip bilong en bai i lus. Tasol sapos wanpela man i ting long mi na i lusim laip bilong en, orait laip bilong en bai i stap gut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For what does it profit a man if he gains the whole world, and loses or forfeits his own self?

block.text: Sapos wanpela man i kisim olgeta samting bilong graun, tasol em yet i bagarap na i lus, orait dispela olgeta samting bai i helpim em olsem wanem?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever will be ashamed of me and of my words, of him will the Son of Man be ashamed, when he comes in his glory, and the glory of the Father, and of the holy angels.

block.text: Sapos wanpela man i sem long mi na long tok bilong mi, orait bihain, taim Pikinini Bilong Man i stap long bikpela lait bilong em yet na bilong Papa bilong en na bilong ol ensel bilong God, na em i kam, em bai i sem long dispela man tu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I tell you the truth: There are some of those who stand here, who will in no way taste of death, until they see the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: Mi tok tru long yupela, sampela man i sanap hia bai ol i no i dai yet, na bai ol i lukim kingdom bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened about eight days after these sayings, that he took with him Peter, John, and James, and went up onto the mountain to pray.

block.text: Samting olsem 8 -pela de bihain long Jisas i mekim ol dispela tok, em i kisim Pita na Jon na Jems, na em i go antap long maunten, long wanem, em i laik beten.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he was praying, the appearance of his face was altered, and his clothing became white and dazzling.

block.text: Em i beten i stap, na pes bilong en i kamap narakain, na klos bilong en i kamap waitpela tru, na i lait moa yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, two men, Moses and Elijah,
appeared in glorious splendor, and spoke with Jesus of his departure, which he was about to accomplish at Jerusalem.

block.text: Na tupela man i toktok wantaim em i stap, em Moses na Elaija.
Tupela i kamap wantaim lait bilong God, na tupela i toktok long ol samting Jisas bai i mekim long Jerusalem, na em bai i lusim dispela graun na i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Peter and those who were with him were heavy with sleep, but when they were fully awake, they saw his glory, and the two men who stood with him.

block.text: Ai bilong Pita wantaim tupela arapela disaipel i hevi na ol i slip. Na taim ol i kirap gen, ol i lukim lait i kamap long Jisas na long dispela tupela man i sanap wantaim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, as they were parting from him, that Peter said to Jesus,

block.text: Na taim tupela i laik lusim Jisas na i go, orait Pita i tokim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Master, it is good for us to be here. Let’s make three tents: one for you, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah,”

block.text: "Tisa, yumi stap hia, em i gutpela. Mipela i ken wokim tripela haus win, wanpela bilong yu, na wanpela bilong Moses, na wanpela bilong Elaija."

ReferenceBlocks.text: not knowing what he said.
While he said these things, a cloud came and overshadowed them, and they were afraid as they entered into the cloud.

block.text: Pita i mekim dispela tok, tasol em yet i no save long wanem kain tok em i mekim.
Pita i mekim dispela tok yet, na wanpela klaut i kamap na i karamapim ol na ol i pret.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A voice came out of the cloud, saying,

block.text: Na wanpela maus insait long dispela klaut i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is my beloved Son. Listen to him!”

block.text: "Dispela em i Pikinini bilong mi. Mi makim em pinis bilong mekim wok bilong mi. Yupela harim tok bilong em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the voice came, Jesus was found alone. They were silent, and told no one in those days any of the things which they had seen.

block.text: Dispela maus i tok pinis, na ol i lukim Jisas wanpela tasol i stap. Na taim ol i kam daun gen long maunten, ol disaipel i no tokim wanpela man long dispela samting ol i bin lukim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened on the next day, when they had come down from the mountain, that a great multitude met him.

block.text: Long de bihain Jisas wantaim ol disaipel i lusim maunten na i go daun, na bikpela lain manmeri i kam bungim Jisas long rot.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, a man from the crowd cried out, saying,

block.text: Na wanpela man namel long ol i singaut olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, I beg you to look at my son, for he is my only child.

block.text: "Bikman, mi askim yu strong bai yu ken lukim pikinini man bilong mi. Mi gat dispela wanpela pikinini tasol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, a spirit takes him, he suddenly cries out, and it convulses him so that he foams, and it hardly departs from him, bruising him severely.

block.text: Planti taim wanpela spirit nogut i save go insait long em, na wantu em i save singaut nogut. Na dispela spirit nogut i save mekim em i guria nogut tru, na waitpela spet i save kamap long maus bilong em. Dispela spirit nogut i save bagarapim tru bodi bilong em, na i no laik lusim em hariap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I begged your disciples to cast it out, and they couldn’t.”

block.text: Na mi bin askim strong ol disaipel bilong yu long rausim dispela spirit nogut. Tasol ol i no inap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered,

block.text: Na Jisas i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you and bear with you? Bring your son here.”

block.text: "Yupela lain manmeri i no bilip, tingting na pasin bilong yupela i no stret tru. Hamas taim bai mi stap yet wantaim yupela na karim hevi bilong yupela? Kisim pikinini bilong yu na bringim i kam."

ReferenceBlocks.text: While he was still coming, the demon threw him down and convulsed him violently. But Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, and healed the boy, and gave him back to his father.

block.text: Na taim pikinini i wokabaut i kam klostu long Jisas, dispela spirit nogut i tromoi em i go daun na i mekim em i guria nogut tru. Tasol Jisas i krosim dispela spirit nogut, na i mekim orait pikinini na i givim em bek long papa bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were all astonished and said:

block.text: Na olgeta manmeri i

block.characterId: everyone who witnessed healing of boy

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: everyone who witnessed healing of boy
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold the majesty of God!”

block.text: lukim bikpela strong bilong God,

ReferenceBlocks.text: But while all were marveling at all the things that Jesus did, he said to his disciples,

block.text: na ol i kirap nogut tru. i mekim, na Jisas i tokim ol disaipel bilong en olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let these words sink into your ears, for the Son of Man will be delivered up into the hands of men.”

block.text: "Yupela i mas putim yau gut long dispela tok. Ol bai i putim Pikinini Bilong Man long han bilong ol man."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they didn’t understand this saying. It was concealed from them, that they should not perceive it, and they were afraid to ask him about this saying.

block.text: Tasol ol disaipel i no save long as bilong dispela tok. As bilong dispela tok em i hait long ol, olsem na ol i no save gut long en. Na ol i pret long askim em long tokim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There arose an argument among them about which of them was the greatest.

block.text: Wanpela taim ol disaipel i tok pait long husat em i namba wan bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, perceiving the reasoning of their hearts, took a little child, and set him by his side,
and said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i save long dispela tingting i stap long bel bilong ol. Olsem na em i kisim wanpela liklik pikinini i kam na i sanapim em klostu long em.
Na em i tokim ol disaipel olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whoever receives this little child in my name receives me. Whoever receives me receives him who sent me. For whoever is least among you all, this one will be great.”

block.text: "Man i tingting long mi na i helpim dispela liklik pikinini, em i helpim mi. Na man i helpim mi, em i helpim Papa, em i bin salim mi na mi kam. Long wanem, man i no gat nem na i stap liklik tru namel long yupela olgeta, em i stap namba wan."

ReferenceBlocks.text: John answered,

block.text: Jon i harim tok bilong Jisas na em i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Master, we saw someone casting out demons in your name, and we forbade him, because he doesn’t follow with us.”

block.text: "Bikman, mipela i lukim wanpela em i wok long rausim ol spirit nogut long nem bilong yu. Tasol em i no bihainim yumi. Olsem na mipela i tambuim em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don’t forbid him, for he who is not against us is for us.”

block.text: "Yupela i no ken tambuim em. Man i no birua long yupela, em i pren bilong yupela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: It came to pass, when the days were near that he should be taken up, he resolutely set out for Jerusalem.

block.text: Taim bilong God i laik kisim Jisas i go long heven em i klostu pinis. Olsem na Jisas i pasim tingting strong long em i mas i go long Jerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent messengers on ahead who went into a Samaritan village to get things ready for him.

block.text: Na em i salim ol man i go pas bilong redim ol samting, na ol i go insait long wanpela ples bilong ol Samaria, na ol i laik redim ol samting bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They didn’t receive him because he was heading for Jerusalem.

block.text: Tasol ol man bilong dispela ples i no laik kisim Jisas i go long haus bilong ol, long wanem, ol i save, em i laik i go long Jerusalem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When his disciples, James and John, saw this, they said,

block.text: Tupela disaipel, Jems na Jon, i lukim dispela pasin bilong ol Samaria, na tupela i askim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, do you want us to command fire to come down from the sky, and destroy them, just as Elijah did?”

block.text: "Bikpela, yu laik bai mipela i singautim paia i kam daun long heven na i kukim ol dispela man?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he turned and rebuked them,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i tanim na i krosim tupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You don’t know of what kind of spirit you are.
For the Son of Man didn’t come to destroy men’s lives, but to save them.”

block.text: Long Aisak tasol bai ol lain tumbuna pikinini bilong yu i kamap.
For the Son of Man didn't come to destroy men's lives, but to save them.”

ReferenceBlocks.text: They went to another village.
As they went on the way, a certain man said to him,

block.text: Na ol i wokabaut i go long narapela ples.
Jisas wantaim ol disaipel i wokabaut i go long rot, na wanpela man i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I want to follow you wherever you go, Lord.”

block.text: "Olgeta ples yu go long en, bai mi bihainim yu i go wantaim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The foxes have holes, and the birds of the sky have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head.”

block.text: "Ol weldok i gat hul long graun, na ol pisin i gat haus bilong ol. Tasol Pikinini Bilong Man em i no gat ples bilong slip."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to another,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim narapela man olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Follow me!”

block.text: "Yu kam bihainim mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said,

block.text: Tasol dispela man i tok,

block.characterId: disciple who wanted to bury his father

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: disciple who wanted to bury his father
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, allow me first to go and bury my father.”

block.text: "Bikman, larim mi i go planim papa bilong mi pastaim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus said to him,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Leave the dead to bury their own dead, but you go and announce the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: "Maski. Ol man i dai pinis, ol i ken planim ol lain bilong ol yet. Tasol yu go autim tok bilong kingdom bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Another also said,

block.text: Narapela man i tokim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I want to follow you, Lord, but first allow me to say good-bye to those who are at my house.”

block.text: "Bikpela, mi laik bihainim yu. Tasol inap yu larim mi i go pastaim na bai mi ken tok gutbai long ol lain bilong mi?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus said to him,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “No one, having put his hand to the plow, and looking back, is fit for the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: "Man i holim stia, tasol oltaim em i lukluk i go long baksait, em i no inap long mekim wok bilong kingdom bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE 10
Now after these things, the Lord appointed seventy-two others, and said:

block.text: Bihain Bikpela i makim 72 man moa, na em i salim ol i

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am sending you out two by two into every city and place where I am about to go.”

block.text: go tupela tupela, na ol i go paslain long em. Em i salim ol i go long olgeta taun na ples em yet i laik i go long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said to them,

block.text: Na em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The harvest is indeed plentiful, but the laborers are few. Pray therefore to the Lord of the harvest, that he may send out laborers into his harvest.

block.text: "Planti kaikai tumas i mau pinis long gaden, tasol i no gat planti wokman i stap bilong kisim. Olsem na yupela i mas beten long Papa bilong gaden, bai em i ken salim ol wokman i go bungim kaikai bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Go your ways. Behold, I send you out as lambs among wolves.

block.text: "Yupela go. Harim. Mi salim yupela i go olsem ol pikinini sipsip i go namel long ol weldok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Carry no purse, nor wallet, nor sandals. Greet no one on the way.

block.text: Yupela i no ken karim paus mani na hanbek na su i go wantaim yupela. Na yupela i no ken givim gude long ol manmeri yupela i bungim long rot.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Into whatever house you enter, first say, ‘Peace be to this house.’

block.text: Sapos yupela i go insait long wanpela haus, orait pastaim yupela i mas tok olsem, 'Ol manmeri bilong dispela haus i ken i stap bel isi.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: If a son of peace is there, your peace will rest on him; but if not, it will return to you.

block.text: Na sapos wanpela man bilong bel isi i stap long dispela haus, orait gutpela tok bilong yupela i ken i go i stap long dispela man. Tasol sapos i no gat kain man olsem i stap, orait gutpela tok bilong yupela bai i kam bek long yupela yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Remain in that same house, eating and drinking the things they give, for the laborer is worthy of his wages. Don’t go from house to house.

block.text: Yupela i mas i stap long dispela wanpela haus tasol. Na yupela i mas kaikai na dringim ol samting ol i givim long yupela, long wanem, man i save wok, em inap long kisim pe bilong en. Na yupela i no ken i go nabaut long olgeta haus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Into whatever city you enter, and they receive you, eat the things that are set before you.

block.text: "Sapos yupela i go insait long wanpela taun na ol i kisim yupela i go long haus bilong ol, orait yupela i mas kisim kaikai ol i tilim long yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Heal the sick who are therein, and tell them, ‘The Kingdom of God has come near to you.’

block.text: Yupela i mas mekim orait ol sikman i stap long dispela taun. Na yupela i mas autim tok long ol olsem, 'Kingdom bilong God i kam klostu pinis long yupela.'
