ReferenceBlocks.text: But into whatever city you enter, and they don’t receive you, go out into its streets and say,

block.text: Tasol sapos yupela i go insait long wanpela taun, na ol i no laik kisim yupela i go long haus bilong ol, orait yupela go sanap long rot bilong dispela taun, na yupela tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘Even the dust from your city that clings to us, we wipe off against you. Nevertheless know this, that the Kingdom of God has come near to you.’

block.text: 'Pipia graun bilong taun bilong yupela em i pas long lek bilong mipela, em mipela i rausim bilong soim yupela olsem, yupela i gat asua long dispela pasin yupela i bin mekim. Tasol yupela tingim gut. Kingdom bilong God em i kam klostu pinis.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you, it will be more tolerable in that day for Sodom than for that city.”

block.text: Mi tokim yupela, long de God i makim bilong kotim ol manmeri, hevi i kamap long ol manmeri bilong dispela taun bai i winim tru hevi i kamap long ol lain bilong taun Sodom."

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon which were done in you, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Sori tumas, yupela ol manmeri bilong taun Korasin. Sori tumas, yupela ol Betsaida. Sapos wanpela man i bin i go long taun Tair na Saidon na wokim ol mirakel olsem mi bin wokim namel long yupela, orait longtaim ol Tair na Saidon ol inap tanim bel na pasim ol klos bilong sori na sindaun long sit bilong paia, bilong soim ol i sori tru long ol sin ol i bin mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon in the judgment than for you.

block.text: Tasol long de God i makim bilong kotim ol manmeri, hevi i kamap long yupela bai i winim tru hevi i kamap long ol Tair na Saidon.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You, Capernaum, who are exalted to heaven, will be brought down to Hades.

block.text: Na yupela ol Kaperneam, ating ol bai i litimapim yupela i go antap tru long heven, a? Nogat tru. Yupela bai i go daunbilo tru long ples bilong ol man i dai pinis."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever listens to you listens to me, and whoever rejects you rejects me. Whoever rejects me rejects him who sent me.”

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol disaipel olsem, "Man i harim tok bilong yupela, em i harim tok bilong mi. Na man i givim baksait long yupela, em i givim baksait long mi. Na man i givim baksait long mi, em i givim baksait long God, em i bin salim mi na mi kam."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The seventy returned with joy, saying,

block.text: Bihain ol 72 man Jisas i bin salim ol i go, ol i kam bek na ol i amamas tru. Ol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, even the demons are subject to us in your name!”

block.text: "Bikpela, mipela i bin kolim nem bilong yu, na ol spirit nogut tu ol i bihainim tok bilong mipela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I saw Satan having fallen like lightning from heaven.

block.text: "Mi lukim Satan i lusim heven na i pundaun olsem lait bilong klaut i pairap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, I give you authority to tread on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy. Nothing will in any way hurt you.

block.text: Harim. Mi givim pinis strong long yupela, na yupela bai inap krungutim ol snek na ol binatang bilong bagarapim man, na yupela inap winim olgeta strong bilong Satan, dispela birua bilong yupela. Na bai i no gat wanpela samting em inap long bagarapim yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nevertheless, don’t rejoice in this, that the spirits are subject to you, but rejoice that your names are written in heaven.”

block.text: Tasol yupela i no ken amamas na tok olsem, 'Ol spirit nogut ol i bihainim tok bilong mipela.' Nogat. Yupela i mas amamas long God i raitim pinis nem bilong yupela long buk bilong en long heven."

ReferenceBlocks.text: In that same hour Jesus rejoiced in the Holy Spirit, and said,

block.text: Long dispela taim Holi Spirit i mekim bel bilong Jisas i amamas, na Jisas i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I thank you, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you have hidden these things from the wise and understanding, and revealed them to little children. Yes, Father, for so it was well-pleasing in your sight.”

block.text: "Papa, yu Bikpela bilong heven na graun, mi tenkyu long yu, long wanem, yu bin haitim ol dispela samting long ol man i gat gutpela save na tingting, na yu bin soim long ol man i stap olsem ol liklik pikinini tasol. Yes, Papa, yu bihainim laik bilong yu tasol na yu mekim olsem."

ReferenceBlocks.text: “All things have been delivered to me by my Father. No one knows who the Son is, except the Father, and who the Father is, except the Son, and he to whomever the Son desires to reveal him.”

block.text: Na Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Papa bilong mi em i putim pinis olgeta samting long han bilong mi. Na i no gat wanpela man i save long Pikinini. Papa wanpela tasol i save long em. Na i no gat wanpela man i save long Papa. Pikinini tasol wantaim ol man Pikinini i soim Papa long ol, ol tasol i save long Papa."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Turning to the disciples, he said privately,

block.text: Ol disaipel tasol i stap wantaim Jisas, na em i tanim na lukim ol, na em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Blessed are the eyes which see the things that you see,

block.text: "Ol man i lukim ol samting yupela i save lukim, ol i ken amamas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: for I tell you that many prophets and kings desired to see the things which you see, and didn’t see them, and to hear the things which you hear, and didn’t hear them.”

block.text: Mi tokim yupela, bipo planti profet na planti king ol i laik lukim ol samting nau yupela i lukim, tasol ol i no bin lukim. Na ol i laik harim dispela ol tok yupela i save harim, tasol ol i no bin harim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, a certain lawyer stood up and tested him, saying,

block.text: Orait wanpela saveman bilong lo i kirap. Em i laik traim Jisas na i askim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?”

block.text: "Tisa, bai mi mekim wanem na mi kisim laip bilong i stap gut oltaim oltaim?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Na Jisas i askim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What is written in the law? How do you read it?”

block.text: "Wanem tok i stap long lo? Yu ritim olsem wanem?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered,

block.text: Na saveman bilong lo i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your strength, and with all your mind; and your neighbor as yourself.”

block.text: "'Yupela i mas laikim God, Bikpela bilong yumi. Yupela i mas laikim em tru long bel bilong yupela na long spirit bilong yupela na long strong bilong yupela na long tingting bilong yupela. Na yu mas laikim tru ol wantok olsem yu laikim yu yet.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You have answered correctly. Do this, and you will live.”

block.text: "Em nau. Yu bekim tok stret. Yu mekim olsem, na bai yu kisim laip."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he, desiring to justify himself, asked Jesus,

block.text: Tasol dispela saveman bilong lo, em i no laik bai Jisas i ting em i no gat gutpela save, olsem na em i askim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who is my neighbor?”

block.text: "Na taim lo i tok long wantok bilong mi, em i tok long husat tru?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered,

block.text: Orait Jisas i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A certain man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and he fell among robbers, who both stripped him and beat him, and departed, leaving him half dead.

block.text: "Wanpela man i lusim Jerusalem na i wokabaut i go daun long taun Jeriko. Na ol stilman i hait i stap long rot, na ol i kisim olgeta samting bilong em, na ol i paitim em nogut tru. Ol i mekim olsem, na ol i wokabaut i go. Na em i slip i stap long rot, na klostu em i laik i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By chance a certain priest was going down that way. When he saw him, he passed by on the other side.

block.text: Na long dispela taim wanpela pris i bihainim dispela rot i go daun. Na em i lukim dispela man i slip i stap long rot, na em i abrusim em, na i wokabaut long arere bilong rot na i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the same way a Levite also, when he came to the place, and saw him, passed by on the other side.

block.text: Olsem tasol wanpela Livai tu i kam kamap long dispela hap, na i lukim dispela man, na i abrusim em, na i wokabaut long arere bilong rot na i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But a certain Samaritan, as he traveled, came where he was. When he saw him, he was moved with compassion.

block.text: "Tasol wanpela man bilong Samaria em i wokabaut long rot na i kam kamap long dispela man. Em i lukim em, na bel bilong en i sori tru long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came to him and bound up his wounds, pouring on oil and wine. He set him on his own animal, brought him to an inn, and took care of him.

block.text: Em i go klostu long em, na i kapsaitim wel wantaim wain long ol sua bilong em, na i pasim ol. Na em i litimapim dispela man, na i putim em i sindaun long donki bilong em yet. Na em i bringim em i go long wanpela haus pasindia na i lukautim em gut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the next day, when he departed, he took out two denarii, and gave them to the host, and said to him, ‘Take care of him. Whatever you spend beyond that, I will repay you when I return.’”

block.text: Na long de bihain em i givim tupela mani silva long papa bilong dispela haus pasindia, na i tokim em olsem, 'Yu lukautim gut dispela man. Na sapos yu yusim sampela mani moa bilong yu bilong lukautim em, orait taim mi kam bek, bai mi bekim bilong yu.' "

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Jesus asked him:

block.text: Na Jisas i askim dispela saveman bilong lo olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now which of these three do you think seemed to be a neighbor to him who fell among the robbers?”

block.text: "Yu ting wanem? Husat bilong ol tripela man i laikim tru dispela man i bin bagarap long han bilong ol stilman?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Na em i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He who showed mercy on him.”

block.text: "Dispela man i sori long em na i helpim em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Jesus said to him,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go and do likewise.”

block.text: "Yu go na yu mekim wankain pasin tasol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened as they went on their way, he entered into a certain village, and a certain woman named Martha received him into her house.

block.text: Jisas wantaim ol disaipel i wokabaut i go, na Jisas i go insait long wanpela ples. Wanpela meri bilong dispela ples, nem bilong en Marta, em i kisim Jisas i go long haus bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: She had a sister called Mary, who also sat at Jesus’ feet, and heard his word.

block.text: Marta i gat wanpela susa, nem bilong en Maria. Maria em i kam sindaun klostu long lek bilong Bikpela, na i harim toktok bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Martha was distracted with much serving, and she came up to him, and said,

block.text: Tasol Marta em i tingting planti long bikpela wok em i mekim bilong redim kaikai samting. Olsem na em i go long Jisas na i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, don’t you care that my sister left me to serve alone? Ask her therefore to help me.”

block.text: "Bikpela, susa bilong mi em i lusim mi na mi wanpela tasol mi wok long redim kaikai. Ating yu no tingting long dispela? Yu tokim em long kam helpim mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered her,

block.text: Tasol Bikpela i bekim tok bilong em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Martha, Martha, you are anxious and troubled about many things,
but one thing is needed. Mary has chosen the good part, which will not be taken away from her.”

block.text: "Marta, Marta, yu wok long tingting planti na yu wari long planti samting.
Yu mas tingting long wanpela samting tasol. Dispela samting Maria i laik kisim, em i gutpela samting tru, olsem na yumi no ken pasim em long kisim dispela gutpela samting."

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE 11
It happened, that when he finished praying in a certain place, one of his disciples said to him,

block.text: Jisas i beten i stap long wanpela hap. Em i beten pinis, orait wanpela disaipel i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, teach us to pray, just as John also taught his disciples.”

block.text: "Bikpela, yu skulim mipela long mekim prea, olsem bipo Jon i bin skulim ol disaipel bilong em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When you pray, say, ‘Our Father in heaven, may your name be kept holy. May your Kingdom come. May your will be done on earth, as it is in heaven.

block.text: "Taim yupela i beten, yupela i ken tok olsem, 'Papa, nem bilong yu i mas i stap holi. Kingdom bilong yu i mas i kam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Give us day by day our daily bread.

block.text: Na olgeta de yu ken givim mipela kaikai inap bilong dispela de.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Forgive us our sins, for we ourselves also forgive everyone who is indebted to us. Bring us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil.’”

block.text: Na yu ken lusim ol sin bilong mipela, long wanem, mipela i save lusim ol rong ol arapela i bin mekim long mipela. Na yu no ken larim ol traim i kamap long mipela.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol moa olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Which of you, if you go to a friend at midnight, and tell him, ‘Friend, lend me three loaves of bread.

block.text: "Sapos wanpela man namel long yupela em i gat wanpela pren, na long biknait tru em i go na i tokim dispela pren olsem, 'Pren, mi laik yu givim mi tripela bret.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A friend of mine has come to me from a journey, and I have nothing to set before him.’

block.text: Wanpela wantok bilong mi em i wokabaut long rot na i kam kamap long haus bilong mi, na mi no gat kaikai bilong givim em.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: He from within will answer and say, ‘Don’t bother me. The door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed. I can’t get up and give it to you?’

block.text: Na sapos dispela man i stap insait long haus em i bekim tok olsem, 'Yu no ken givim hatwok long mi. Dua i pas pinis, na mi wantaim ol pikinini bilong mi, mipela i slip pinis. Mi no inap kirap na givim ol samting long yu.' Orait olsem wanem?

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you, although he will not rise and give it to him because he is his friend, yet because of his persistence, he will get up and give him as many as he needs.”

block.text: Mi tokim yupela, papa bilong haus bai i kirap na givim pren bilong en olgeta samting em i sot long en. Tru, em bai i no ting olsem em i laik helpim pren bilong en, na em bai i mekim olsem. Nogat. Em bai i les tasol long harim pren i singaut planti, na em bai i kirap na givim ol samting long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I tell you, keep asking, and it will be given you. Keep seeking, and you will find. Keep knocking, and it will be opened to you.

block.text: Olsem na mi tokim yupela, yupela i mas prea na askim God long givim ol samting long yupela, na em bai i givim long yupela. Yupela i mas wok long painim samting, na bai yupela i lukim. Yupela i mas paitim dua, na God bai i opim long yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For everyone who asks receives. He who seeks finds. To him who knocks it will be opened.”

block.text: Olgeta man i prea long God, ol i save kisim ol samting. Man i wok long painim samting, em i save lukim. Na man i paitim dua, God bai i opim dua long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Which of you fathers, if your son asks for bread, will give him a stone? Or if he asks for a fish, he won’t give him a snake instead of a fish, will he?

block.text: "Sapos pikinini bilong wanpela bilong yupela em i askim papa long givim wanpela pis long em, ating papa bai i givim em wanpela snek nogut, a? Nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or if he asks for an egg, he won’t give him a scorpion, will he?

block.text: Na sapos pikinini i askim papa long givim em wanpela kiau, ating papa bai i givim em wanpela binatang nogut, a? Em tu nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him?”

block.text: Yupela papa i save mekim planti pasin nogut, tasol yupela i save tumas long givim ol gutpela samting long ol pikinini bilong yupela. Olsem na yupela i ken save tru, Papa bilong yupela i stap long heven em bai i amamas long givim Holi Spirit long ol man i askim em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was casting out a demon, and it was mute. It happened, when the demon had gone out, the mute man spoke; and the multitudes marveled.

block.text: Jisas i rausim wanpela spirit nogut i stap long wanpela man na i mekim maus bilong en i pas. Spirit nogut i go pinis, orait dispela mauspas i toktok. Na ol manmeri i lukim na ol i kirap nogut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But some of them said,

block.text: Tasol sampela man i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He casts out demons by Beelzebul, the prince of the demons.”

block.text: "Em i save rausim ol spirit nogut long strong bilong Belsebul, em hetman bilong ol spirit nogut."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others, trying to trap him said:

block.text: Na sampela man i laik traim Jisas na ol i askim em long

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Show us a sign from Heaven!”

block.text: wokim wanpela mirakel olsem mak bilong soim ol olsem em i mekim wok bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he, knowing their thoughts, said to them,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i save long tingting bilong ol, na em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation. A house divided against itself falls.

block.text: "Sapos ol man bilong wanpela kantri i bruk tupela lain na ol i pait, orait dispela kantri bai i bagarap. Na sapos ol man bilong wanpela famili i birua na pait namel long ol yet, orait famili bai i bagarap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If Satan also is divided against himself, how will his kingdom stand? For you say that I cast out demons by Beelzebul.

block.text: Na sapos ol lain bilong Satan i bruk tupela lain na ol i birua long ol yet, orait olsem wanem bai em i gat strong bilong bosim ol samting? Yupela i tok, mi save rausim ol spirit nogut long strong bilong Belsebul.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if I cast out demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your children cast them out? Therefore will they be your judges.

block.text: Tasol sapos em i tru Belsebul i save helpim mi na mi rausim ol spirit nogut, orait husat i save helpim ol lain bilong yupela, na ol i rausim ol spirit nogut? Ol lain bilong yupela yet bai i soim yupela olsem dispela tok bilong yupela em i no stret.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if I by the finger of God cast out demons, then the Kingdom of God has come to you.”

block.text: Tasol sapos God yet i givim strong long mi na mi rausim ol spirit nogut, orait yupela i ken save, kingdom bilong God i kam pinis long yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When the strong man, fully armed, guards his own dwelling, his goods are safe.

block.text: "Sapos wanpela strongpela man i holim bainat samting na i was gut long haus bilong en, orait olgeta samting bilong en bai i stap gut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when someone stronger attacks him and overcomes him, he takes from him his whole armor in which he trusted, and divides his spoils.”

block.text: Tasol sapos wanpela man i strongpela moa em i kamap na i pait long dispela man na i winim em, orait em bai i kisim olgeta spia na bainat samting i bin mekim dispela man i stap strong. Na em bai i tilim olgeta samting bilong en i go long ol arapela man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He that is not with me is against me. He who doesn’t gather with me scatters.

block.text: "Man i no pren bilong mi, em i save birua long mi. Na man i no helpim mi long bungim ol manmeri, em i save ranim ol i go nabaut."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The unclean spirit, when he has gone out of the man, passes through dry places, seeking rest, and finding none, he says, ‘I will turn back to my house from which I came out.’

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Sapos spirit nogut i lusim pinis wanpela man, orait spirit i save go nabaut long ples drai, bilong painim wanpela hap em i ken malolo long en. Tasol sapos em i no lukim wanpela gutpela hap, orait em bai i tok olsem, 'Bai mi go bek long dispela haus bipo mi stap long en.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he returns, he finds it swept and put in order.

block.text: Na em bai i go na lukim dispela haus, ol i brumim pinis na bilasim pinis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he goes, and takes seven other spirits more evil than himself, and they enter in and dwell there. The last state of that man becomes worse than the first.”

block.text: Olsem na em bai i go kisim 7 -pela arapela spirit ol i winim em long mekim pasin nogut. Na ol bai i go insait na i stap long dispela haus. Pastaim dispela man i stap nogut, tasol nau em bai i stap nogut moa yet."

ReferenceBlocks.text: It came to pass, as he said these things, a certain woman out of the multitude lifted up her voice, and said to him,

block.text: Jisas i autim tok long taim bikpela lain manmeri i stap. Na wanpela meri i stap namel long ol em i singaut olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Blessed is the womb that bore you, and the breasts which nursed you!”

block.text: "Dispela meri I bin karim yu na i givim susu long yu, em i ken amamas."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “On the contrary, blessed are those who hear the word of God, and keep it.”

block.text: "Mobeta yumi tok olsem, ol man i harim tok bilong God na I bihainim, em ol i ken amamas."

ReferenceBlocks.text: As the multitudes continued to increase, he began to say,

block.text: Planti manmeri moa i wok long kam yet long Jisas, na Jisas I tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is an evil generation. It seeks after a sign. No sign will be given to it but the sign of Jonah, the prophet.

block.text: "Ol manmeri bilong dispela taim ol i lain manmeri nogut. Ol i singaut long lukim wanpela mirakel o mak i soim olsem mi mekim wok bilong God. Tasol ol bai i no inap lukim wanpela mak. Nogat. Wanpela mak tasol bai ol i lukim, em mak bilong profet Jona.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For even as Jonah became a sign to the Ninevites, so will also the Son of Man be to this generation.

block.text: Bipo Jona i kamap olsem mak God i bin soim long ol man bilong taun Ninive. Na olsem tasol Pikinini Bilong Man bai i stap olsem mak God i soim long ol manmeri bilong dispela taim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Queen of the South will rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation, and will condemn them: for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, one greater than Solomon is here.

block.text: Long de God i makim bilong kotim ol manmeri, kwin bilong hap bilong saut bai i sanap long kot na tokaut long pasin nogut bilong ol manmeri bilong dispela taim nau. Long wanem, dispela kwin i bin i stap long arere tru bilong graun,tasol em i kam bilong harim Solomon i autim gutpela save bilong em. Tasol i gat wanpela man i stap namel long yupela, em i winim tru Solomon.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The men of Nineveh will stand up in the judgment with this generation, and will condemn it: for they repented at the preaching of Jonah, and behold, one greater than Jonah is here.”

block.text: Taim God i kotim ol manmeri, ol man bilong Ninive bai i sanap long kot na tokaut long pasin nogut bilong ol manmeri bilong dispela taim nau. Long wanem, ol Ninive i bin harim tok Jona i autim, na ol i tanim bel. Tasol i gat wanpela man i stap hia, em i winim tru Jona."

ReferenceBlocks.text: “No one, when he has lit a lamp, puts it in a cellar or under a basket, but on a stand, that those who come in may see the light.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Ol man i no save laitim lam na putim i go daun insait long hul aninit long haus, o aninit long wanpela baket. Nogat. Ol i save putim antap long tebol, na ol man i kam insait ol i ken lukim dispela lait.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The lamp of the body is the eye. Therefore when your eye is good, your whole body is also full of light; but when it is evil, your body also is full of darkness.

block.text: Ai bilong yu em i olsem lam bilong bodi bilong yu. Sapos ai bilong yu em i gutpela, orait lait bai i pulap long olgeta hap bodi bilong yu. Tasol sapos ai bilong yu em i nogut, orait bodi bilong yu em i tudak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore see whether the light that is in you isn’t darkness.

block.text: Olsem na yu mas was gut. Nogut dispela lait i stap insait long yu em i kamap tudak.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If therefore your whole body is full of light, having no part dark, it will be wholly full of light, as when the lamp with its bright shining gives you light.”

block.text: Sapos olgeta hap bilong bodi bilong yu i gat lait, na i no gat wanpela hap bilong en i tudak, orait bodi bilong yu bai i lait olgeta, olsem lait bilong lam i sutim yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus finished speaking, a Pharisee invited him to dinner at his house, saying:

block.text: Jisas i autim tok pinis, orait wanpela Farisi i askim em long

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come dine with me.”

block.text: kam kaikai wantaim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went in, and sat at the table.

block.text: Olsem na Jisas i go insait long haus na i sindaun long tebol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the Pharisee saw it, he marveled that he had not first washed himself before dinner.

block.text: Na dispela Farisi i lukim em i sindaun kaikai na i no waswas pastaim, na em i tingting planti.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord said to him,

block.text: Tasol Bikpela i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now you Pharisees cleanse the outside of the cup and of the platter, but your inward part is full of extortion and wickedness.

block.text: "Yupela Farisi, yupela i save klinim gut ausait bilong kap na plet. Tasol long insait, yupela i pulap long pasin bilong stil na olkain pasin nogut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You foolish ones, didn’t he who made the outside make the inside also?

block.text: Yupela ol longlong man! Man i wokim ausait bilong ol samting, ating em i no wokim insait bilong ol tu?

ReferenceBlocks.text: But give for gifts to the needy those things which are within, and behold, all things will be clean to you.

block.text: Tasol ol samting i stap long insait, em yupela i mas givim long ol man i sot, bilong helpim ol. Yupela i mekim olsem na bai olgeta samting bilong yupela bai i stap klin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But woe to you Pharisees! For you tithe mint and rue and every herb, but you bypass justice and the love of God. You ought to have done these, and not to have left the other undone.

block.text: "Tasol yupela Farisi, yupela lukaut. Olgeta liklik sayor na kumu samting bilong gaden em yupela i save tilim long 10 -pela hap na givim wanpela hap long God. Tasol yupela i save lusim stretpela pasin na pasin bilong laikim God. Mobeta yupela i strong long mekim ol dispela pasin na yupela i no lusim ol arapela lo tu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Woe to you Pharisees! For you love the best seats in the synagogues, and the greetings in the marketplaces.

block.text: "Yupela Farisi, yupela lukaut. Yupela i save laik long kisim ol namba wan ples bilong sindaun long ol haus lotu, na yupela i laikim tumas long ol manmeri i mas givim gude long yupela long ol ples bung.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you are like hidden graves, and the men who walk over them don’t know it.”

block.text: "Yupela lukaut. Yupela i olsem ol matmat i stap hait insait long graun, na ol man i no save, na ol i wokabaut antap long ol, na ol i kamap doti long ai bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: One of the lawyers answered him,

block.text: Wanpela saveman bilong lo i harim dispela tok na em i tokim Jisas olsem,

block.characterId: experts in religious law, one of the

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: experts in religious law, one of the
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, in saying this you insult us also.”

block.text: "Tisa, taim yu mekim dispela kain tok long ol Farisi, yu rabisim mipela tu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Na Jisas i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woe to you lawyers also! For you load men with burdens that are difficult to carry, and you yourselves won’t even lift one finger to help carry those burdens.

block.text: "Yupela saveman bilong lo, yupela tu i mas lukaut. Yupela i mekim pasin olsem yupela i kisim ol samting i gat bikpela hevi, na yupela i givim long ol man, na ol i hatwok tru long karim. Tasol yupela yet i no save putim wanpela pinga tasol bilong helpim ol long karim dispela ol hevi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Woe to you! For you build the tombs of the prophets, and your fathers killed them.

block.text: "Yupela lukaut. Ol tumbuna bilong yupela i bin kilim ol profet i dai, na yupela i save wokim ol matmat bilong ol dispela profet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So you testify and consent to the works of your fathers. For they killed them, and you build their tombs.

block.text: Long dispela pasin yupela i save soim ol man olsem yupela i orait long ol dispela pasin ol tumbuna i bin mekim. Long wanem, ol tumbuna i bin kilim ol profet i dai, na yupela i wokim ol matmat bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore also the wisdom of God said, ‘I will send to them prophets and apostles; and some of them they will kill and persecute,

block.text: "Gutpela na stretpela tingting bilong God em i bin tok olsem, 'Mi bai salim ol profet na aposel i go long ol dispela man, na ol man bai i mekim nogut long sampela bilong ol na kilim ol i dai.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: that the blood of all the prophets, which was shed from the foundation of the world, may be required of this generation;

block.text: Olsem na asua bilong olgeta man i bin kilim i dai ol profet, stat long taim God i mekim kamap dispela graun na i kam inap long nau, dispela asua bai i stap long ol manmeri bilong dispela taim nau na ol bai i kisim hevi long dispela asua.

ReferenceBlocks.text: from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zachariah, who perished between the altar and the sanctuary.’ Yes, I tell you, it will be required of this generation.

block.text: Ol i bin kilim i dai ol profet, stat long Abel na i kam inap long Sekaraia, em dispela man ol i bin kilim i dai namel long alta na haus bilong God. Yes, mi tokim yupela, pe nogut bilong dispela olgeta pasin nogut, em bai i kamap long dispela lain manmeri nau i stap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Woe to you lawyers! For you took away the key of knowledge. You didn’t enter in yourselves, and those who were entering in, you hindered.”

block.text: "Yupela saveman bilong lo, yupela lukaut. Yupela i rausim pinis ki bilong dua i go insait long ples bilong kisim save. Yupela yet i no laik i go insait long dispela ples, tasol taim ol arapela manmeri i laik i go insait na kisim save, yupela i pasim rot bilong ol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he said these things to them, the scribes and the Pharisees began to be terribly angry, and to draw many things out of him.

block.text: Orait Jisas i lusim dispela haus em i stap long en, na bihain ol saveman bilong lo wantaim ol Farisi ol i bel nogut tru long em na ol i wok long askim em long ol kain kain askim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were trying to catch him in something he might say, that they might accuse him.

block.text: Ol i laik trikim em, bai em i bekim wanpela tok i no stret, na ol inap kotim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE 12
Meanwhile, when a multitude of many thousands had gathered together, so much so that they trampled on each other, he began to tell his disciples first of all,

block.text: Planti tausen manmeri i kam bung na ples i pas tru, inap long sampela i krungutim lek bilong ol arapela. Na Jisas i autim tok pastaim long ol disaipel bilong en olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Beware of the yeast of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.

block.text: "Yupela lukaut gut long yis bilong ol Farisi. Mi tok long giaman pasin bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But there is nothing covered up, that will not be revealed, nor hidden, that will not be known.

block.text: Olgeta samting i karamap i stap bai i kamap long ples klia. Na olgeta tok hait bai ol man i save long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore whatever you have said in the darkness will be heard in the light. What you have spoken in the ear in the inner rooms will be proclaimed on the housetops.”

block.text: Olsem na olgeta tok yupela i bin mekim long tudak, ol manmeri bai i harim long san. Na olgeta tok yupela i bin mekim isi tasol insait long haus, em bai ol i sanap antap long haus na autim long ol manmeri."

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I tell you, my friends, don’t be afraid of those who kill the body, and after that have no more that they can do.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Ol pren bilong mi, mi tokim yupela olsem. Yupela i no ken pret long ol man i save kilim i dai bodi tasol, na bihain ol i no inap mekim wanpela samting moa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I will warn you whom you should fear. Fear him, who after he has killed, has power to cast into Gehenna. Yes, I tell you, fear him.”

block.text: Tasol mi laik tok klia long yupela long yupela i mas pret long husat tru. Yupela i mas pret long God. Taim God i kilim man i dai, orait em i gat strong bilong tromoi dispela man i go long hel. Mi tokim yupela stret, yupela i mas pret long God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Aren’t five sparrows sold for two assaria coins? Not one of them is forgotten by God.

block.text: "Yupela i save, ol man i save baim 5 -pela liklik pisin long 2 toea tasol. Na God i no save lusim tingting long wanpela bilong ol dispela liklik pisin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the very hairs of your head are all numbered. Therefore don’t be afraid. You are of more value than many sparrows.”

block.text: Na tu, God i kaunim pinis olgeta gras long het bilong yupela, na em i save gut tru long yupela. Olsem na yupela i no ken pret. Yupela i winim planti lain liklik pisin."

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I tell you, everyone who confesses me before men, him will the Son of Man also confess before the angels of God;

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Mi tokim yupela, sapos man i tokim ol manmeri olsem em i stap long lain bilong mi, orait Pikinini Bilong Man em tu bai i tokim ol ensel bilong God olsem dispela man em i man bilong em yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: but he who denies me in the presence of men will be denied in the presence of the angels of God.

block.text: Tasol man i tokim ol manmeri olsem em i no man bilong lain bilong mi, mi tu bai mi tokim ol ensel bilong God olsem em i no bilong mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Everyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but those who blaspheme against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.

block.text: "Man i mekim tok nogut long Pikinini Bilong Man, God bai i lusim dispela sin bilong em. Tasol man i mekim tok nogut long Holi Spirit, God bai i no inap lusim dispela sin bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they bring you before the synagogues, the rulers, and the authorities, don’t be anxious how or what you will answer, or what you will say;

block.text: "Na taim ol i bringim yupela i go long ol haus lotu na long ai bilong ol gavman na ol man i gat namba, orait yupela i no ken pret na ting, 'Mipela bai i bekim tok olsem wanem? Mipela bai i mekim wanem kain tok?' Nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: for the Holy Spirit will teach you in that same hour what you must say.”

block.text: Long dispela taim stret Holi Spirit bai i soim yupela long tok yupela i mas autim long ol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: One of the multitude said to him,

block.text: Wanpela man long dispela bikpela lain manmeri i tokim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me.”

block.text: "Tisa, papa bilong mi i dai pinis, na mi laik bai yu tokim brata bilong mi long em i mas tilim ol samting papa i lusim, na givim hap long mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said to him,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i askim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Man, who made me a judge or an arbitrator over you?”

block.text: "Olsem wanem? Husat i makim mi long kamap jas bilong yutupela, na mi mas tilim ol samting bilong yutupela?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Na em i tokim ol manmeri olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Beware! Keep yourselves from covetousness, for a man’s life doesn’t consist of the abundance of the things which he possesses.”

block.text: "Yupela lukaut na was gut. Nogut yupela i mangal long kisim ol kain kain samting. Maski yu yet yu gat planti samting moa, tasol yu no inap kisim laip long ol dispela samting bilong yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He spoke a parable to them, saying,

block.text: Na Jisas i autim wanpela tok piksa long ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The ground of a certain rich man brought forth abundantly.

block.text: "Gaden bilong wanpela maniman em i karim planti kaikai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He reasoned within himself, saying, ‘What will I do, because I don’t have room to store my crops?’

block.text: Orait dispela man i ting olsem, 'Bai mi mekim wanem nau? Mi no gat haus inap long bungim olgeta kaikai bilong mi.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said, ‘This is what I will do. I will pull down my barns, and build bigger ones, and there I will store all my grain and my goods.

block.text: Na em i tok, 'Ating bai mi mekim olsem. Bai mi brukim olgeta haus kaikai bilong mi, na wokim ol bikpela bikpela haus. Na bai mi bungim olgeta wit na olgeta gutpela samting bilong mi long ol dispela haus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I will tell my soul, “Soul, you have many goods laid up for many years. Take your ease, eat, drink, be merry.”’”

block.text: Na bai mi tok long mi yet olsem. Man, mi win tru ya. Mi gat planti gutpela samting i stap inap long planti yia. Orait nau mi ken i stap malolo. Bai mi sindaun na mekim bikpela kaikai oltaim na amamas i stap.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But God said to him, ‘You foolish one, tonight your soul is required of you. The things which you have prepared--whose will they be?’

block.text: Tasol God i tokim em olsem, 'Yu longlong man tru. Nau long dispela nait tasol bai yu dai. Na olgeta dispela samting yu bin redim i stap, em husat bai i kisim?'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is the same for one who lays up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.”

block.text: Na Jisas i tok, "Dispela kain samting bai i kamap long ol man i hipim hipim planti samting bilong ol yet, tasol ol i stap rabis long ai bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to his disciples,

block.text: Orait na Jisas i tokim ol disaipel bilong en,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Therefore I tell you, don’t be anxious for your life, what you will eat, nor yet for your body, what you will wear.

block.text: "Mi tokim yupela olsem, yupela i mas tingim dispela tok piksa na yupela i no ken tingting planti long laip bilong yupela, na tok, 'Bai yumi kaikai wanem?' Na yupela i no ken tingting planti long bodi bilong yupela na tok, 'Bai yumi pasim wanem laplap?'

ReferenceBlocks.text: Life is more than food, and the body is more than clothing.

block.text: Laip em i no samting bilong kaikai tasol. Na bodi em i winim ol laplap samting.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Consider the ravens: they don’t sow, they don’t reap, they have no warehouse or barn, and God feeds them. How much more valuable are you than birds!

block.text: Yupela tingim ol kotkot. Ol i no save planim kaikai na ol i no save bungim kaikai. Ol i no gat haus kaikai o haus bilong putim samting long en. Tasol God i save givim kaikai long ol. Na yupela manmeri i winim tru ol pisin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Which of you by being anxious can add a cubit to his height?

block.text: Sapos wanpela bilong yupela i wok long tingting planti long rot bilong i stap gut, ating dispela pasin bilong tingting planti bai i skruim liklik hap taim moa long laip bilong en? I no inap tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If then you aren’t able to do even the least things, why are you anxious about the rest?

block.text: Na sapos yupela i no inap mekim kain liklik samting olsem, orait bilong wanem yupela i tingting planti tumas long ol arapela samting?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Consider the lilies, how they grow. They don’t toil, neither do they spin; yet I tell you, even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.

block.text: "Yupela lukim gut ol plaua, ol i kamap olsem wanem. Ol i no save hatwok. Ol i no save wokim laplap. Tasol mi tokim yupela, bipo King Solomon i save putim olgeta gutpela gutpela bilas bilong en, tasol gutpela bilas bilong ol dispela plaua i winim tru bilas bilong Solomon.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if this is how God clothes the grass in the field, which today exists, and tomorrow is cast into the oven, how much more will he clothe you, O you of little faith?

block.text: Nau ol dispela gras samting i stap nabaut na tumora tasol ol man bai i katim na tromoi i go long paia. Na kain gras nating olsem, em God i save bilasim. Olsem na yupela ol manmeri i gat liklik bilip, yupela i ken save tru olsem, God bai i givim bilas long yupela tu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don’t seek what you will eat or what you will drink; neither be anxious.

block.text: Olsem na yupela i no ken wari na tingting planti long yupela bai i kaikai wanem samting, na yupela bai i dring wanem samting.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the nations of the world seek after all of these things, but your Father knows that you need these things.

block.text: Olgeta lain manmeri bilong graun i save wari long painim ol dispela kain samting. Tasol Papa bilong yupela em i save pinis, yupela i mas kisim ol dispela samting.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But seek God’s Kingdom, and all these things will be added to you.

block.text: Olsem na mobeta yupela i tingting long larim God i stap king bilong yupela. Na bai em i givim ol dispela samting tu long yupela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don’t be afraid, little flock, for it is your Father’s good pleasure to give you the Kingdom.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Yupela liklik lain sipsip, yupela i no ken pret. Papa bilong yupela em i tok pinis long em bai i stap king bilong yupela na givim kingdom bilong en long yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Sell that which you have, and give gifts to the needy. Make for yourselves purses which don’t grow old, a treasure in the heavens that doesn’t fail, where no thief approaches, neither moth destroys.

block.text: Yupela larim ol man i baim olgeta samting bilong yupela, na givim dispela mani long ol man i sot long ol samting. Yupela i mas kisim dispela kain paus mani i no save bagarap, na yupela i mas wok long bungim ol gutpela gutpela samting long heven. Long heven ol samting i no save lus, na ol stilman i no save kisim, na ol binatang i no save bagarapim ol samting.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.”

block.text: Long ples ol gutpela samting bilong yupela i stap long en, long dispela ples tasol laik bilong yupela tu bai i stap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Be ready and dressed. Have your lamps burning.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Yupela sotim laplap bilong yupela na pasim let, na laitim lam, na yupela i stap redi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Be like men watching for their lord, when he returns from the marriage feast; that, when he comes and knocks, they may immediately open to him.

block.text: Yupela i mas i stap olsem ol man i wetim bikman bilong ol em i laik lusim bikpela kaikai bilong marit na i kam bek. Sapos em i kam paitim dua, bai ol i opim dua kwiktaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed are those servants, whom the lord will find watching when he comes. Most certainly I tell you, that he will dress himself, and make them recline, and will come and serve them.

block.text: Sapos bikman i kam na i lukim ol wokboi bilong en i no slip, orait ol dispela wokboi i ken amamas. Mi tok tru long yupela, bikman yet bai i sotim laplap na pasim let, na bai em i tokim ol long sindaun long tebol. Na em yet bai i kam givim kaikai long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will be blessed if he comes in the second or third watch, and finds them so.

block.text: Na sapos bikman i kam long biknait tru, o long taim kakaruk i krai namba wan taim, na em i lukim ol wokboi i no slip, orait ol dispela wokboi i ken amamas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But know this, that if the master of the house had known in what hour the thief was coming, he would have watched, and not allowed his house to be broken into.

block.text: "Yupela tingim dispela samting. Sapos papa bilong haus i save pastaim long wanem taim stilman bai i kam, orait em bai i no inap larim dispela stilman i brukim haus bilong en na i go insait.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore be ready also, for the Son of Man is coming in an hour that you don’t expect him.”

block.text: Yupela tu i mas redi. Pikinini Bilong Man bai i kam long wanpela taim yupela i no ting em bai i kam."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter said to him,

block.text: Pita i askim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, are you telling this parable to us, or to everybody?”

block.text: "Bikpela, ating yu givim dispela tok piksa long mipela tasol, o long olgeta man wantaim?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord said,

block.text: Na Bikpela i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who then is the faithful and wise steward, whom his lord will set over his household, to give them their portion of food at the right times?

block.text: "Wanem bosboi i gat gutpela tingting, na i save mekim gut wok bilong en? Bikman i save makim dispela kain bosboi bilong bosim ol wokboi bilong en, na bilong skelim kaikai long ol long taim bikman i makim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed is that servant whom his lord will find doing so when he comes.

block.text: Dispela kain wokboi i ken amamas tru taim bikman bilong en i kam bek na i lukim em i stap mekim wok bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Truly I tell you, that he will set him over all that he has.

block.text: Mi tok tru long yupela, bikman bai i makim dispela wokboi bilong bosim olgeta samting bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But suppose that servant says in his heart, ‘My lord delays his coming,’ and begins to beat the menservants and the maidservants, and to eat and drink, and to be drunken.

block.text: Tasol sapos dispela wokboi i ting long bel bilong en, 'Bikman bilong mi bai i no inap i kam kwik,' na em i stat long paitim ol arapela wokboi na wokmeri, na em i wok long kaikai na dring na em i spak,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the lord of that servant will come in a day when he isn’t expecting him, and in an hour that he doesn’t know, and will cut him in two, and place his portion with the unfaithful.

block.text: orait bikman bai i kam bek long wanpela de dispela wokboi i no redi, na long wanpela taim em i no save long en. Na bikman bai i bagarapim tru dispela wokboi, na bai em i putim em i stap wantaim ol man bilong sakim tok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: That servant, who knew his lord’s will, and didn’t prepare, nor do what he wanted, will be beaten with many stripes.

block.text: "Wokboi i save pinis long laik bilong bikman bilong en, tasol em i no redim samting na i no bihainim laik bilong bikman, em bikman bai i paitim strong tumas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he who didn’t know, and did things worthy of stripes, will be beaten with few stripes. To whomever much is given, of him will much be required; and to whom much was entrusted, of him more will be asked.”

block.text: Tasol wokboi i no save long laik bilong bikman na i mekim pasin inap long kisim kanda, em bikman bai i paitim liklik. Ol man i kisim planti samting, ol i mas bekim planti samting gen. Sapos ol manmeri i putim planti samting long han bilong wanpela man, orait ol bai i tokim em long bekim planti samting moa."

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I came to throw fire on the earth. I wish it were already kindled.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Mi bin kam bilong tromoi paia long graun, na mi laikim tumas bai dispela paia i lait hariap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I have a baptism to be baptized with, and how distressed I am until it is accomplished!

block.text: Mi mas kisim wanpela kain baptais. Nau mi no kisim yet, na bel bilong mi em i hevi tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Do you think that I have come to give peace in the earth? I tell you, no, but rather division.

block.text: Nogut yupela i ting mi kam bilong mekim i dai olgeta pait long graun. Nogat. Mi tokim yupela, mi kam bilong brukim ol lain manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For from now on, there will be five in one house divided, three against two, and two against three.

block.text: Long nau na bihain tu sapos i gat 5 -pela bilong wanpela famili i stap long wanpela haus, orait ol bai i bruk tupela lain. Tripela bai i birua long tupela, na tupela bai i birua long tripela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will be divided, father against son, and son against father; mother against daughter, and daughter against her mother; mother-in-law against her daughter-in-law, and daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.”

block.text: Bai ol i bruk, na papa i birua long pikinini man bilong en, na pikinini man bai i birua long papa bilong en. Na mama bai i birua long pikinini meri bilong en, na pikinini meri bai i birua long mama bilong en. Na mama bilong wanpela man bai i birua long meri bilong dispela man, na meribai i birua long mama bilong man bilong en."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to the multitudes also,

block.text: Jisas i tokim ol planti lain manmeri olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When you see a cloud rising from the west, immediately you say, ‘A shower is coming,’ and so it happens.

block.text: "Yupela i save lukim klaut i kamap long hap bilong san i go daun, na kwiktaim yupela i save tok, 'Ren i laik i kam.' Na tru tumas, ren i save kam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When a south wind blows, you say, ‘There will be a scorching heat,’ and it happens.

block.text: Na yupela i save lukim strongpela win bilong saut i kamap, na yupela i save tok, 'Bai san i hat nau.' Na tru tumas, hatpela san i save kamap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You hypocrites! You know how to interpret the appearance of the earth and the sky, but how is it that you don’t interpret this time?

block.text: Yupela man bilong giaman, yupela i save skelim gut ol samting i save kamap long graun na long skai. Tasol watpo yupela i no save long pasin bilong skelim ol samting i wok long kamap long dispela taim nau?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Why don’t you judge for yourselves what is right?

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Bilong wanem yupela yet i no save tingim gut na skelim wanem ol pasin i stretpela?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For when you are going with your adversary before the magistrate, try diligently on the way to be released from him, lest perhaps he drag you to the judge, and the judge deliver you to the officer, and the officer throw you into prison.

block.text: Sapos yu wokabaut i go long kot wantaim wanpela man i laik kotim yu, orait taim yutupela i stap yet long rot yu mas traim long stretim tok wantaim em. Nogut em i pulim yu i go long jas, na jas i putim yu long han bilong plisman, na plisman i putim yu long haus kalabus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you, you will by no means get out of there, until you have paid the very last penny.”

block.text: Mi tok stret long yu, yu bai i stap long haus kalabus inap long yu baim olgeta mani ol i makim bilong yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE 13
Now there were some present at the same time who told him about the Galileans, whose blood Pilate had mixed with their sacrifices.
Jesus answered them,

block.text: Jisas i autim tok pinis, orait sampela man i stori long Jisas long ol man bilong Galili, em Pailat i bin tokim ol soldia bilong en long kilim ol i dai long taim ol i mekim ol ofa long God, na blut bilong ol i bin kapsait antap long blut bilong ol abus bilong ofa.
Na Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you think that these Galileans were worse sinners than all the other Galileans, because they suffered such things?

block.text: "Yupela i ting ol dispela man bilong Galili i bin mekim planti sin moa i winim olgeta arapela man bilong Galili, na dispela em i as bilong dispela samting nogut i bin kamap long ol, a?

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you, no, but unless you repent, you will all perish in the same way.

block.text: Nogat tru. Mi tokim yupela stret, sapos yupela i no tanim bel, orait wankain samting bai i kamap long yupela olgeta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or those eighteen, on whom the tower in Siloam fell, and killed them; do you think that they were worse offenders than all the men who dwell in Jerusalem?

block.text: Na dispela 18 man, bipo longpela haus long Siloam i bin pundaun antap long ol na i kilim ol i dai, em yupela i ting rong bilong ol i winim rong bilong ol arapela man i stap long Jerusalem, a?

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you, no, but, unless you repent, you will all perish in the same way.”

block.text: Nogat tru. Mi tokim yupela stret, sapos yupela i no tanim bel, orait wankain samting bai i kamap long yupela olgeta."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He spoke this parable.

block.text: Na Jisas i autim wanpela tok piksa olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard, and he came seeking fruit on it, and found none.

block.text: "Wanpela man i bin planim wanpela diwai fik long gaden wain bilong en, na bihain em i kam long dispela diwai bilong painim ol pikinini fik. Tasol em i no lukim wanpela i stap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to the vine dresser, ‘Behold, these three years I have come looking for fruit on this fig tree, and found none. Cut it down. Why does it waste the soil?’

block.text: Olsem na em i tokim wokman bilong gaden olsem, 'Harim. Tripela yia nau mi kam bilong painim ol pikinini fik long dispela diwai, tasol em i no karim pikinini. Olsem na yu mas katim dispela diwai. Watpo em i pinisim nating gris bilong graun?'

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered, ‘Lord, leave it alone this year also, until I dig around it, and fertilize it.

block.text: Na wokman i bekim tok bilong em olsem, 'Bikman, larim em i stap dispela wanpela yia moa. Bai mi brukim graun long as bilong en na putim pekpek bilong bulmakau.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If it bears fruit, fine; but if not, after that, you can cut it down.’”

block.text: Ating em bai inap karim kaikai long yia bihain. Na sapos nogat, orait yu ken katim.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath day.

block.text: Long de Sabat Jisas i givim tok long ol manmeri insait long wanpela haus lotu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, there was a woman who had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years, and she was bent over, and could in no way straighten herself up.

block.text: Na wanpela meri i stap, em i gat wanpela spirit nogut i stap long en, na dispela spirit i bin givim sik long em inap long 18 yia. Olsem na bun bilong baksait bilong dispela meri em i krungut, na em i no inap tru long sanap stret.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus saw her, he called her, and said to her,

block.text: Jisas i lukim em, na i singautim em i kam, na i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woman, you are freed from your infirmity.”

block.text: "Meri, mi tekewe pinis sik bilong yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He laid his hands on her and immediately she stood up straight and exclaimed:

block.text: Na em i putim han antap long dispela meri, na wantu tasol meri i sanap stret na i litimapim nem bilong God.

block.characterId: woman who could not straighten up

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: woman who could not straighten up
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Glory be to God!”
The ruler of the synagogue, being indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath, said to the multitude,

block.text: Tasol hetman bilong haus lotu em i belhat long Jisas i mekim orait dispela meri long de Sabat. Olsem na hetman i tokim ol manmeri olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “There are six days in which men ought to work. Therefore come on those days and be healed, and not on the Sabbath day!”

block.text: "I gat 6 -pela de bilong mekim wok. Sapos yupela i laikim man I tekewe sik bilong yupela, orait yupela i mas i kam long de bilong wok. Tasol maski askim man long tekewe sik bilong yupela long de Sabat."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore the Lord answered him,

block.text: Orait Bikpela i bekim tok bilong em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You hypocrites! Doesn’t each one of you free his ox or his donkey from the stall on the Sabbath, and lead him away to water?

block.text: "Yupela i man bilong giaman. Tok bilong yupela na pasin bilong yupela i no wankain. Long de Sabat yupela olgeta i save go long haus bulmakau na lusim ol bulmakau na donki bilong yupela, na kisim ol i go bilong dring wara.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Ought not this woman, being a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan had bound eighteen long years, be freed from this bondage on the Sabbath day?”

block.text: Tasol dispela meri hia, em i wanpela pikinini bilong Abraham. Na Satan i bin pasim em inap long 18 yia. Orait olsem wanem? Sapos mi laik lusim dispela samting i bin pasim em, mi no inap mekim long de Sabat, a?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he said these things, all his adversaries were disappointed, and all the multitude rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by him.
He said,

block.text: Em i tok olsem, na ol birua bilong en ol i sem nogut. Na olgeta manmeri ol i amamas long olgeta dispela gutpela samting tru em i mekim.
Jisas i tok moa olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What is the Kingdom of God like? To what shall I compare it?

block.text: "Kingdom bilong God i olsem wanem samting? Bai mi mekim wanem kain tok piksa?

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is like a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and put in his own garden. It grew, and became a large tree, and the birds of the sky lodged in its branches.”

block.text: Em i olsem pikinini bilong dispela kain sayor ol i kolim mastet. Wanpela man i kisim pikinini bilong mastet na i planim long gaden bilong en. Na bihain mastet i kamap bikpela olsem diwai na ol pisin i kam wokim haus bilong ol long ol han bilong en."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again he said,

block.text: Na Jisas i tok moa olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “To what shall I compare the Kingdom of God?

block.text: "Bai mi mekim wanem kain tok piksa long kingdom bilong God?

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is like yeast, which a woman took and hid in three measures of flour, until it was all leavened.”

block.text: Em i olsem yis. Wanpela meri i kisim dispela yis na i tanim wantaim bikpela dram plaua. Na bihain dispela plaua olgeta i solap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went on his way through cities and villages, teaching, and traveling on to Jerusalem.
One said to him,

block.text: Jisas I wokabaut i go long rot bilong Jerusalem. Na em i go long ol taun na ples na skulim ol manmeri.
Na wanpela man i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, are only a few people going to be saved?”

block.text: "Bikpela, ating God bai I kisim bek wan wan man tasol, a?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Strive to enter in by the narrow door, for many, I tell you, will seek to enter in, and will not be able.

block.text: "Yupela i mas taitim bun tru, bilong i go insait long liklik dua. Mi tokim yupela, planti man bai i laik i go insait, tasol bai ol i no inap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When once the master of the house has risen up, and has shut the door, and you begin to stand outside, and to knock at the door, saying, ‘Lord, Lord, open to us!’ then he will answer and tell you, ‘I don’t know you or where you come from.’

block.text: Bihain papa bilong haus bai i kirap na i pasim dua bilong haus. Na yupela bai i kam sanap ausait na paitim dua na singaut olsem, 'Bikpela, opim dua long mipela.' Na em bai i bekim tok olsem long yupela, 'Mi no save long yupela, yupela i bilong wanem hap.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then you will begin to say, ‘We ate and drank in your presence, and you taught in our streets.’

block.text: Na yupela bai i tokim em olsem, 'Mipela i bin kaikai na dring wantaim yu, na yu bin sanap long rot bilong mipela na skulim mipela.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: He will say, ‘I tell you, I don’t know where you come from. Depart from me, all you workers of iniquity.’

block.text: Tasol em bai i tokim yupela olsem, 'Mi no save long yupela, yupela ol lain bilong wanem hap. Yupela ol man bilong mekim pasin nogut, yupela olgeta klia long mi.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth, when you see Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and all the prophets, in the Kingdom of God, and yourselves being thrown outside.

block.text: Yupela bai i lukim Abraham na Aisak na Jekop na olgeta profet ol i stap insait long kingdom bilong God, tasol yupela yet ol bai i rausim na yupela bai i stap ausait. Na yupela bai i krai nogut na skrapim tit bilong yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will come from the east, west, north, and south, and will sit down in the Kingdom of God.

block.text: Na ol manmeri bai i lusim ol kantri i stap long hap sankamap na long hap san i go daun na long hap not na hap saut, na ol bai i kam sindaun long kaikai insait long kingdom bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, there are some who are last who will be first, and there are some who are first who will be last.”

block.text: Na harim. Sampela man nau ol i stap las tru, ol bai i kamap namba wan. Na sampela man nau i stap namba wan, ol bai i stap las tru."

ReferenceBlocks.text: On that same day, some Pharisees came, saying to him,

block.text: Long dispela taim stret sampela Farisi i kam, na ol i tokim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Get out of here, and go away, for Herod wants to kill you.”

block.text: "Yu mas lusim dispela ples na yu go long narapela hap, long wanem, Herot i laik kilim yu i dai."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go and tell that fox, ‘Behold, I cast out demons and perform cures today and tomorrow, and the third day I complete my mission.

block.text: "Yupela go tokim dispela weldok nogut olsem, 'Harim. Nau na tumora bai mi rausim ol spirit nogut na mekim orait ol sikman. Na long de namba 3 bai mi pinisim wok bilong mi.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nevertheless I must go on my way today and tomorrow and the next day, for it can’t be that a prophet perish outside of Jerusalem.’”

block.text: Tasol nau na tumora na haptumora mi mas wokabaut i go. Long wanem, profet i no ken i stap long narapela ples na ol i kilim em i dai. Nogat. Ol i mas kilim em i dai long Jerusalem tasol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Jerusalem, Jerusalem, that kills the prophets, and stones those who are sent to her! How often I wanted to gather your children together, like a hen gathers her own brood under her wings, and you refused!

block.text: "Jerusalem, Jerusalem, yu save kilim ol profet i dai, na yu save kisim ol man God i salim i kam long yu na tromoi ston long ol bilong kilim ol i dai. Planti taim moa mi laik bungim ol pikinini bilong yu, olsem kakaruk meri i save bungim ol pikinini bilong en aninit long wing bilong en. Tasol yupela i no laik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, your house is left to you desolate. I tell you, you will not see me, until you say, ‘Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!’”

block.text: Harim. Nau ples bilong yupela bai i bagarap na i stap nating. Mi tok stret long yupela, yupela bai i no lukim mi inap long taim yupela bai i tok, 'God i ken mekim gut long dispela man i kam long nem bilong Bikpela!' "

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE 14
It happened, when he went into the house of one of the rulers of the Pharisees on a Sabbath to eat bread, that they were watching him.

block.text: Long wanpela de Sabat Jisas i go kaikai long haus bilong wanpela hetman bilong ol Farisi. Na ol i was tru long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, a certain man who had dropsy was in front of him.

block.text: Na wanpela man, skin bilong en i solap nogut, em i stap klostu long Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, answering, spoke to the lawyers and Pharisees, saying,

block.text: Jisas i lukim dispela man, na em i askim ol saveman bilong lo na ol Farisi olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath?”

block.text: "Ating yumi ken mekim orait ol sikman long de Sabat, o nogat?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they were silent. He took him, and healed him, and let him go.
He answered them,

block.text: Tasol ol i pasim maus na ol i no bekim tok. Olsem na em i kisim dispela man na i mekim em i orait na i larim em i go.
Na em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Which of you, if your son or an ox fell into a well, wouldn’t immediately pull him out on a Sabbath day?”

block.text: "Sapos wanpela bilong yupela i lukim pikinini man bilong en o bulmakau bilong en i pundaun long hul wara long de Sabat, ating em bai i pulim dispela pikinini o bulmakau i kam antap kwiktaim, o nogat?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They couldn’t answer him regarding these things.

block.text: Na ol i no inap bekim dispela tok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He spoke a parable to those who were invited, when he noticed how they chose the best seats, and said to them,

block.text: Jisas i lukim ol man i kam long dispela kaikai, ol i laik sindaun long ol namba wan sia tasol. Olsem na em i givim wanpela tok piksa long ol. Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When you are invited by anyone to a marriage feast, don’t sit in the best seat, since perhaps someone more honorable than you might be invited by him.

block.text: "Sapos wanpela man i singautim yu na yu go long bikpela kaikai bilong marit, yu no ken i go sindaun long namba wan sia. Nogut ol i makim pinis dispela sia long narapela man i gat biknem i winim nem bilong yu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The one who invited both of you would come and tell you, ‘Make room for this person.’ Then you would begin, with shame, to take the lowest place.

block.text: Na bihain man i bin singautim yu em bai i kam tokim yu olsem, 'Yu givim dispela namba wan sia long dispela man.' Na bai yu sem nogut tru na yu go sindaun long baksait tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when you are invited, go and sit in the lowest place, so that when he who invited you comes, he may tell you, ‘Friend, move up higher.’ Then you will be honored in the presence of all who sit at the table with you.

block.text: Olsem na sapos wanpela man i singautim yu na yu go long kaikai, yu mas i go sindaun long baksait tru. Yu mekim olsem, na dispela man i bin singautim yu em bai i kam na tokim yu, 'Pren, yu kam sindaun long namba wan sia.' Em i mekim olsem, na bai yu kisim biknem long ai bilong olgeta man i kaikai wantaim yu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted.”

block.text: Man i litimapim nem bilong em yet, bai God i daunim em. Tasol man i daunim em yet, bai God i litimapim em i go antap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He also said to the one who had invited him,

block.text: Jisas i tokim dispela man i bin singautim em i kam long dispela kaikai olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When you make a dinner or a supper, don’t call your friends, nor your brothers, nor your kinsmen, nor rich neighbors, or perhaps they might also return the favor, and pay you back.

block.text: "Sapos yu mekim wanpela kaikai, yu no ken singautim ol pren na brata na wanlain bilong yu, na ol wanples i gat planti mani. Nogut bihain ol i singautim yu na yu go kaikai long haus bilong ol, na ol i bekim kaikai long yu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when you make a feast, ask the poor, the maimed, the lame, or the blind;

block.text: Nogat. Sapos yu mekim bikpela kaikai, orait yu mas singautim ol rabisman na ol man bodi bilong ol i bagarap na ol lek nogut na ol aipas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: and you will be blessed, because they don’t have the resources to repay you. For you will be repaid in the resurrection of the righteous.”

block.text: Ol dispela kain man i no inap bekim kaikai long yu. Olsem na bai yu ken amamas, long wanem, bihain God bai i bekim dispela kaikai long yu, long taim ol stretpela man i kirap bek long matmat."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When one of those who sat at the table with him heard these things, he said to him,

block.text: Wanpela bilong ol dispela man i kaikai wantaim Jisas, em I harim dispela tok na em i tokim Jisas olsem,

block.characterId: one at table of Pharisee (expert in religious law)

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: one at table of Pharisee (expert in religious law)
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Blessed is he who will feast in the Kingdom of God!”

block.text: "Ol manmeri bai i sindaun kaikai insait long kingdom bilong God, ol i ken amamas."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said to him,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A certain man made a great supper, and he invited many people.

block.text: "Wanpela man i laik mekim bikpela kaikai, na em i singautim planti man long kam long dispela kaikai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent out his servant at supper time to tell those who were invited, ‘Come, for everything is ready now.’

block.text: Orait long de em i makim bilong mekim dispela kaikai, em i tokim wokboi bilong en long go lukim ol man bipo em i bin singautim. Na wokboi i mas tokim ol olsem, 'Yupela kam. Olgeta samting i redi pinis.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: They all as one began to make excuses. The first said to him, ‘I have bought a field, and I must go and see it. Please have me excused.’”

block.text: Tasol olgeta dispela man i tok long ol i no inap i go. Wanpela man i tok, 'Mi baim pinis wanpela gaden, na mi mas i go lukim. Sori tru, mi no inap i kam.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Another said, ‘I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I must go try them out. Please have me excused.’”

block.text: Na narapela i tok, 'Mi baim 10 -pela bulmakau bilong wok, na mi laik i go traim ol. Sori tru, mi no inap i kam.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Another said, ‘I have married a wife, and therefore I can’t come.’”

block.text: Na narapela i tok, 'Nau tasol mi marit. Olsem na mi no inap i kam.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “That servant came, and told his lord these things. Then the master of the house, being angry, said to his servant, ‘Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city, and bring in the poor, maimed, blind, and lame.’”

block.text: "Orait wokboi i bringim ol dispela tok i go bek long bikman bilong en. Taim bikman i harim ol dispela tok, em i belhat na i tokim wokboi bilong en olsem, 'Yu go kwiktaim long olgeta bikpela rot na olgeta liklik rot bilong dispela taun, na yu kisim ol rabisman, na ol man bodi bilong ol i bagarap, na ol aipas na ol lek nogut, na yu bringim ol i kam insait long haus bilong mi.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The servant said, ‘Lord, it is done as you commanded, and there is still room.’”

block.text: "Orait wokboi i mekim olsem pinis, na em i tok, 'Bikman, mi mekim pinis olsem yu tok, tasol haus i no pulap yet.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The lord said to the servant, ‘Go out into the highways and hedges, and compel them to come in, that my house may be filled.

block.text: "Na bikman i tokim wokboi olsem, 'Yu lusim taun na yu go long olgeta bikrot na yu bihainim banis bilong ol gaden, na taim yu lukim ol manmeri yu tok strong long ol i mas kam long kaikai bilong mi. Mi laik bai haus bilong mi i pulap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I tell you that none of those men who were invited will taste of my supper.’”

block.text: Mi tokim yupela, olgeta dispela man bipo mi bin singautim, ol bai i no inap tru long kisim wanpela liklik hap kaikai bilong mi.' "

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now great multitudes were going with him. He turned and said to them,

block.text: Bikpela lain manmeri i wokabaut wantaim Jisas, na em i tanim na i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If anyone comes to me, and doesn’t disregard his own father, mother, wife, children, brothers, and sisters, yes, and his own life also, he can’t be my disciple.

block.text: "Sapos man i kam long mi, tasol em i no birua long papa na mama na meri na ol pikinini na brata na susa bilong em, na long laip bilong em yet tu, orait em i no inap i stap disaipel bilong mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever doesn’t bear his own cross, and come after me, can’t be my disciple.

block.text: Na man i no karim diwai kros bilong en na bihainim mi, em i no inap i stap disaipel bilong mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For which of you, desiring to build a tower, doesn’t first sit down and count the cost, to see if he has enough to complete it?

block.text: "Sapos wanpela bilong yupela i laik wokim wanpela haus bilong ol man i ken i stap na was long ol samting bilong en, orait ating em bai i sindaun pastaim na tingim gut pe bilong wokim dispela haus. Em i laik save, mani bilong en bai inap long pinisim dispela haus, o nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or perhaps, when he has laid a foundation, and is not able to finish, everyone who sees begins to mock him,
saying, ‘This man began to build, and wasn’t able to finish.’

block.text: Sapos em i no mekim olsem pastaim, na em i putim simen na bihain em i no inap pinisim dispela haus, orait olgeta man i lukim, ol bai i tok bilas long em.
Ol bai i tok, 'Dispela man i statim dispela haus, tasol em i no inap pinisim.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or what king, as he goes to encounter another king in war, will not sit down first and consider whether he is able with ten thousand to meet him who comes against him with twenty thousand?

block.text: "Na sapos wanpela king i laik i go pait long narapela king, orait em bai i sindaun pastaim na tingting gut. Ating em yet i gat 10 tausen soldia bilong en, na narapela king em i kam wantaim 20 tausen soldia. Olsem na em i laik save pastaim, bai em inap pait long dispela arapela king na rausim em, o nogat?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or else, while the other is yet a great way off, he sends an envoy, and asks for conditions of peace.

block.text: Na sapos em i ting em i no inap, orait taim birua bilong en i stap longwe yet, em bai i salim ol man i go long em na traim toktok bilong mekim pait i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So therefore whoever of you who doesn’t renounce all that he has, he can’t be my disciple.

block.text: "Olsem tasol, sapos wanpela bilong yupela i no givim baksait long olgeta samting bilong en, orait em i no inap i stap disaipel bilong mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Salt is good, but if the salt becomes flat and tasteless, with what do you season it?

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Sol em i gutpela samting. Tasol sapos pait bilong sol em i lus pinis, orait bai yumi mekim wanem na dispela sol i kamap gutpela gen?

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is fit neither for the soil nor for the manure pile. It is thrown out. He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”

block.text: Kain sol olsem em i no inap helpim kaikai i kamap long gaden. Na i no inap long yumi bungim wantaim pekpek bilong bulmakau na putim long gaden. Nogat. Yumi save rausim nating tasol. Man i gat yau em i mas harim dispela tok."

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE 15
Now all the tax collectors and sinners were coming close to him to hear him.

block.text: Ol man bilong kisim takis na ol man bilong mekim sin ol i kam klostu long Jisas bilong harim tok bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Pharisees and the scribes murmured, saying,

block.text: Na ol Farisi na ol saveman bilong lo ol i tok kros olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man welcomes sinners, and eats with them.”

block.text: "Dispela man i save pren wantaim ol man bilong mekim sin na em i save kaikai wantaim ol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He told them this parable.

block.text: Olsem na Jisas i givim dispela tok piksa long ol,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Which of you men, if you had one hundred sheep, and lost one of them, wouldn’t leave the ninety-nine in the wilderness, and go after the one that was lost, until he found it?

block.text: "Sapos wanpela bilong yupela i gat 100 sipsip, na sapos wanpela sipsip i lus, orait ating em bai i lusim ol 99 sipsip i kaikai i stap long wanpela hap. Na em bai i go painim dispela wanpela sipsip inap em i lukim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he has found it, he carries it on his shoulders, rejoicing.

block.text: Taim em i kisim sipsip pinis, orait em bai i slipim long sol bilong en, na em bai i amamas na karim i kam bek long ples.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he comes home, he calls together his friends and his neighbors, saying to them, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found my sheep which was lost!’

block.text: Na taim em i kamap long haus bilong en, em bai i singautim ol pren na wanples bilong en, na ol i kam bung. Na em bai i tokim ol, 'Yupela amamas wantaim mi! Wanpela sipsip bilong mi em i lus, na mi painim na kisim bek pinis!'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you that even so there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents, than over ninety-nine righteous people who need no repentance.

block.text: "Mi tok stret long yupela, wankain amamas i save kamap long heven taim wanpela man bilong mekim sin i tanim bel. Tru, ol i save amamas long 99 man i stretpela pinis na i no gat wok long tanim bel. Tasol sapos wanpela man bilong mekim sin em i tanim bel, orait ol i save amamas moa moa yet."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or what woman, if she had ten drachma coins, if she lost one drachma coin, wouldn’t light a lamp, sweep the house, and seek diligently until she found it?

block.text: Na Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Na sapos wanpela meri em i gat 10 -pela wan kina mani, na wanpela i lus long haus, orait bai em i mekim wanem nau? Em bai i laitim lam na brumim haus na lukluk gut, na i wok i go inap long em i kisim bek mani bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When she has found it, she calls together her friends and neighbors, saying, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found the drachma which I had lost.’

block.text: Taim em i kisim mani pinis, orait em bai i singautim ol pren na wanples bilong en, na ol i kam bung. Na em bai i tokim ol, 'Yupela amamas wantaim mi! Wanpela mani bilong mi em i lus, tasol nau mi painim na kisim bek pinis!'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even so, I tell you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner repenting.”

block.text: Na Jisas i tok olsem, "Mi tok stret long yupela, wankain amamas i save kamap namel long ol ensel bilong God taim wanpela man bilong mekim sin em i tanim bel."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Na Jisas i tok moa olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A certain man had two sons.
The younger of them said to his father, ‘Father, give me my share of your property.’ He divided his livelihood between them.

block.text: "Wanpela man i gat tupela pikinini man.

Na namba 2 pikinini i tokim papa olsem, 'Papa, mi ting long olgeta samting yu laik tilim long mi wantaim brata bilong mi. Hap bilong mi, mi laik bai yu givim long mi nau.' Orait papa i tilim olgeta samting bilong en i go long tupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Not many days after, the younger son gathered all of this together and traveled into a far country. There he wasted his property with riotous living.

block.text: I no longtaim, na dispela namba 2 pikinini i bungim olgeta samting bilong en na i salim long ol man. Na em i kisim mani na i go i stap long wanpela longwe ples. Em i stap long dispela ples, na em i mekim ol kain kain hambak pasin, na olgeta mani bilong en i pinis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had spent all of it, there arose a severe famine in that country, and he began to be in need.
