block.text: Na taim olgeta mani bilong en i pinis, taim bilong bikpela hangre i kamap long dispela ples. Na em i no gat wanpela samting.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went and joined himself to one of the citizens of that country, and he sent him into his fields to feed pigs.

block.text: Olsem na em i go kisim wok long wanpela man bilong dispela ples. Na dispela man i salim em i go long banis pik bilong en bilong lukautim ol pik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He wanted to fill his belly with the husks that the pigs ate, but no one gave him any.

block.text: Em i lukim ol pik i kaikai ol skin bilong bin, na em i gat bikpela laik tru long kisim sampela na pulapim bel bilong en. Tasol i no gat wanpela man i givim kaikai long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when he came to himself he said, ‘How many hired servants of my father’s have bread enough to spare, and I’m dying with hunger!

block.text: "Orait nau em i kisim stretpela tingting, na em i tok, 'Olgeta wokboi bilong papa bilong mi ol i gat planti kaikai tru. Tasol mi stap hia na mi bagarap tru long hangre.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I will get up and go to my father, and will tell him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and in your sight.

block.text: Maski, bai mi kirap na mi go bek long papa bilong mi. Na bai mi tokim em olsem, "Papa, mi bin mekim sin long God na long yu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I am no more worthy to be called your son. Make me as one of your hired servants.’”

block.text: Nau mi no gutpela man moa inap long yu kolim mi pikinini bilong yu. Yu larim mi i stap olsem wanpela wokboi bilong yu.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He arose, and came to his father. But while he was still far off, his father saw him, and was moved with compassion, and ran, and fell on his neck, and kissed him.

block.text: Orait em i kirap na i go long papa bilong en. Taim em i stap long we yet na papa i lukim em i wokabut i kam. Na bel bilong papa i sori tumas long em. Na papa i ran i go, na i holimpas pikinini na i givim kis long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven, and in your sight. I am no longer worthy to be called your son.’”

block.text: Na pikinini i tokim em olsem, 'Papa, mi bin mekim sin long God na long yu. Nau mi no gutpela man moa inap long yu kolim mi pikinini bilong yu.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But the father said to his servants, ‘Bring out the best robe, and put it on him. Put a ring on his hand, and shoes on his feet.

block.text: Tasol papa i singautim ol wokboi bilong en i kam na em i tokim ol olsem, 'Yupela kisim namba wan longpela klos bilong mi na bringim i kam kwiktaim na pasim long em. Na putim wanpela ring long pinga bilong em. Na putim su long lek bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Bring the fattened calf, kill it, and let us eat, and celebrate;

block.text: Na yupela go kisim dispela patpela pikinini bulmakau i kam na kilim. Bai yumi kaikai na amamas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: for this, my son, was dead, and is alive again. He was lost, and is found.’ They began to celebrate.”

block.text: Long wanem, dispela pikinini bilong mi em i dai pinis, tasol nau em i kisim laip gen. Em i lus pinis, tasol yumi kisim bek.' Orait na ol i mekim bikpela kaikai na amamas i stap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now his elder son was in the field. As he came near to the house, he heard music and dancing.

block.text: "Orait long dispela taim namba wan pikinini em i stap long gaden. Bihain em i kam bek, na i kamap klostu long haus, na em i harim musik na em i harim ol manmeri i wok long danis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He called one of the servants to him, and asked what was going on.

block.text: Orait em i singautim wanpela wokboi, na i askim em olsem, 'Ol i mekim wanem?'

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him, ‘Your brother has come, and your father has killed the fattened calf, because he has received him back safe and healthy.’

block.text: Na wokboi i tokim em, 'Brata bilong yu i kam bek pinis, na papa bilong yu i kilim patpela pikinini bulmakau, long wanem, papa em i amamas long lukim pikinini i stap gut na i kam bek pinis.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he was angry, and would not go in. Therefore his father came out, and begged him.

block.text: Namba wan pikinini i harim dispela tok, orait em i belhat, na i no laik i go insait long haus. Orait papa bilong en i kam ausait na i givim gutpela tok long em bilong daunim belhat bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered his father, ‘Behold, these many years I have served you, and I never disobeyed a commandment of yours, but you never gave me a goat, that I might celebrate with my friends.

block.text: Tasol em i bekim tok bilong papa olsem, 'Olsem wanem? Planti yia mi hatwok tru long mekim wok bilong yu, olsem wanpela wokboi nating. Na mi no save sakim tok bilong yu. Na i no gat wanpela taim yu bin givim mi wanpela liklik pikinini meme tasol, bai mi ken amamas wantaim ol pren bilong mi. Nogat tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when this, your son, came, who has devoured your living with prostitutes, you killed the fattened calf for him.’”

block.text: Tasol dispela pikinini bilong yu, em i pinisim pinis olgeta samting bilong yu long ol pamukmeri. Na nau em i kam bek, na yu laik amamasim em na yu kilim patpela pikinini bulmakau.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He said to him, ‘Son, you are always with me, and all that is mine is yours.

block.text: "Na papa i tokim em olsem, 'Pikinini, oltaim yu save stap wantaim mi. Na olgeta samting bilong mi em i bilong yu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But it was appropriate to celebrate and be glad, for this, your brother, was dead, and is alive again. He was lost, and is found.’”

block.text: Tasol nau yumi mas amamas, na bel bilong yumi i mas gutpela, long wanem, brata bilong yu i dai pinis, tasol nau em i kisim laip gen. Em i lus pinis, tasol nau yumi kisim em bek.' "

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE 16
Jesus told his disciples,

block.text: Jisas i tokim ol disaipel bilong en olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “There was a certain rich man who had a manager. An accusation was made to him that this man was wasting his possessions.

block.text: "Wanpela maniman em i gat bosboi bilong en i stap. Na sampela man i kam long dispela maniman na ol i sutim tok long bosboi olsem, 'Bosboi bilong yu em i pinisim nating ol samting bilong yu.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: He called him, and said to him, ‘What is this that I hear about you? Give an accounting of your management, for you can no longer be manager.’”

block.text: Olsem na maniman i singautim bosboi i kam na i tokim em, 'Olsem wanem long dispela tok mi harim long pasin bilong yu? Yu go wokim wanpela ripot long olgeta samting bilong mi i stap long han bilong yu. Yu no inap i stap bosboi moa.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The manager said within himself, ‘What will I do, seeing that my lord is taking away the management position from me? I don’t have strength to dig. I am ashamed to beg.

block.text: "Orait dispela bosboi i tokim em yet olsem, 'Bai mi mekim wanem nau? Bikman em i laik rausim mi long wok bosboi. Mi no gat strong bilong kamap leba bilong wanpela man na mekim wok bilong brukim graun. Na mi sem long askim ol arapela man long givim mani samting long mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I know what I will do, so that when I am removed from management, they may receive me into their houses.’

block.text: Tasol nau mi save long samting mi mas mekim, bai ol man i ken kisim mi i go long haus bilong ol long taim bikman i rausim mi long wok bosboi.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: Calling each one of his lord’s debtors to him, he said to the first, ‘How much do you owe to my lord?’

block.text: Olsem na em i singautim ol wan wan man i bin dinau long bikman bilong en, na ol i kam long em. Wanpela man i kamap paslain, na bosboi i askim em, 'Yu bin kisim hamas dinau long bikman bilong mi?'

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said, ‘A hundred batos of oil.’ He said to him, ‘Take your bill, and sit down quickly and write fifty.’

block.text: Na em i tok, ' 100 dram wel.' Na bosboi i tokim em, 'Yu kisim dispela pepa ol i bin raitim dinau bilong yu long en, na yu sindaun kwik na yu raitim 50 tasol.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said to another, ‘How much do you owe?’ He said, ‘A hundred cors of wheat.’ He said to him, ‘Take your bill, and write eighty.’”

block.text: Bihain narapela man i kamap, na bosboi i askim em, 'Dinau bilong yu hamas?' Na em i tok, ' 100 bek wit.' Na bosboi i tokim em, 'Yu kisim dispela pepa ol i bin raitim dinau bilong yu long en, na yu raitim 80 tasol.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “His lord commended the dishonest manager because he had done wisely, for the children of this world are, in their own generation, wiser than the children of the light.

block.text: "Na bihain, taim bikman i painimaut long dispela samting bosboi i bin mekim, em i litimapim nem bilong dispela bosboi nogut, long wanem, em i mekim pasin olsem man i gat tingting. Ol man i save bihainim pasin bilong dispela graun ol i save tru long ol kain kain rot bilong mekim wok bilong ol, na ol i winim ol man i save bihainim pasin bilong lait.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you, make for yourselves friends by means of unrighteous mammon, so that when you fail, they may receive you into the eternal tents.

block.text: "Na mi tokim yupela, long mani nogut bilong dispela graun yupela i mas mekim ol manmeri i kamap pren bilong yupela. Na bihain, taim dispela taim bilong holim mani em i pinis, orait ol i ken kisim yupela i go long ol haus i stap gut oltaim oltaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who is faithful in a very little is faithful also in much. He who is dishonest in a very little is also dishonest in much.

block.text: "Sapos wanpela man i save lukaut gut long ol liklik samting, orait em bai i lukaut gut long ol bikpela samting tu. Na man i save mekim pasin i no stret long ol liklik samting, em bai i mekim pasin i no stret long ol bikpela samting tu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If therefore you have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will commit to your trust the true riches?

block.text: Sapos yupela i no save lukaut gut long mani nogut bilong dispela graun, orait husat bai i givim samting tru long yupela bilong lukautim?

ReferenceBlocks.text: If you have not been faithful in that which is another’s, who will give you that which is your own?

block.text: Na sapos yupela i no lukautim gut ol samting bilong narapela man, orait husat bai i givim yupela ol samting bilong yupela yet?

ReferenceBlocks.text: No servant can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to one, and despise the other. You aren’t able to serve God and mammon.”

block.text: "I no gat wanpela wokboi inap i stap aninit long tupela bosman wantaim. Bai em i laikim wanpela na bel nogut long narapela. Bai em i harim tok bilong wanpela na givim baksait long narapela. Yupela i no inap i stap aninit long God na long mani wantaim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Pharisees, who were lovers of money, also heard all these things, and they scoffed at him.

block.text: Ol Farisi i save laikim mani, olsem na taim ol i harim olgeta dispela tok Jisas I mekim, ol i tok bilas long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Tasol em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are those who justify yourselves in the sight of men, but God knows your hearts. For that which is exalted among men is an abomination in the sight of God.

block.text: "Yupela i laik bai ol man i ting, yupela i man bilong mekim stretpela pasin tasol. Tasol God i save long ol samting i stap hait long bel bilong yupela. Samting ol man i ting em i gutpela samting tru, em i samting nogut tru long ai bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The law and the prophets were until John. From that time the Good News of the Kingdom of God is preached, and everyone is forcing his way into it.

block.text: "Tok bilong lo wantaim tok bilong ol profet em i stap inap long taim bilong Jon. Tasol stat long taim bilong Jon, gutnius bilong kingdom bilong God em i kamap long olgeta ples. Na olgeta man ol i strong tumas long i go insait long dispela kingdom.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But it is easier for heaven and earth to pass away, than for one tiny stroke of a pen in the law to fall.

block.text: "Skai wantaim graun bai inap lus. Tasol i no gat wanpela liklik hap tok bilong lo bilong God bai i lus."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Everyone who divorces his wife, and marries another, commits adultery. He who marries one who is divorced from a husband commits adultery.”

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Wanem man i lusim meri bilong en na i maritim narapela meri, em i mekim pasin pamuk. Na man i maritim wanpela meri, bipo man bilong en i bin lusim em, em tu i mekim pasin pamuk."

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now there was a certain rich man, and he was clothed in purple and fine linen, living in luxury every day.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Bipo wanpela maniman i stap, na oltaim em i save putim naispela naispela siot na gutpela retpela klos. Na olgeta de em i save kisim gutpela gutpela kaikai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A certain beggar, named Lazarus, was laid at his gate, full of sores.

block.text: A certain beggar, named Lazarus, was laid at his gate, full of sores.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was desiring to be fed with the crumbs that fell from the rich man’s table. Yes, even the dogs came and licked his sores.

block.text: He was desiring to be fed with the crumbs that fell from the rich man's table. Yes, even the dogs came and licked his sores.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened that the beggar died, and that he was carried away by the angels to Abraham’s bosom. The rich man also died, and was buried.

block.text: "Bihain dispela rabisman i dai, na ol ensel i karim em i go na putim em i stap wantaim Abraham. Na dispela maniman em tu i dai, na ol i planim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In Hades, he lifted up his eyes, being in torment, and saw Abraham far off, and Lazarus at his bosom.

block.text: Em i stap long ples bilong ol man i dai pinis na em i gat bikpela pen. Em i lukluk i go antap, na em i lukim Abraham i stap longwe tumas, na Lasarus i stap wantaim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He cried and said, ‘Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus, that he may dip the tip of his finger in water, and cool my tongue! For I am in anguish in this flame.’”

block.text: Orait maniman i singaut olsem, 'Papa Abraham, yu mas sori long mi na tokim Lasarus long kisim liklik wara long pinga bilong en na kam putim long tang bilong mi bai em i kol liklik. Mi stap long dispela paia na mi pilim pen nogut tru.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But Abraham said, ‘Son, remember that you, in your lifetime, received your good things, and Lazarus, in the same way, bad things. But now here he is comforted and you are in anguish.

block.text: "Tasol Abraham i tok, 'Pikinini, yu mas tingim wanpela samting. Taim yu stap laip, yu bin kisim olgeta gutpela samting. Na Lasarus em i kisim olgeta samting nogut. Tasol nau long dispela ples, bel bilong en i stap gutpela. Na yu kisim pen nogut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Besides all this, between us and you there is a great gulf fixed, that those who want to pass from here to you are not able, and that none may cross over from there to us.’”

block.text: Na narapela samting tu. Namel long mipela na yupela God i bin putim wanpela bikpela baret. Olsem na ol man i stap hia na i laik brukim dispela baret na i go long yupela, ol i no inap. Na ol man i stap long hap, ol i no inap brukim baret na i kam long mipela.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He said, ‘I ask you therefore, father, that you would send him to my father’s house.

block.text: "Na maniman i tok, 'Sapos olsem, orait papa, mi askim yu, inap yu salim Lasarus i go long haus bilong papa bilong mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I have five brothers. Let him testify to them so that they won’t also come into this place of torment.’”

block.text: Mi gat 5 -pela brata. Na Lasarus em i mas givim strongpela tok long ol i mas stretim pasin bilong ol. Nogut ol tu i kam long dispela ples bilong kisim bikpela pen.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But Abraham said to him, ‘They have Moses and the prophets. Let them listen to them.’”

block.text: Tasol Abraham i tok, 'Tok bilong Moses na bilong ol profet i stap. Ol i ken putim yau long dispela.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He said, ‘No, father Abraham, but if one goes to them from the dead, they will repent.’”

block.text: Na maniman i tok, 'Papa Abraham, nogat. Em i no inap. Tasol sapos wanpela man i dai pinis, em i kirap long matmat na i go long ol, orait ol bai inap tanim bel.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He said to him, ‘If they don’t listen to Moses and the prophets, neither will they be persuaded if one rises from the dead.’”

block.text: "Na Abraham i tokim em olsem, 'Sapos ol i no save harim tok bilong Moses na bilong ol profet, orait maski sapos wanpela man i kirap bek long matmat, dispela tu bai i no inap mekim ol i bilip.' "

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE 17
He said to the disciples,

block.text: Jisas i tokim ol disaipel bilong en olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is impossible that no occasions of stumbling should come, but woe to him through whom they come!

block.text: "Ol kain kain samting bai i kamap bilong mekim ol manmeri i pundaun long sin. Tasol sori tumas long man i mekim ol dispela samting i kamap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It would be better for him if a millstone were hung around his neck, and he were thrown into the sea, rather than that he should cause one of these little ones to stumble.

block.text: Sapos em i mekim wanpela bilong ol dispela liklik pikinini i pundaun long sin, orait mobeta ol man i pasim wanpela bikpela ston long nek bilong em na tromoi em i go daun long solwara na bai em i dai. Olsem na yupela lukaut gut long yupela yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Be careful. If your brother sins against you, rebuke him. If he repents, forgive him.

block.text: "Sapos brata bilong yu i mekim sin, yu mas tokim em long stretim pasin bilong em. Na sapos em i tanim bel, orait yu mas lusim sin bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If he sins against you seven times in the day, and seven times returns, saying, ‘I repent,’ you shall forgive him.”

block.text: Na sapos em i mekim sin long yu inap 7 -pela taim long wanpela de, na 7 -pela taim em i kam bek long yu na i tok, 'Mi sori,' orait yu mas lusim sin bilong en."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The apostles said to the Lord,

block.text: Ol aposel i tokim Bikpela olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Increase our faith.”

block.text: "Yu mas mekim bilip bilong mipela i kamap bikpela moa."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord said,

block.text: Na Bikpela i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you had faith like a grain of mustard seed, you would tell this sycamore tree, ‘Be uprooted, and be planted in the sea,’ and it would obey you.

block.text: "Maski sapos bilip bilong yupela em i liklik tru inap olsem pikinini bilong dispela kain sayor ol i kolim mastet, yupela bai inap tokim dispela diwai, 'Yu kamautim ol rop bilong yu na yu go sanap i stap long solwara,' na diwai bai i bihainim tok bilong yupela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But who is there among you, having a servant plowing or keeping sheep, that will say, when he comes in from the field, ‘Come immediately and sit down at the table,’

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Sapos wanpela man namel long yupela i tokim wokboi long i go brukim graun long gaden o long i go lukautim ol sipsip, orait taim dispela wokboi i kam bek long haus, ating bikman bilong en bai i tokim em, 'Yu kam kwiktaim na yu sindaun na kaikai'?

ReferenceBlocks.text: and will not rather tell him, ‘Prepare my supper, clothe yourself properly, and serve me, while I eat and drink. Afterward you shall eat and drink’?

block.text: Nogat. Bikman bai i tokim wokboi olsem, 'Yu redim kaikai bilong mi, na yu pasim laplap na sutim kaikai bilong mi na kisim i kam. Mi kaikai na dring pastaim, orait bihain yu ken kaikai na dring.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: Does he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded? I think not.

block.text: Na ating bikman bai i tok tenkyu long dispela wokboi long taim wokboi i bihainim tok bilong em? Nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even so you also, when you have done all the things that are commanded you, say, ‘We are unworthy servants. We have done our duty.’”

block.text: Olsem na yupela tu, sapos yupela i mekim pinis olgeta samting olsem God i tokim yupela, orait yupela i mas tok, 'Mipela i no gutpela wokboi. Samting mipela i mekim, em i wok tasol bilong mipela.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened as he was on his way to Jerusalem, that he was passing along the borders of Samaria and Galilee.

block.text: Jisas i bihainim rot i go long Jerusalem, na em i wokabaut i go namel long distrik Samaria na Galili.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he entered into a certain village, ten men who were lepers met him, who stood at a distance.

block.text: Em i kamap long wanpela ples, na 10 -pela man i gat sik lepra ol i kam bungim em long rot. Ol i sanap longwe,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They lifted up their voices, saying,

block.text: na ol i singaut strong olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Jesus, Master, have mercy on us!”

block.text: "Jisas, bikman, yu ken sori long mipela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he saw them, he said to them,

block.text: Jisas i lukim ol, na em I tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go and show yourselves to the priests.”

block.text: "Yupela go soim skin bilong yupela long ol pris."

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened that as they went, they were cleansed.

block.text: Orait ol i wokabaut i go, na skin bilong ol i kamap klin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: One of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back. Glorifying God with a loud voice he said:

block.text: Na wanpela man namel long ol em i lukim skin bilong en i gutpela gen, na em i go bek. Em i wok long singaut bikmaus na litimapim nem bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Glory be to God!”
He fell on his face at Jesus’ feet, giving him thanks; and he was a Samaritan.
Jesus answered,

block.text: Em i go kamap long Jisas na em i brukim skru na putim pes i go daun long graun klostu long lek bilong Jisas, na i givim tenkyu long em. Dispela man em i man bilong ol lain Samaria.
Jisas i lukim dispela man, na em i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Weren’t the ten cleansed? But where are the nine?

block.text: "Mi ting 10 -pela man i kamap klin. Tasol ol arapela 9 -pela man ol i stap we?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Were there none found who returned to give glory to God, except this stranger?”

block.text: Ating i no gat man bilong I kam bek na litimapim nem bilong God, a? Dispela man bilong narapela lain, em wanpela tasol?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said to him,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim dispela man olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Get up, and go your way. Your faith has healed you.”

block.text: "Yu kirap na yu go. Bilip bilong yu i bin mekim yu i orait gen."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Pharisees asked him,

block.text: Ol Farisi i askim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When will the Kingdom of God come?”

block.text: "Wanem taim bai kingdom bilong God i kam?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered them,

block.text: Na Jisas i bekim tok bilong ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Kingdom of God doesn’t come with observation;

block.text: "Taim kingdom bilong God i kam, bai i no inap ol samting i kamap olsem mak na ol manmeri i lukim long ai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: neither will they say, ‘Look, here!’ or, ‘Look, there!’ for behold, the Kingdom of God is within you.”

block.text: Na ol bai i no inap i tok, 'Lukim, em i stap hia,' o 'Em i stap long hap.' Harim. Kingdom bilong God em I stap pinis namel long yupela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to the disciples,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol disaipel bilong en olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The days will come, when you will desire to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and you will not see it.

block.text: "Bihain taim bai i kamap, na yupela bai i laikim tumas long lukim wanpela bilong ol de bilong Pikinini Bilong Man. Tasol yupela bai i no lukim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will tell you, ‘Look, he is here!’ or ‘Look, he is there!’ Don’t follow after them.

block.text: Na ol bai i tokim yupela olsem, 'Lukim, em i stap long hap,' o 'Lukim, em i stap hia.' Tasol yupela i no ken i go bihainim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the Son of Man comes, he will be like the flash of lighning that shines from one end of the sky to the other.

block.text: Yupela i save, taim klaut i lait, dispela lait i save sut i go long olgeta hap bilong skai. Na Pikinini Bilong Man bai i mekim olsem tasol long taim em i kamap, na olgeta manmeri bai i lukim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But first, he must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.

block.text: Tasol em i mas karim planti pen pastaim, na ol man bilong dispela taim nau ol i mas givim baksait long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As it happened in the days of Noah, even so will it be also in the days of the Son of Man.

block.text: "Kain pasin ol i bin mekim long taim bilong Noa, ol bai i mekim wankain pasin tasol long taim Pikinini Bilong Man i laik i kam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They ate, they drank, they married, they were given in marriage, until the day that Noah entered into the ship, and the flood came, and destroyed them all.

block.text: Long taim bilong Noa ol i wok long kaikai na dring, na ol man i maritim ol meri, i go inap long taim Noa i go insait long sip. Orait na bikpela tait i bin kamap, na i bagarapim olgeta manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Likewise, even as it happened in the days of Lot: they ate, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they built;

block.text: Ol manmeri i bin mekim wankain pasin long taim bilong Lot tu. Ol i wok long kaikai na dring i stap na ol i baim na salim ol samting na ol i planim ol gaden na ol i wokim ol haus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: but in the day that Lot went out from Sodom, it rained fire and sulfur from the sky, and destroyed them all.

block.text: Tasol Lot i lusim Sodom na i go, na long dispela de yet paia wantaim ston salfa i pundaun long skai olsem ren, na i bagarapim olgeta manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It will be the same way in the day that the Son of Man is revealed.

block.text: Orait wankain pasin tasol bai i kamap long de Pikinini Bilong Man i kamap ples klia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In that day, he who will be on the housetop, and his goods in the house, let him not go down to take them away. Let him who is in the field likewise not turn back.
Remember Lot’s wife!

block.text: "Long dispela de sapos wanpela man i stap antap long haus, na ol samting bilong en i stap insait long haus, orait em i no ken i go daun na kisim ol samting bilong en. Olsem tasol, man i stap long gaden, em i no ken i go bek long haus.
Yupela i mas tingim samting i bin kamap long meri bilong Lot.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever seeks to save his life loses it, but whoever loses his life preserves it.

block.text: Sapos wanpela man i laik holimpas laip bilong em yet, orait laip bilong em bai i lus. Tasol sapos wanpela man i lusim laip bilong en, orait laip bilong en bai i stap gut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you, in that night there will be two people in one bed. The one will be taken, and the other will be left.

block.text: "Mi tokim yupela, long nait Pikinini Bilong Man i kamap, tupela man bai i slip i stap long wanpela bet, na God bai i kisim wanpela, na em bai i lusim narapela i stap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There will be two grinding grain together. One will be taken, and the other will be left.

block.text: There will be two grinding grain together. One will be taken, and the other will be left.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Two men will be in the field; the one shall be taken, and the other left.”

block.text: Two men will be in the field; the one shall be taken, and the other left.”

ReferenceBlocks.text: They, answering, asked him,

block.text: Ol disaipel i harim dispela tok na ol i askim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where, Lord?”

block.text: "Bikpela, dispela ol samting bai i kamap we?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where the dead body is, there will the vultures also be gathered together.”

block.text: "Long ples bodi bilong ol man i dai pinis i slip i stap long en, long dispela ples tasol ol tarangau i save kam bung."

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE 18
He also spoke a parable to them that they must always pray, and not give up,
saying,

block.text: Jisas i givim wanpela tok piksa long ol, bilong lainim ol long ol i mas beten long olgeta taim, na ol i no ken les.
Em I tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “There was a judge in a certain city who didn’t fear God, and didn’t respect man.

block.text: "Long wanpela taun, wanpela jas i stap. Dispela jas i no save pret long God, na em i no save tingting tumas long ol man tu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A widow was in that city, and she often came to him, saying, ‘Defend me from my adversary!’

block.text: Na wanpela meri, man bilong en i dai pinis, em i stap long dispela taun. Oltaim em i save kam long dispela jas na i tokim em, 'Birua bilong mi em i laik bagarapim mi. Yu mas helpim mi long kot.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: He wouldn’t for a while, but afterward he said to himself, ‘It is true that I neither fear God, nor respect man.

block.text: Pastaim dispela jas i no laik helpim em. Tasol bihain em i ting olsem, 'Mi no pret long God, na mi no tingting tumas long ol man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: However, because this widow keeps bothering me, I will defend her, or else she will wear me out by her continual coming.’”

block.text: Tasol dispela meri, man bilong en i dai pinis, oltaim em i save givim hevi long mi. Ating mobeta mi mas helpim em long kot. Nogut em i wok long kam oltaim oltaim, na bihain mi les olgeta long harim toktok bilong en.' "

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord said,

block.text: Na Bikpela i tok moa olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Listen to what the unrighteous judge says.

block.text: "Yupela i harim dispela tok bilong dispela jas nogut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Won’t God avenge his chosen ones, who are crying out to him day and night, and yet he exercises patience with them?

block.text: Orait olsem wanem? Ol manmeri God i bin makim bilong em yet, na ol i wok long krai long em long olgeta de na long olgeta nait, ating God bai i no helpim ol, a? Ating em bai i wet wet na i no helpim ol kwik, a? Nogat tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you that he will avenge them quickly. Nevertheless, when the Son of Man comes, will he find faith on the earth?”

block.text: Mi tokim yupela, em bai i helpim ol kwiktaim. Tasol taim Pikinini Bilong Man i kam, em bai i lukim ol manmeri i stap long graun ol i bilip, o nogat?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He spoke also this parable to certain people who were convinced of their own righteousness, and who despised all others.

block.text: Sampela man i ting ol i stretpela man na ol arapela man i no gutpela olsem ol. Jisas i givim tok piksa olsem long ol dispela kain man,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Two men went up into the temple to pray; one was a Pharisee, and the other was a tax collector.

block.text: "Tupela man i laik mekim prea, na tupela i go long tempel.Narapela em i Farisi. Na narapela em i man bilong kisim takis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Pharisee stood and prayed to himself like this: ‘God, I thank you, that I am not like the rest of men, extortioners, unrighteous, adulterers, or even like this tax collector.

block.text: Dispela Farisi em i sanap na long bel bilong em yet em i prea olsem, 'God, mi no olsem ol arapela man, olsem na mi tenkyu long yu. Ol i save stil na mekim pasin i no stret na trabel long ol maritmeri. Tasol mi nogat. Na mi no olsem dispela man bilong kisim takis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I fast twice a week. I give tithes of all that I get.’

block.text: Long olgeta wik mi save makim tupela de bilong tambu long kaikai. Na olgeta samting mi kisim, mi save tilim long 10 -pela hap na givim wanpela hap long yu.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the tax collector, standing far away, wouldn’t even lift up his eyes to heaven, but beat his breast, saying, ‘God, be merciful to me, a sinner!’

block.text: Tasol man bilong kisim takis em i sanap longwe, na em i no laik lukluk i go antap long heven. Nogat. Em i paitim bros bilong en na i tok, 'God, mi man bilong mekim sin. Yu ken marimari long mi.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you, this man went down to his house justified rather than the other; for everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, but he who humbles himself will be exalted.”

block.text: Na Jisas i tok, "Mi tokim yupela, long taim dispela man bilong kisim takis i go bek long haus bilong en, em tasol i kamap stretpela man long ai bilong God. Tasol dispela arapela man nogat. Long wanem, olgeta man i litimapim nem bilong ol yet, God bai i daunim ol. Na olgeta man i daunim ol yet, God bai i litimapim nem bilong ol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were also bringing their babies to him, that he might touch them. But when the disciples saw it, they said:

block.text: Ol manmeri i bringim ol pikinini i kam long Jisas, na ol i bringim tu ol liklik pikinini i dring susu yet. Ol i laik bai em i putim han long ol. Tasol ol disaipel i lukim, na ol i

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do not bother the teacher!”

block.text: krosim ol dispela manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus summoned them, saying,

block.text: Orait Jisas i singautim ol pikinini i kam klostu long em, na em i tokim ol disaipel olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Allow the little children to come to me, and don’t hinder them, for the Kingdom of God belongs to such as these.

block.text: "Yupela larim ol pikinini i kam long mi. Yupela i no ken pasim ol. Kingdom bilong God em i bilong kain man olsem ol dispela pikinini.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly, I tell you, whoever doesn’t receive the Kingdom of God like a little child, he will in no way enter into it.”

block.text: Mi tok tru long yupela, sapos wanpela man i no kisim kingdom bilong God olsem ol liklik pikinini i save kisim, em i no inap i go insait long en. Nogat tru."

ReferenceBlocks.text: A certain ruler asked him, saying,

block.text: Wanpela hetman i askim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Good Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?”

block.text: "Gutpela tisa, bai mi mekim wanem na mi ken kisim laip i stap gut oltaim oltaim?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus asked him,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you call me good? No one is good, except one--God.

block.text: "Bilong wanem yu kolim mi gutpela? God wanpela tasol em i gutpela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You know the commandments: ‘Don’t commit adultery,’ ‘Don’t murder,’ ‘Don’t steal,’ ‘Don’t give false testimony,’ ‘Honor your father and your mother.’”

block.text: Yu save pinis long ol tok bilong lo, 'Yupela ol marit, yupela i no ken mekim pasin pamuk. Yupela i no ken kilim i dai ol arapela manmeri. Yupela i no ken stil. Yupela i no ken giaman na kotim nating ol arapela manmeri. Yupela i mas aninit long papamama bilong yupela na bihainim tok bilong ol.' "

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Na hetman I tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I have observed all these things from my youth up.”

block.text: "Taim mi pikinini yet na i kam inap long nau, mi save bihainim olgeta dispela lo."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus heard these things, he said to him,

block.text: Jisas i harim dispela tok, na em i tokim hetman olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You still lack one thing. Sell all that you have, and distribute it to the poor. You will have treasure in heaven. Come, follow me.”

block.text: "Yu sot yet long wanpela samting. Yu mas salim olgeta samting bilong yu, na dispela mani yu kisim yu mas tilim i go long ol rabisman. Yu mekim olsem, na bai yu gat ol gutpela samting tru long heven. Na yu kam bihainim mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when he heard these things, he became very sad, for he was very rich.
Jesus, seeing that he became very sad, said,

block.text: Tasol hetman i harim dispela tok, na bel bilong en i hevi tru, long wanem, em i gat planti samting tru.
Jisas i lukim dispela hetman i bel hevi na em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How hard it is for those who have riches to enter into the Kingdom of God!

block.text: "Ol man i gat planti samting, ol bai i hatwok long i go insait long kingdom bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For it is easier for a camel to enter in through a needle’s eye, than for a rich man to enter into the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: Kamel i laik i go insait long hul bilong nil bilong samap, em i no gat hatwok olsem maniman i laik i go insait long kingdom bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who heard it said,

block.text: Ol man i harim dispela tok na ol i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then who can be saved?”

block.text: "Sapos i olsem, orait husat inap kisim laip i stap gut oltaim?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said,

block.text: Na Jisas i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.”

block.text: "Samting man i no inap mekim, em God inap mekim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter said,

block.text: Na Pita i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Look, we have left everything, and followed you.”

block.text: "Harim. Mipela i lusim pinis ples wantaim ol samting bilong mipela, na mipela i bihainim yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, there is no one who has left house, or wife, or brothers, or parents, or children, for the Kingdom of God’s sake,
who will not receive many times more in this time, and in the world to come, eternal life.”

block.text: "Mi tok tru long yupela, olgeta man i bin ting long kingdom bilong God na i lusim haus na meri na brata na papamama na pikinini,

orait taim ol i stap yet long dispela graun God bai i givim ol planti samting tru, i winim ol samting ol i bin i gat bipo. Na long taim i laik kamap bihain, ol bai i kisim laip i stap gut oltaim oltaim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took the twelve aside, and said to them,

block.text: Jisas i kisim ol 12 -pela disaipel na em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and all the things that are written through the prophets concerning the Son of Man will be completed.

block.text: "Harim. Nau yumi go long Jerusalem. Na olgeta tok bipo ol profet i bin raitim long ol samting bai i kamap long Pikinini Bilong Man, nau ol baii kamap tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he will be delivered up to the Gentiles, will be mocked, treated shamefully, and spit on.

block.text: Bai ol i givim em long han bilong ol man bilong arapela lain. Na bai ol i tok bilas long em na mekim nogut long em na spetim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will scourge and kill him. On the third day, he will rise again.”

block.text: Na bai ol i wipim em na kilim em i dai. Tasol long de namba 3 bai em i kirap bek."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They understood none of these things. This saying was hidden from them, and they didn’t understand the things that were said.

block.text: Tasol ol disaipel i no save long as bilong dispela tok. As bilong dispela tok em i hait long ol, na ol i no klia gut long dispela tok em i mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, as he came near Jericho, a certain blind man sat by the road, begging.

block.text: Jisas i kamap klostu long taun Jeriko, na wanpela man aipas em i sindaun arere long rot na i askim ol manmeri long mani samting.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Hearing a multitude going by, he asked:

block.text: Em i harim ol bikpela lain manmeri i wokabaut i kam, na em i askim ol man olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What is going on?”

block.text: "Ol i mekim wanem?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They told him:

block.text: Na ol i tokim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Jesus of Nazareth is passing by.”

block.text: "Jisas bilong Nasaret i wokabaut i kam."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He cried out,

block.text: Orait dispela aipas I singaut olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Jesus, son of David, have mercy on me!”

block.text: "Jisas, yu Pikinini Bilong Devit, yu mas sori long mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who led the way rebuked him and said:

block.text: Ol man i wokabaut i kam paslain ol i krosim em na tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Be quiet!”

block.text: "Yu pasim maus."

ReferenceBlocks.text: but he cried out all the more,

block.text: Tasol em I singaut bikmaus moa yet olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Son of David, have mercy on me!”

block.text: "Yu Pikinini Bilong Devit, yu mas sori long mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Standing still, Jesus commanded him to be brought to him. When he had come near, he asked him,

block.text: Na Jisas i kam sanap na i tokim ol long bringim dispela man i kam long em. Aipas i kam klostu pinis, na Jisas i askim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What do you want me to do?”

block.text: "Yu laik bai mi mekim wanem long yu?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Na em i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, that I may see again.”

block.text: "Bikpela, mi laik lukluk."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Receive your sight. Your faith has healed you.”

block.text: "Ai bilong yu i ken i orait. Bilip bilong yu i bin mekim yu i orait."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately he received his sight and followed him, glorifying God, saying:

block.text: Na wantu tasol ai bilong en i orait na em i lukluk. Na em i bihainim Jisas i go, na em i litimapim nem bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Glory be to God!”
All the people, when they saw it, praised God.

block.text: Na olgeta manmeri i lukim dispela, na ol tu i litimapim nem bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE 19
He entered and was passing through Jericho.

block.text: Orait Jisas i go insait long taun Jeriko, na em i laik bihainim rot i go na lusim taun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There was a man named Zacchaeus. He was a chief tax collector, and he was rich.

block.text: Wanpela man i stap long dispela taun, nem bilong en Sakius. Em i hetman bilong ol man bilong kisim takis, na em i gat planti mani.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was trying to see who Jesus was, and couldn’t because of the crowd, because he was short.

block.text: Em i laik lukim Jisas em i wanem kain man. Tasol bikpela lain manmeri i stap, na Sakius em i sotpela man. Olsem na em i no inap lukim Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He ran on ahead, and climbed up into a sycamore tree to see him, for he was to pass that way.

block.text: Orait em i ran i go pas, na i go antap long wanpela diwai fik, bai em i ken lukim Jisas. Em i save, Jisas bai i wokabaut i kam long dispela rot.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus came to the place, he looked up and saw him, and said to him,

block.text: Orait Jisas i kamap long dispela hap, na em i lukluk i go antap long dispela diwai, na i tokim Sakius olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Zacchaeus, hurry and come down, for today I must stay at your house.”

block.text: "Sakius, yu kam daun hariap. Nau mi mas i stap long haus bilong yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He hurried, came down, and received him joyfully.

block.text: Olsem na em i kam daun hariap, na bel bilong en i amamas tru, na em i kisim Jisas i go long haus bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they saw it, they all murmured, saying,

block.text: Na olgeta man i lukim, ol i tok kros olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He has gone in to lodge with a man who is a sinner.”

block.text: "Em i go i stap long haus bilong wanpela man i save mekim sin."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Zacchaeus stood and said to the Lord,

block.text: Ol i stap long haus na Sakius i sanap, na em i tokim Bikpela olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, Lord, half of my goods I give to the poor. If I have wrongfully exacted anything of anyone, I restore four times as much.”

block.text: "Bikpela, yu harim. Nau bai mi tilim olgeta samting bilong mi long tupela hap na givim wanpela hap long ol rabisman. Na sapos mi bin giamanim wanpela man na stilim wanpela samting bilong en, orait bai mi bekim 4 -pela samting long en."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Today, salvation has come to this house, because he also is a son of Abraham.

block.text: "Nau God i kisim bek pinis ol manmeri bilong dispela haus. Dispela man tu em i pikinini bilong Abraham.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the Son of Man came to seek and to save that which was lost.”

block.text: Pikinini Bilong Man i kam bilong painim ol man i lus na kisim bek ol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they heard these things, he went on and told a parable, because he was near Jerusalem, and they supposed that the Kingdom of God would be revealed immediately.
He said therefore,

block.text: Ol manmeri i harim Jisas i toktok i stap, na em i givim wanpela tok piksa tu long ol, long wanem, em i kamap klostu pinis long Jerusalem, na ol i ting nau tasol kingdom bilong God bai i kamap ples klia.
Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom, and to return.

block.text: "Wanpela bikman i laik i go long wanpela longwe ples, bai ol i ken makim em i kamap king. Na bihain bai em i kam bek long as ples na bosim ol lain bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He called ten servants of his, and gave them ten mina coins, and told them, ‘Conduct business until I come.’

block.text: Taim em i laik i go, em i singautim 10 -pela wokboi bilong en, na em i tilim 20 kina 20 kina long ol. Na em i tokim ol olsem, 'Yupela kisim dispela mani na wok bisnis long en, inap long taim mi kam bek.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: But his citizens hated him, and sent an envoy after him, saying, ‘We don’t want this man to reign over us.’”

block.text: "Tasol ol wanples bilong dispela man ol i bel nogut tru long em. Olsem na taim em i go pinis ol i salim sampela man bilong bringim tok i go long dispela ples bikman i bin i go long en. Ol i mas tok olsem, 'Mipela i no laik bai dispela man i kamap king bilong mipela.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It happened when he had come back again, having received the kingdom, that he commanded these servants, to whom he had given the money, to be called to him, that he might know what they had gained by conducting business.

block.text: Tasol ol i makim em i kamap king, na bihain em i kam bek. Em i kam bek pinis, orait em i tok olsem, 'Singautim ol dispela wokboi bipo mi bin givim mani long ol. Mi laik save hamas winmani olgeta wan wan man i bin kisim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The first came before him, saying, ‘Lord, your mina has made ten more minas.’”

block.text: "Orait wanpela man i kam paslain, na em i tok, 'Bikman, mi wok bisnis long dispela 20 kina bilong yu na mi kisim 200 kina profit long en.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He said to him, ‘Well done, you good servant! Because you were found faithful with very little, you shall have authority over ten cities.’”

block.text: Na king i tokim em olsem, 'Yu gutpela wokboi, na yu bin mekim gutpela wok tru. Yu bin lukautim gut dispela samting i liklik tru, olsem na nau mi givim namba long yu bilong bosim 10 -pela taun.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The second came, saying, ‘Your mina, Lord, has made five minas.’”

block.text: "Orait namba 2 wokboi i kam, na em i tok, 'Bikman, mi wok bisnis long 20 kina bilong yu, na nau mi kisim 100 kina profit.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “So he said to him, ‘And you are to be over five cities.’

block.text: Na king i tokim em, 'Mi putim yu bilong bosim 5 -pela taun.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: Another came, saying, ‘Lord, behold, your mina, which I kept laid away in a handkerchief

block.text: Na narapela wokboi i kam, na em i tok, 'Bikman, 20 kina bilong yu i stap hia. Mi bin pasim insait long wanpela hankisip na mi putim i stap,

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I was afraid of you because you are an exacting man. You take up that which you didn’t lay down, and reap that which you didn’t sow.’”

block.text: long wanem, mi lukim yu, yu hatpela man. Samting ol arapela man i putim i stap, em yu save kisim. Na ol kaikai ol arapela man i planim, em tu yu save kisim. Olsem na mi pret long yu.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He said to him, ‘Out of your own mouth will I judge you, you wicked servant! You knew that I am an exacting man, taking up that which I didn’t lay down, and reaping that which I didn’t sow.

block.text: "Orait king i tokim dispela wokboi olsem, 'Yu wokboi nogut tru! Long tok bilong yu yet bai mi kotim yu. Yu save pinis olsem, mi hatpela man, na mi save kisim ol samting ol arapela man i bin putim i stap na ol kaikai ol arapela man i bin planim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then why didn’t you deposit my money in the bank, and at my coming, I might have earned interest on it?’

block.text: Orait watpo yu no bin putim mani bilong mi long beng, na taim mi kam bek mi inap kisim gen wantaim sampela winmani?'

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to those who stood by, ‘Take the mina away from him, and give it to him who has the ten minas.’”

block.text: Na em i tok olsem long ol man i sanap klostu, 'Yupela kisim dispela 20 kina long em, na givim long dispela man i gat 200 kina.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “They said to him, ‘Lord, he has ten minas!’

block.text: Na ol i tokim em olsem, 'Bikman, em i gat 200 kina pinis.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: He replied to them, ‘I tell you that to everyone who has, will more be given; but from him who doesn’t have, even that which he has will be taken away.

block.text: "Na em i tok, 'Mi tokim yupela, olgeta man i gat sampela samting, bai mi givim sampela moa long ol. Tasol sapos wanpela man i no gat ol samting, orait liklik samting em i holim, em bai mi rausim long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But bring those enemies of mine who didn’t want me to reign over them here, and kill them before me.’”

block.text: Tasol ol dispela birua bilong mi, ol i no laik bai mi stap king bilong ol, yupela kisim ol i kam hia na kilim ol i dai long ai bilong mi.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having said these things, he went on ahead, going up to Jerusalem.

block.text: Jisas i mekim dispela tok piksa pinis, na em i statim gen wokabaut bilong en, na i bihainim rot i go antap long Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, when he drew near to Bethsphage and Bethany, at the mountain that is called Olivet, he sent two of his disciples,
saying,

block.text: Jisas i kamap klostu long ples Betfage na Betani, long maunten ol i kolim Oliv, na em i salim tupela disaipel
na i tokim tupela olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go your way into the village on the other side, in which, as you enter, you will find a colt tied, whereon no man ever yet sat. Untie it, and bring it.

block.text: "Yutupela go long dispela ples i stap long hap. Yutupela go long dispela ples, na bai yutupela i lukim wanpela yangpela donki ol i pasim i stap. I no gat wanpela man i bin sindaun long en bipo. Lusim rop na bringim donki i kam hia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you untying it?’ say to him: ‘The Lord needs it.’”

block.text: Na sapos wanpela man i askim yutupela olsem, 'Bilong wanem yutupela i lusim dispela donki?', orait yutupela i mas bekim tok bilong em olsem, 'Bikpela i gat wok long en.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who were sent went away, and found things just as he had told them.

block.text: Jisas i salim tupela, na tupela i go, na tupela i lukim olgeta samting i stap olsem em i bin tokim tupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they were untying the colt, its owners said to them,

block.text: Tupela i wok long lusim rop bilong dispela donki, na ol papa bilong en ol i askim tupela olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why are you untying the colt?”

block.text: "Bilong wanem yutupela i lusim dispela donki?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Na tupela i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Lord needs it.”

block.text: "Bikpela i gat wok long en

ReferenceBlocks.text: They brought it to Jesus. They threw their cloaks on the colt, and set Jesus on them.

block.text: Orait tupela i bringim donki i kam long Jisas. Na tupela i putim longpela klos bilong tupela antap long donki. Na ol i helpim Jisas long sindaun antap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he went, they spread their cloaks in the way.

block.text: Em i sindaun long donki na i go, na ol manmeri i rausim longpela klos bilong ol na lainim long rot.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he was now getting near, at the descent of the Mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works which they had seen,
saying,

block.text: Em i kam klostu pinis long hap rot i lusim maunten Oliv na i go daun. Na ol bikpela lain disaipel bilong en i stat long amamas. Ol i ting long olgeta mirakel ol i bin lukim, na ol i singaut strong, na ol i litimapim nem bilong God.
Ol i singaut olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Blessed is the King who comes in the name of the Lord! Peace in heaven, and glory in the highest!”

block.text: "God i ken mekim gut long dispela king i kam long nem bilong Bikpela. Litimapim nem bilong God Antap Tru! Em i mekim yumi manmeri i stap bel isi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of the Pharisees from the multitude said to him,

block.text: Na sampela Farisi ol i stap insait long dispela bikpela lain manmeri, ol i tokim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, rebuke your disciples!”

block.text: "Tisa, yu mas krosim ol dispela disaipel bilong yu. Ol i no ken mekim dispela kain tok."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered them,

block.text: Na em i bekim tok olsem

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I tell you that if these were silent, the stones would cry out.”

block.text: "Mi tokim yupela, sapos ol i pasim maus, ol ston yet bai i singaut na litimapim nem bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he drew near, he saw the city and wept over it,
saying,

block.text: Jisas i kamap klostu long Jerusalem, na em i lukim taun, na em i krai long em.
Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you, even you, had known today the things which belong to your peace! But now, they are hidden from your eyes.

block.text: "Jerusalem, nau long dispela de yet mi laik bai yu ken save long ol samting inap long mekim yu i stap gut. Tasol ol dispela samting i stap hait, na yu no inap lukim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the days will come on you, when your enemies will throw up a barricade against you, surround you, hem you in on every side.

block.text: Yu harim. Bihain wanpela taim bai i kamap, na ol birua bilong yu bai i kam hipim graun raunim bikpela banis bilong yu. Na ol bai i banisim yu tru long olgeta hap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will dash you and your children within you to the ground. They will not leave in you one stone on another, because you didn’t know the time of your visitation.”

block.text: Na ol bai i brukim yu na bagarapim yu tru, yu wantaim ol pikinini bilong yu i stap insait long yu. Na ol bai i no larim wanpela ston bilong yu i stap antap long narapela ston, long wanem, yu no bin save long taim God i kam bilong helpim yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He entered into the temple, and began to drive out those who bought and sold in it,
saying to them,

block.text: Orait Jisas i go insait long banis bilong tempel, na em i stat long rausim ol man i mekim wok bisnis i stap long dispela hap.
Em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is written, ‘My house is a house of prayer,’ but you have made it a ‘den of robbers’!”

block.text: "Buk bilong God i gat tok olsem, 'Haus bilong mi bai i stap haus bilong beten.' Tasol yupela i mekim em i kamap olsem ples hait bilong ol stilman."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was teaching daily in the temple, but the chief priests and the scribes and the leading men among the people sought to destroy him.

block.text: Na long olgeta de em i wok long skulim ol manmeri insait long banis bilong tempel. Na ol bikpris na ol saveman bilong lo na ol hetman bilong ol manmeri, ol i stat long painim rot bilong kilim Jisas i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They couldn’t find what they might do, for all the people hung on to every word that he said.

block.text: Tasol olgeta manmeri i strong tumas long harim tok bilong em, olsem na ol hetman i no lukim wanpela rot bilong kilim em i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE 20
It happened on one of those days, as he was teaching the people in the temple and preaching the Good News, that the priests and scribes came to him with the elders.
They asked him,

block.text: Wanpela de Jisas i givim tok long ol manmeri insait long banis bilong tempel, na em i autim gutnius long ol. Na ol bikpris na ol saveman bilong lo wantaim ol hetman ol i kam long em.
Na ol I tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell us: by what authority do you do these things? Or who is giving you this authority?”

block.text: "Yu tokim mipela, yu kisim dispela namba na strong we na yu mekim ol dispela samting? Na husat i givim dispela namba long yu?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered them,

block.text: Na em i bekim tok bilong ol olsem

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I also will ask you one question. Tell me:
the baptism of John, was it from heaven, or from men?”

block.text: "Mi tu mi laik askim yupela long wanpela samting. Yupela tokim mi,
taim Jon I baptaisim ol man, yupela i ting em i samting bilong heven, o em I samting bilong ol man tasol?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They reasoned with themselves, saying,

block.text: Orait ol i toktok namel long ol yet olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘Why didn’t you believe him?’

block.text: "Sapos yumi tok, 'Em i samting bilong heven,' em bai i tok, 'Bilong wanem yupela i no bin bilip long em?'

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if we say, ‘From men,’ all the people will stone us, for they are persuaded that John was a prophet.”

block.text: Na sapos yumi tok, 'Em i samting bilong ol man tasol,' orait olgeta man ol bai i tromoi ston long yumi, long wanem, ol i bilip strong olsem Jon em i profet."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They answered, saying:

block.text: Orait ol i tokim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We don’t know.”

block.text: ol i no save, Jon i bin kisim dispela pasin we na em i baptaisim ol man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.”

block.text: "Mi tu mi no ken tokim yupela long husat i givim mi namba na mi mekim dispela wok."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He began to tell the people this parable.

block.text: Jisas i givim wanpela tok piksa long ol manmeri olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A man planted a vineyard, and rented it out to some farmers, and went into another country for a long time.

block.text: "Wanpela man i wokim gaden wain. Na em i putim dispela gaden wain long han bilong sampela man i laik wok bisnis long en. Na em yet i go i stap longpela taim long wanpela longwe ples.

ReferenceBlocks.text: At the proper season, he sent a servant to the farmers to collect his share of the fruit of the vineyard. But the farmers beat him, and sent him away empty.

block.text: Orait long taim bilong ol diwai wain i karim kaikai, em i salim wanpela wokboi i go long ol man i wok long gaden wain. Em i laik bai ol i givim em sampela kaikai bilong dispela gaden. Tasol ol man i wok long gaden ol i paitim dispela wokboi na ol i rausim em i go nating.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent yet another servant, and they also beat him, and treated him shamefully, and sent him away empty.

block.text: Na papa bilong gaden i salim narapela wokboi i go long ol. Tasol ol i paitim em tu na mekim nogut long em, na ol i rausim em i go nating.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent yet a third, and they also wounded him, and threw him out.

block.text: Orait em i salim namba 3 wokboi i go. Tasol ol i bagarapim em nogut tru na rausim em i go ausait.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The lord of the vineyard said, ‘What shall I do? I will send my beloved son. It may be that seeing him, they will respect him.’”

block.text: Olsem na papa bilong gaden i tok, 'Nau bai mi mekim wanem? Bai mi salim pikinini man bilong mi, em mi laikim tumas. Ating ol bai inap harim tok bilong em.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But when the farmers saw him, they reasoned among themselves, saying, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him, that the inheritance may be ours.’

block.text: Tasol ol man i wok long gaden ol i lukim pikinini bilong en i kam, na ol i toktok namel long ol yet olsem, 'Dispela man hia bai i kisim olgeta samting bilong papa bilong en. Yumi kilim em i dai, na bai yumi yet i holim dispela gaden.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: They threw him out of the vineyard, and killed him. What therefore will the lord of the vineyard do to them?

block.text: Olsem na ol i rausim em i go ausait long gaden, na ol i kilim em i dai. ol dispela man?

ReferenceBlocks.text: He will come and destroy these farmers, and will give the vineyard to others.”

block.text: Em bai i kam na kilim i dai ol dispela man i wok long gaden. Na em bai i givim dispela gaden wain long ol arapela man."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they heard it, they said,

block.text: Ol man i harim dispela tok, na ol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “May it never be!”

block.text: "Em i no ken mekim olsem."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he looked at them, and said,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i lukluk long ol, na em i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then what is this that is written, ‘The stone which the builders rejected, the same was made the chief cornerstone?’

block.text: "Orait bilong wanem ol i raitim dispela tok i stap long buk bilong God, 'Dispela ston ol kamda i ting em i nogut na ol i rausim, nau em i kamap namba wan ston bilong strongim banis bilong haus'?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Everyone who falls on that stone will be broken to pieces, but it will crush whomever it falls on to dust.”

block.text: Olgeta man i pundaun antap long dispela ston, ol bai i bruk olgeta. Na sapos dispela ston i pundaun antap long wanpela man, ston bai i bagarapim em olgeta."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The chief priests and the scribes sought to lay hands on him that very hour, but they feared the people--for they knew he had spoken this parable against them.

block.text: Ol saveman bilong lo na ol bikpris ol i save olsem, Jisas i sutim dispela tok piksa long ol yet. Olsem na long dispela taim tasol ol i kirap na ol i laik holimpas em. Tasol ol i pret long ol manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They watched him, and sent out spies, who pretended to be righteous, that they might trap him in something he said, so as to deliver him up to the power and authority of the governor.
They asked him,

block.text: Orait ol bikpris na ol saveman bilong lo ol i was gut long Jisas. Na ol i salim ol man i kam bilong luk stil long em. Dispela ol man ol i giaman olsem ol i laik tru long harim tok bilong en. Ol i laik trikim em long mekim wanpela tok ol inap kotim em long en, bai ol i ken putim em long han bilong namba wan gavman, na em i ken kotim Jisas.
Ol i askim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, we know that you say and teach what is right, and aren’t partial to anyone, but truly teach the way of God.

block.text: "Tisa, mipela i save, tok bilong yu em i stret, na yu save givim stretpela tok long ol manmeri. Na yu save mekim wankain tok long olgeta man, maski ol i gat nem o ol i no gat nem. Long tok tru tasol yu save skulim ol manmeri long pasin bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Is it lawful for us to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?”

block.text: Orait, yu ting wanem? Yumi ken givim takis long Sisar, o nogat?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he perceived their craftiness, and said to them,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i save pinis long dispela trik ol i mekim. Olsem na em i tokim ol,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you test me?
Show me a denarius. Whose image and inscription are on it?”

block.text: "Soim wanpela mani long mi. Dispela piksa na nem i stap long mani em i bilong husat? "

ReferenceBlocks.text: They answered,

block.text: Na ol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Caesar’s.”

block.text: "Bilong Sisar."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Na em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then give to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”

block.text: "Orait samting bilong Sisar, em yupela i mas givim long Sisar. Na samting bilong God, em yupela i mas givim long God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They weren’t able to trap him in his words before the people. They marveled at his answer, and were silent.

block.text: Olsem na taim em i stap wantaim ol manmeri, ol i no inap long trikim em long mekim wanpela tok ol bai inap long kotim em long en. Ol i kirap nogut long dispela tok em i bekim long ol, na ol i pasim maus i stap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of the Sadducees came to him, those who deny that there is a resurrection. They asked him,

block.text: Sampela man bilong lain Sadyusi ol i kam long Jisas. Ol Sadyusi em ol dispela lain i save tok, ol man i dai pinis, bai ol i no inap kirap bek.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, Moses wrote to us that if a man’s brother dies having a wife, and he is childless, his brother should take the wife, and raise up children for his brother.

block.text: Ol dispela man i tokim Jisas olsem, "Tisa, Moses i bin raitim wanpela tok bilong yumi olsem. Sapos wanpela man i marit, na bihain em i dai na i no gat pikinini, orait brata bilong en i mas kisim meri bilong dispela man na kamapim ol pikinini, bai lain bilong brata bilong en i no ken pinis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There were therefore seven brothers. The first took a wife, and died childless.

block.text: Orait bipo i gat 7 -pela brata i stap. Namba wan em i kisim meri, na em i no gat pikinini na em i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The second took her as wife, and he died childless.

block.text: Orait namba 2 brata i kisim dispela meri,

ReferenceBlocks.text: The third took her, and likewise the seven all left no children, and died.

block.text: na bihain namba 3 brata tu i kisim em. Dispela 7 -pela brata olgeta ol i maritim dispela meri, na ol i no gat pikinini, na ol i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Afterward the woman also died.

block.text: Na bihain dispela meri tu i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife of them will she be? For the seven had her as a wife.”

block.text: Orait bihain, taim ol man i dai pinis ol i kirap bek, dispela meri bai i stap meri bilong husat tru? Yu save, ol 7 -pela man i bin kisim em na em i stap meri bilong ol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Orait Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The children of this age marry, and are given in marriage.

block.text: "Ol man na ol meri bilong dispela taim nau ol i save marit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But those who are considered worthy to attain to that age and the resurrection from the dead, neither marry, nor are given in marriage.

block.text: Tasol ol manmeri God i tok ol inap kirap bek na stap laip wantaim em long taim bihain, ol dispela lain manmeri bai i no inap marit,

ReferenceBlocks.text: For they can’t die any more, for they are like the angels, and are children of God, being children of the resurrection.

block.text: long wanem, ol i no inap i dai moa. Ol i stap olsem ol ensel. God i kirapim ol pinis long matmat, olsem na ol i stap pikinini bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But that the dead are raised, even Moses showed at the bush, when he called the Lord ‘The God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’

block.text: Tasol Moses tu i bin soim yumi olsem ol man i dai pinis, ol i save kirap bek long matmat. Long dispela stori bilong liklik diwai i paia, em i bin tok olsem, Bikpela em i stap God bilong Abraham na bilong Aisak na bilong Jekop.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now he is not the God of the dead, but of the living, for all are alive to him.”

block.text: Dispela i soim yumi olsem God em i no God bilong ol man i dai pinis. Nogat. Em i God bilong ol man i stap laip. Long ai bilong em, olgeta manmeri i stap laip."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of the scribes answered,

block.text: Sampela saveman bilong lo i harim Jisas i mekim dispela tok, na ol i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, you speak well.”

block.text: "Tisa, tok bilong yu em i gutpela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They didn’t dare to ask him any more questions.
He said to them,

block.text: Na ol man i pret long askim Jisas long wanpela samting moa.
Orait Jisas i askim ol manmeri olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do they say that the Christ is David’s son?

block.text: "Olsem wanem na ol i save tok olsem, man God i makim bilong kisim bek ol manmeri bilong en, em i pikinini bilong Devit?

ReferenceBlocks.text: David himself says in the book of Psalms, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, Sit at my right hand,
until I make your enemies the footstool of your feet.’”

block.text: Long Buk Song, Devit yet i bin tok olsem, 'Bikpela i tokim Bikpela bilong mi olsem, "Yu sindaun long han sut bilong mi
inap mi putim ol birua bilong yu i stap aninit long yu.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: “David therefore calls him Lord, so how is he his son?”

block.text: Yupela lukim. Devit yet i kolim dispela man Bikpela bilong en. Orait olsem wanem na dispela man em i pikinini bilong Devit?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the hearing of all the people, he said to his disciples,

block.text: Olgeta manmeri i harim Jisas i autim tok i stap yet, na em i tokim ol disaipel bilong en olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Beware of the scribes, who like to walk in long robes, and love greetings in the marketplaces, the best seats in the synagogues, and the best places at feasts.

block.text: "Yupela lukaut long ol saveman bilong lo. Ol i save laikim tumas long putim longpela klos na wokabaut i go. Ol i laikim tumas long ol manmeri i mas givim gude long ol long ol ples bung. Ol i laikim tumas long kisim ol namba wan ples bilong sindaun long ol haus lotu, na ol i save laik long kisim ol namba wan sia long ol bikpela kaikai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They devour widows’ houses, and for a pretense make long prayers: these will receive greater condemnation.”

block.text: Ol i save trikim ol meri, man bilong ol i dai pinis, na stilim ol haus bilong ol. Na ol i save giaman long mekim ol longpela prea. Long taim bilong kot ol bai i kisim bikpela hevi moa."

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE 21
He looked up, and saw the rich people who were putting their gifts into the treasury.

block.text: Jisas i lukluk i stap, na em i lukim ol maniman i kam putim ol ofa bilong ol i go daun long bokis mani bilong tempel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He saw a certain poor widow casting in two small brass coins.
He said,

block.text: Na em i lukim wanpela rabismeri, man bilong en i dai pinis, em i tromoi tupela liklik mani i go long bokis.
Na Jisas i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Truly I tell you, this poor widow put in more than all of them.

block.text: "Mi tok tru long yupela, dispela rabismeri, man bilong en i dai pinis, em i givim bikpela mani moa, i winim mani olgeta dispela lain manmeri i bin givim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For all these put in gifts for God from their abundance, but she, out of her poverty, put in all that she had to live on.”

block.text: Dispela olgeta manmeri ol i gat planti mani i stap, na ol i tromoi hap tasol i go long bokis. Tasol dispela meri em i sot tru, na em i tromoi olgeta mani em i holim bilong baim kaikai bilong en."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some were talking about the temple, saying:

block.text: Sampela man i lukim tempel na ol i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Look at the precious stones and offerings to God that adorn the temple!”

block.text: "Ol i bin kisim ol gutpela gutpela ston na olkain gutpela presen ol manmeri i bin givim long God na ol i bilasim gut tru dispela haus."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said:

block.text: Na Jisas i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “As for these things which you see, the days will come, in which there will not be left here one stone on another that will not be thrown down.”

block.text: "Mi laik tokim yupela long dispela ol samting nau yupela i lukim. Taim bai i kamap na ol bai i no larim wanpela bilong ol dispela ston i stap antap long narapela ston. Nogat. Ol bai i brukim olgeta na tromoi i go daun."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They asked him,

block.text: Orait na ol man i askim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, when will these things be? What is the sign that these things are about to happen?”

block.text: "Tisa, wanem taim ol dispela samting bai i kamap? Wanem mak bai i kamap pastaim, na mipela I ken save, ol dispela samting klostu i laik kamap?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Na Jisas I tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Watch out that you don’t get led astray, for many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am Christ,’ and, ‘The time is at hand.’ Therefore don’t follow them.

block.text: "Yupela lukaut. Nogut ol i giamanim yupela. Long wanem, planti man bai i kam na kolim nem bilong mi na tok, 'Mi yet mi dispela man.' Na bai ol i tok, 'Taim i kamap klostu pinis nau.' Tasol yupela i no ken i go bihainim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When you hear of wars and rumors of wars, don’t be terrified, for these things must happen first, but the end won’t come immediately.”

block.text: Na bihain, taim yupela i harim tok long ol kantri i mekim bikpela pait, orait yupela i no ken pret na guria. Ol dispela samting i mas kamap pastaim, tasol las de bai i no inap kamap kwiktaim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said to them,

block.text: Na em i tokim ol moa olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.

block.text: "Ol man bilong sampela lain bai i kirapim pait long ol narapela narapela lain. Na ol lain bilong sampela king bai i kirapim pait long ol lain bilong ol narapela narapela king.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There will be great earthquakes, famines, and plagues in various places. There will be terrors and great signs from heaven.

block.text: Ol bikpela bikpela guria bai i kamap long graun. Na long sampela hap ol bai i gat taim bilong bikpela hangre na bikpela sik. Na long skai yupela bai i lukim ol bikpela bikpela mak na ol kain kain samting bilong mekim yupela i pret nogut tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But before all these things, they will lay their hands on you and will persecute you, delivering you up to synagogues and prisons, bringing you before kings and governors for my name’s sake.

block.text: "Tasol taim dispela olgeta samting i no kamap yet, ol bai i holimpas yupela na mekim nogut long yupela. Na ol bai i kotim yupela insait long ol haus lotu na putim yupela long kalabus. Ol bai i ting long daunim nem bilong mi, na ol bai i bringim yupela i go sanap long pes bilong ol king na ol gavman.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This will result in you being witnesses to them.

block.text: Na dispela bai i stap olsem rot bilong yupela i ken autim gutnius long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Settle it therefore in your hearts not to meditate beforehand how to answer.

block.text: Olsem na yupela i no ken tingting planti pastaim long wanem tok yupela bai i bekim long ol,

ReferenceBlocks.text: I will give you a mouth and wisdom which all your adversaries will not be able to withstand or to contradict.

block.text: long wanem, mi yet bai mi putim tok long maus bilong yupela, na bai mi givim gutpela save long yupela. Na ol lain i laik kotim yupela bai i no inap sakim o daunim dispela tok mi givim yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You will be handed over even by parents, brothers, relatives, and friends. They will cause some of you to be put to death.

block.text: "Ol papamama na ol brata na ol wanblut na ol pren, ol tu bai i givim yupela long han bilong ol birua. Na ol bai i kilim i dai sampela bilong yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You will be hated by all men for my name’s sake.

block.text: Na olgeta man bai i bel nogut tru long yupela, long wanem, nem bilong mi em i stap long yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And not a hair of your head will perish.”
“By your endurance you will win your lives.”

block.text: Tasol i no inap wanpela gras long het bilong yupela bai i lus.
Yupela i mas i stap strong, na bai yupela i kisim laip na i stap gut."

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But when you see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, then know that its desolation is at hand.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Taim yupela i lukim ol ami i kam raunim Jerusalem i stap, orait yupela i ken save, taim bilong taun i mas bagarap em i klostu nau.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains. Let those who are in the midst of her depart. Let those who are in the country not enter therein.

block.text: Long dispela taim ol manmeri i stap long distrik Judia ol i mas ranawe i go long ples maunten. Na ol man i stap insait long Jerusalem ol i mas lusim taun na i go long narapela hap. Na ol man i stap ausait long taun, ol i no ken i go insait long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For these are days of vengeance, that all things which are written may be fulfilled.

block.text: Dispela taim em i taim bilong God i bekim rong, olsem na olgeta tok i stap long buk bilong God, em bai i kamap tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Woe to those who are pregnant and to those who nurse infants in those days! For there will be great distress in the land, and wrath to this people.

block.text: Sori tumas long ol meri i gat bel na ol meri i givim susu long ol pikinini long dispela taim. Long wanem, taim bilong bikpela hevi tru bai i kamap long dispela graun, na belhat bilong God bai i pundaun antap long dispela lain manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will fall by the edge of the sword, and will be led captive into all the nations. Jerusalem will be trampled down by the Gentiles, until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.

block.text: Ol birua bai i kam kilim ol i dai. Na ol bai i bringim ol i go i stap kalabus long olgeta kantri bilong graun. Na lek bilong ol man bilong ol arapela lain bai i krungutim Jerusalem, inap long taim God i bin makim bilong ol arapela lain man i bosim Jerusalem, em i pinis."

ReferenceBlocks.text: There will be signs in the sun, moon, and stars; and on the earth anxiety of nations, in perplexity for the roaring of the sea and the waves.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Long dispela taim ol kain kain mak bai i kamap long san na long mun na long ol sta. Na long graun tingting bilong olgeta lain man bai i bagarap tru na ol bai i harim pairap bilong bikpela si i bruk bruk long solwara, na ol bai i tingting planti na pret moa yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Men will faint for fear, and for expectation of the things which are coming on the world: for the powers of the heavens will be shaken.

block.text: Planti manmeri bai i tingting long ol samting i laik kamap long graun, na ol bai i pret tru na ai bilong ol bai i raun, long wanem, ol strongpela samting bilong skai bai i guria.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.

block.text: Na long dispela taim ol manmeri bai i lukim Pikinini Bilong Man i stap long wanpela klaut na i kam wantaim bikpela strong na bikpela lait bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when these things begin to happen, look up, and lift up your heads, because your redemption is near.”

block.text: Taim ol dispela samting i stat long kamap, orait yupela i mas sanap na litimapim het bilong yupela, long wanem, taim bilong God i kisim bek yupela em i kam klostu pinis."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He told them a parable.

block.text: Jisas i givim wanpela tok piksa long ol. Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “See the fig tree, and all the trees.

block.text: "Yupela lukim diwai fik na ol arapela diwai tu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they are already budding, you see it and know by your own selves that the summer is already near.

block.text: Taim yupela i lukim ol nupela lip i kamap long ol, orait yupela i save, taim bilong gutpela san i laik kamap nau.
